story:
Welcome to Dark Fable Miniature's Temple of Set Indiegogo Campaign.  We have put together an exciting selection of miniatures from one of the most iconic adventure settings in fantasy fiction and films - the temple of Set, the snake god of chaos, evil and violence!  Within this sinister temple are said to be fabulous treasures such as the Eye of Set, a priceless jewel, guarded by a giant two-headed serpent, the Amphisbaena, which is ever vigilant and always hungry for the flesh of men . . . It is also a place where unspeakable rituals are performed by the prophet of Set in the flickering light of serpentine braziers.  Who knows what nefarious schemes are being plotted by the prophet of this dark god, who has a host of fanatical priests and merciless temple guards to do his bidding.  Only fools or fearless heroes would dare enter such an evil shrine to challenge the power of the prophet and his minions!

The Temple of Set Indiegogo campaign is the latest expansion of Dark Fable's pseudo-historical Egyptian range.  The concept and design of the miniatures are a mix of history, archaeology, fantasy fiction and Hollywood films.  The core group of miniatures consists of 6 sets: 1. Temple guards I, 2. Cultists I, 3. Amphisbaena and the Eye of Set, 4. Fearless Heroes, 5. Cultists II, 6. Temple guards II.  There are also a number of stretch goal rewards and add-ons which if unlocked, will expand the number of selections available.  David Soderquist also sculpted a FREE reward figure of the prophet of Set for returning contributors!  I was fortunate enough to recruit a highly talented band of sculpting desperadoes which you will be familiar with from my previous Indiegogo campaigns.  They include the most excellent David Soderquist, the talented Tim Prow, the amazing Andy Peiper and the brilliant Brother Vinni.  These high-quality 28mm miniatures are made from a lead-free pewter alloy and have an incredible amount of detail and personality. Whether you are a collector or gamer you are certain to enjoy these figures!  Check out the gallery for more images!

 

 

 

 

 

There are a variety of perks to suit every budget, which range in price from $20 to $310.  Each perk allows you to choose from the 6 core sets of miniatures on offer and/or any of the stretch goal rewards that are unlocked to tailor your order to your own gaming needs.  You may also select as add-ons or perk selections any of the miniatures which were released during our previous Indiegogo campaigns for a flat rate of $12 (unless priced otherwise).

  • Dark Fable Miniatures is very much a no-frills operation and everyone will receive their sets of miniatures in small zip-lock bags (Sorry no blister packs yet).  We understand that many of you use a variety of basing methods, therefore plastic slotta bases will only be provided if requested.

 

  • How much is postage?  Postage world-wide is included as part of the perk, and will be sent standard airmail or regular post.  Please note that standard airmail is NOT insured, tracked or signed for.  IF YOU REQUIRE SIGNED, RECORDED OR SPECIAL DELIVERY THAT WILL BE AT YOUR OWN COST.  Please contact me regarding rates.
  • When can I expect to get my miniatures?  I am hoping to be able to start mailing out orders within a month of the campaign's end - so by the end of April.  The first two master moulds have already been made as well as several production moulds which should allow me to get the miniatures cast relatively quickly.  If there are any delays I will be sure to let you all know exactly what is going on and how long it might take.
  • How do I let you know which packs I have chosen for my perk?  You can either send me a message through the Indiegogo site or an email with your selections.  You can do this right away if you know which sets you want, or you can wait until the end of the campaign and also select from any stretch goals which have been unlocked.
  • If you have any questions about any aspect of the campaign please send me a message and I will do my best to answer you.

 

 

 

1.  Temple Guards I (Spearman, Axe-mace, Khopesh)

2a.  Cultists I (two cultists and the prophet of Set) or

2b.  Cultists I (three cultists - prophet replaced by variant cultist with torch)

3.  The Amphisbaena and Eye of Set jewel on plinth (resin base not included)

 

4.  Fearless Heroes (Northern barbarian, Nubian archer, Female mercenary)

 

5.  Cultists II (Cultist with dagger, Heirophant of Set, Female cultist)
 

6.  Temple Guards II  (two armed with khopesh swords and one spearman)

 

 

 

$3000 – Cultists of Set III (3 variants) as an add-on for $12.  As a bonus reward contributors of level 4 or higher will receive a randomly selected miniature from this set FREE.  UNLOCKED!!

 

$4000 – Female Guards V (hand-axes) as an add-on for $12.  As a bonus reward contributors of level 5 or higher will receive a randomly selected miniature from this set FREE.   UNLOCKED!!

 

$5000 – A pair of Serpentine Braziers as an add-on for $12.  Each brazier comes with separate flame and snake plugs.  As a bonus reward
contributors of level 6 or higher will receive a set of braziers FREE.  UNLOCKED!!
 

$6000 – The Ugallu Temple Guardian statues (Inanimate and animated) as an add-on for $12.  As a bonus reward levels 7 and 8 contributors will receive this set of miniatures FREE.   UNLOCKED!!
 

$7000 – Stheno, Consort of Set (concealed and revealed versions) as an add-on for $12.  As a bonus reward level 8 contributors will receive this set of miniatures FREE.  UNLOCKED!!
 

  Giant Baboon Spiders as an add-on set for $12.  Each set contains 4 spiders - 2 in threatening posture and 2 in nuetral stance.
 

Variant characters as an add-on set for $12.  Each set contains a Cyclopean eunuch guard, chief eunuch with lotus staff and Nubian warrior with khopesh.
 

Cultists of Set IV an add-on set for $12.  Each set contains a female cultist worshipping, female priestess with cobra staff, a cultist torturer
 

 

SETS AVAILABLE AS ADD-ONS FROM PREVIOUS CAMPAIGNS:

Level 3 contributors and higher have the option to add on additional sets of miniatures to their existing perks at $12 a set (Unless priced otherwise).  Miniatures available for add-ons include any stretch goal reward sets unlocked during this campaign and all of the sets listed below.  You may choose add-on sets as perk selections if you wish

  1. Egyptian Queen and Attendants

  2. Court Personalities I (Vizier, Pygmy Priest, Food Taster)

  3. Egyptian Ladies

  4. Egyptian Royal Guards I (Spears)

  5. Egyptian Royal Guards II (Axes)

  6. Egyptian Royal Guards III (Khopesh Swords)

  7. Serving Girls (4 figure set)

  8. Egyptian Lady and Maids

  9. Young Concubines (25mm)

  10. Court Personalities II (Egyptian Noblewoman, Libyan Princess, Concubine)

  11. Court Personalities III (Bodyguard, Physician, Scribe)

  12. Foreign Slave Girls

  13. Egyptian Assassins

  14. Eunuch Harem Guards I

  15. Eunuch Harem Guards II

  16. Eunuch Harem Guards III

  17. Eunuch Harem Guards IV

  18. Eunuch Harem Guard Characters

  19. Egyptian Sorceress and Attendants

  20. Egyptian Entertainers I

  21. Egyptian Entertainers II

  22. Giant Cobras  *Available at $10 a set

  23. Egyptian Princess and Attendants

  24. Sedja Beast  *Available at $10 a piece

  25. Nubian Guards I

  26. Court Attendants

  27. Egyptianised Goblin Minion *$4

  28. Egyptian Vampires
  29. Mummy Kidnapping
  30. Ammut the Devourer *$16
  31. Nubian Guards II (Hyena and Handlers)
  32. Egyptian Female Guards I (Spears)
  33. Egyptian Female Guards II (Bows)
  34. Mummy Pharaoh and Skeletal Attendants
  35. Skeletal Lion *$10
  36. Tomb Robbers I
  37. Tomb Robbers II
  38. Armed Egyptian Girls
  39. Egyptian Concubine Variants
  40. Skeletal Guards I
  41. Egyptian Pharaoh and Followers
  42. Skeletal Guards II
  43. Egyptian Female Guards III (Melee Weapons)
  44. Egyptian Female Guards IV (Officer and hand axes)
  45. Egyptianised Dejah Thoris *$5
  46. Court Personalities IV (Scribe, Overseer and Guard Officer)
  47. Hunting Dogs *$10
  48. Senet Game and Players
  49. Pharaoh's Champion *$5
  50. Queen Nefertiti and Attendants
  51. Exotic Pets I (Leopards and Baboon)
  52. Nile Crocodiles
  53. Nubian King and Followers
  54. Evil Concubines I (Orc, Drow and Cyclopean)
  55. Lamia *$3
  56. Egyptian Kids *$5

These sets can be viewed on the Dark Fable Miniatures Website:

http://www.darkfableminiatures.com/store/c1/Fea...

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

     

    The prophet has sent messengers far and wide to spread the word of Set, but you too can help!

    • Ask friends, gaming associates, minions and anyone you think might be interested in these excellent miniatures from ancient Egypt to get the word out.
    • You can put a link to this campaign on your blog, forum or website.
    • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 $4000 – Female Guards V (hand-axes) as an add-on for $12.  As a bonus reward contributors of level 5 or higher will receive a randomly selected miniature from this set FREE.   UNLOCKED!! 
 $5000 – A pair of Serpentine Braziers as an add-on for $12.  Each brazier comes with separate flame and snake plugs.  As a bonus rewardcontributors of level 6 or higher will receive a set of braziers FREE.  UNLOCKED!!  $6000 – The Ugallu Temple Guardian statues (Inanimate and animated) as an add-on for $12.  As a bonus reward levels 7 and 8 contributors will receive this set of miniatures FREE.   UNLOCKED!!  $7000 – Stheno, Consort of Set (concealed and revealed versions) as an add-on for $12.  As a bonus reward level 8 contributors will receive this set of miniatures FREE.  UNLOCKED!! 
  Giant Baboon Spiders as an add-on set for $12.  Each set contains 4 spiders - 2 in threatening posture and 2 in nuetral stance.  Variant characters as an add-on set for $12.  Each set contains a Cyclopean eunuch guard, chief eunuch with lotus staff and Nubian warrior with khopesh.  Cultists of Set IV an add-on set for $12.  Each set contains a female cultist worshipping, female priestess with cobra staff, a cultist torturer  
 
SETS AVAILABLE AS ADD-ONS FROM PREVIOUS CAMPAIGNS:
Level 3 contributors and higher have the option to add on additional sets of miniatures to their existing perks at $12 a set (Unless priced otherwise).  Miniatures available for add-ons include any stretch goal reward sets unlocked during this campaign and all of the sets listed below.  You may choose add-on sets as perk selections if you wish

story:
RestLess is a single player survival horror game that mixes the classic gameplay of the genre with new ideas and a updated engine.

                                                       

The player will be taken to the terrifying story of a character lost inside his troubled mind and the terrible world created by his own acts.

The game features both first and third person cameras, changing between the two according to key ingame events that'll take the player through the narrative and the inner workings of the main character's mind and the world around him. There are several puzzles that require the player to investigate the environment and the story of the place. Combat is meant to be reasonably difficult and resources are limited, but sufficient, making for a rewarding challenge to complete.

Gameplay will differ depending on the camera being used at the time. While on first person the player will not be able to fight and will have to either run from danger or rely on stealth to escape. On third person there'll be both melee weapons and guns available to engage in combat.

Third person gameplay brings back the feel and style of several classic horror games, such as Resident evil 1, 2, 3 (Capcom), Silent hill (Konami) and Clock tower (Human Entertainment), while first person has a few more recent games as reference, like Outlast (Red Barrels), Amnesia (Frictional Games) and Dreadout (Digital Happiness).

To get a better idea of what the game's supposed to be like, download the demo for a little taste of what's to come. Click to download the free demo.


And don't forget to vote for us on Steam Greenlight. Click to go to the game page.


We are a small team based in Brazil, hoping to jump start this project with your help!

Team members:



We need your help to fund this project and make this game come to fruition! Developing a game requires more than just a good idea and passion for gaming, it takes a lot of hard work, time and money. We can provide most of it, but we need you to make it work!
We're asking for $190,000 as our initial goal, to cover the costs related to the production of the game as well as payment for our staff for the duration of the project.

Every little bit helps, and even if you can't contribute with actual money, you can still help by spreading the word and sharing this project out there!


This project started 9 months ago, as our final project for a Game Development course. Since we started we have learned much more, gained a lot of experience with the tools we used, improving by far our technique, and we get better every day. Many of things that have been done so far would be greatly improved, both visually and performance-wise, if we had a chance to make then again now.


A few things that we can guarantee will be better:

If you like what you've seen so far, you can trust us when we say we can do even better!


Our initial goal will cover the basic costs of production and will allow us to get the game done, but there's no need to think small and stop there at bare minimum!

If the campaign succeeds and we surpass our base goal the project will continue to grow and improve accordingly, expanding both as a game and maybe even more.


So you read everything so far and think it's a great idea and all (we certainly hope you do!), but you might be wondering what's in it for you. Well, fear not fellow game enthusiast, we're not leaving you empty handed after all this!

These are the perks and the rewards you get for helping us out.


We here, the Restless Game team, are passionate about games and our biggest dream is to see the project grow into a complete game, where people can have fun and be terrified.
The game's script is fully developed and we know exactly where we're going with it, and trust us, you will want to know.
The plot is full of twists and remarkable events, and the ending will take you by surprise.
We can guarantee that if it's up to us, you will soon live this unique experience.


Q: What game engine was used ?

A: Unreal Engine 4


Q: How long until the full game comes out ?

A: The time it takes will be relative to the result of this campaign, if we reach our goal we'll do everything for the game to be finished by the first trimester of 2016. 


Q: How long will the full game be ?

A: With the script in mind we believe the full game will have at least 10 hours of gameplay.


Q: I'm out of cash, how can I help ?

A: The campaign has low cost perks for those that can't help with a higher amount of money. You can also help by sharing in social networks which means a lot to us as well.


Q : What are the minimum requirements of the demo ?

A: 

OS: Windows 7, 8

Processor: 2.5 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo or equivalent

Memory: At least 2GB RAM

Hard Drive: At least 3GB of free space

Video Card: 512 MB of Video RAM, DirectX 10 compatible

Input: Keyboard and Mouse


Q : How did I get here ?

A: Unfortunately we don't know either, but since you are here, take a look at our perks list :D

story:
Follow your story through the land of shards by slaying legendary beasts and uncovering your past.

We Plan on releasing Shards The Crystals Of Life for PC,IOS/Android, PS3, Xbox 360, Xbox one.Wii U

                                                         

                                               

           

Shards is a voxel rpg dungeoning exploration game where the player (yourself) goes out searching for all the missing shards around the world venturing over a huge infinite terrain combating bosses beyond your imagination.

                                                          

                                             



Shards story starts with a young adventurer (yourself) wondering what or who created everything deciding to set out on a long journey of discovery slicing and slamming demons and dangerous wildlife to come across murals but what do they mean, the answer is what you decide tell your own story and discover the story of the past. 

                                                             


                                              

 


Currently we are at an extremely fast development stage able to release updates on a near to daily basis.

We want to build a world using your childhood memories from old fashion platforming puzzles to huge epic dungeons for you to explore.

unfortunately we require funding to get shards to a closer and more stable release date from people like you!

Any contributions you make will bring us closer to finishing Shards. 

                                                                  

                                                 


     

     






                                                               

                                               


As you may have guessed we are a none profited team so we are working on this with no profit or income, so all funding will be going to hiring more help, getting better hardware and equipment for development,

and giving you guys the best ways to play the game on all platform possible.

                                                            


                                                                 

                                      

                                           

We are digital shocks a small independent game development team working on our current title of shards, we are formed of currently 4 members who work   most of our days on the development of games.

story:
The Story

Ladybugs, cute – Think again. After an apocalyptic event; and much to the surprise of Darwinians a previously dormant power house of the insect world comes to the fore. As the radiation clouds subside and seismic disturbance diminishes the first organisms to raise their inscrutable heads are Ladybugs. After years of being subjected to humiliating cartoon representations as cute and friendly insects they now have the chance to unlock their dark side. With a motto of “No Mercy – No Exceptions” the Ladybugs set about to make Earth their own.  In the ensuing years the Ladybug juggernaut crushes all before it with a ruthless efficiency that leaves the wasteland devoid of all life but the mighty Ladybug. After a few short years of global dominance these brightly coloured killing machines cast their many eyes towards the heavens with a view to further conquest. Probes were sent to the far reaches of our galaxy and unfortunately for our heroes, with positive results. However these probes have contacted another insectoid civilisation and their many compound eyes have gazed back at earth with desire. The game covers the first forays into earth space by the invaders and the efforts of our cute but cruel defenders.

Take part in the most surreal defence of Earth thus far undertaken. We have a history of successful games behind us but wanted to bring humour and enjoyment on a simple scale back to the gaming environment. So, if you wish to commit wanton mayhem, but with a wry hint of humour, then this is the game for you.  I work 24/7 to transfer my eccentric creations to the digital medium. Along with the rest of the team (2 old but experienced games developers) we have no problem committing the time and energy into this project. We do however require certain bits of software in order to release the game. This is what we are in search of. We have the product we just need help opening the door to the market. This is an on-going project that I will enhance and expand purely for the creative challenge.

Method

Ladybug Killers will be an Original and unique spin on the old classic shoot 'em up games with addictive game play, fun characters and a great storyline but unfortunately, at this moment, it is hard for us to keep up with the financial demands of required software while ensuring we stay true to our aims of making this the most surreal retro game out on the market. We have been working on our game for the last 3 months and are trying to ensure this is done to the very best standards. Release is planned for 1st May and we aim to do this for the i-phone, android and PC platforms.
Technically and creatively we have all our resources in place however we have one area of shortfall.
This is the requirement to raise $4,500 in order to purchase the remaining pieces of software to enable release. We have put many hours of love and labour into our creation so far and do not want to be held back by a mere financial object such as this

Utilisation of Funds

Here is the breakdown of how your contributions will be applied (in order):

Unity Pro License  ($1500)

Android Pro Add-On License for Unity  ($1500)

iOS Pro Add-On License for Unity   ($1500)

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please also spread the word, it would be greatly appreciated.

 

 

 

www.ladybugkillers.com

story:
We are looking for funds for our new educational game for kids: LetterQuest
Letterquest is a game for children who are discovering the Alphabet. In a fun way they learn the shape of letters.
See also the gameplay bellow

Our needs

We are developing this game at this moment and we will continue to do so until its finished. For the moment we work on it in our spare time or when we don't have paid projects.

We need funding

  • So we know we are not crazy and this little game is worth being published
  • So we can focus to get this game published ASAP
  • So we can do good advertising, something more and more important nowadays to stand out in the crowd

We offer

  • €1 Our gratitude, fund 1€ if you think we are not crazy and you would buy this game for € 2.69
  • €1 One promocode for the game @ €1 for the early birds first published (max 40 available)
  • €2 One promocode @ €2 (available after the first update of the published game) (max 40 available)
  • €25 Be the first tho know when the game will be available online. 
  • €50 get a t-shirt with the character of your choice.
  • €1000 you get to chose a new character, we will illustrate for you. You will take part in the choice of theme and the look of the character.
  • €2000 We'll transform a photo of you or who ever you want into a character and integrate it in the game.


How will it be spend

  • The first €500 goes to the guy who did the music and offers it almost for free.
  • The second €2000 go to advertising
  • The next €3000 we put all other projects on hold for a month and focus to get it publised ASAP with 3 characters (Pilote, Clown,?)
  • Every €1000 more we add a another character to the game or spend on advertising

Gameplay

  • Chose a character of your liking (pilote, clown,?)
  • Chose the level of the game
    • recognise uppercase
    • recognose lowercase
    • recognise written letters
    • letter trace, trace the handwritten letters with your favourite character



  • Press play and start to collect all the stars as quick as possible, sometimes they are hidden sometimes in plain sight. When all stars are collected you get a popup that with a multiple choice: Which letter did you recognise?

  • After choosing a letter points get counted. You get points for finishing the level, points for doing it fast, points for recognising the letter. Press play and the fun starts again. A new letter will be shown to discover.

     

Credits:

Music: Tinyloops
Illustration: Renate Frotscher
Programmation: Serge Vieillescaze

Tools:

Illustrator, Photoshop, Gamesalad


Other Ways You Can Help

Just leave a comment if you like this game and spread the word!! (Use the helpful sharing tools just under de video on top!)

We can use advice on the price! Do you think €2.69 is reasonable?

story:
Howdy,

My name is Drake Kazmierczak and I am a passionate game designer and artist looking for funding to finish one of my dream projects Horror Legends. Please feel free to check out my personal LinkedIn profile to look at my professional work experience. Or you can check octobergames.com, my indie game studio website!

First, let me just thank you for checking out my IndieGoGo campaign! I am really excited about what I have to show here, so lets take a look!

Nick Gets It


What is Horror Legends you ask? Well, its a multiplayer video game inspired by cult classic games like Capcom's Resident Evil: Outbreak series and Monolith's Alien Vs. Predator 2. A one part online cooperative survival horror game, and one monster simulator. Where you can terrorize your friends as a monster of your choosing! I wanted to create a video game that invoked the feeling of the playground classic Ghost in the Graveyard. Something that you and your friends could just pick up and play on the fly and have a great spooky horror experience with. There haven't been to many games after Resident Evil out break that expanded on the multiplayer horror genera. Thus the idea for Horror Legends was born. I have been developing this game slowly in our spare time for years now, and I have come a long way since in those two years completing a large portions of the game, but there are certain tasks I just cannot complete on my own. That's where you can help me out!


I need to raise  10,000 dollars so that I can hire key members of my team to work on the game throughout the summer. Which will cost money.  Again we have been working hard on this game for over 2 years and one of our biggest challenges has been finding the time to work on the it. Everyone has bills to pay and things they need to take care of. Paying for their time will alleviate those needs so that they can focus on the game! I want to be clear, none of this money is going to me (Drake). All of it is going to key members of my team! 

The rest of the game's development has been planned out. I already know who I am going to hire and what they will be working on. Which is primarily finishing programming specific game mechanics, and the sound design elements of the game. Which 75% of the funding will go towards, and the remaining 25% will go towards buying software and hardware licencees. These are much needed tools that will help with the game's development! The goal here is to have something ready to play by Halloween 2016 for you Early Access backers! Then we will work towards releasing the game to the general public in January of 2017. 

Oh and we have been greenlit on steam!


Also there are plenty of awesome perks if you help me out. Like access to early builds of the game, T-shirts, and even a printed comic book with concept art in the back. Or if you are so inclined, we are offering a chance to get your name engraved on a tombstone in one of the maps, producer credits, or even a chance to design a playable Legend yourself! With the help of the October crew of course ;) 



Alright, so lets get down to the nitty gritty of what this game is about. Horror Legends is a 3 versus 1 multiplayer survival horror video game. To be released on the steam green light for the PC. (Possible MAC release TBT)

Player will be able to choose 1 of 2 roles in the game. The first being part of a cast of character know as... well the Cast. They are our game's potential victims or heroes. Then there are the monster's and slashers that we call the Legends but I will get to those shortly. 


As part of the Cast you will have to search the environment for objectives or items to defend yourself with. Objectives are determined by the map your are playing on and the Legend that has been selected. Each Legend plays by it’s own set of rules, so in order for you to survive you will need to stay on your guard, you won't know what you are up against until its right in your face! Certain Legends might not be hurt by certain weapons and even if you kill them, some legends might not stay dead. So, make sure you save your ammo for when it counts; sometimes running is the best course of action. Remember you don't have to kill the Legend. If you complete the Map's objective you can escape and win the day. It's up to the Cast members to determine if they want to risk taking the Legend head on. Killing the Legend will win the round.


So lets talk about monsters, or as we call them the Legends. Quite possibly the most alluring part of the game.  As the Legend you are the hunter. Utilize the unknown to your advantage. Cast players wont know what Legend they are up against until they encounter You for the first time. Certain rules of the encounter are determined by which legend you pick. In addition to the fact that each Legend will play completely differently from one another, some Legends can be gunned down while others will keep coming back until certain conditions are met. Some will kill, some will capture, and some will turn their prey into their minions. 

At its core, Horror Legends is a video game that introduces a fun new blend of horrific multiplayer experiences. It gives you the tools to thrill and chill your friends. Each player gets the opportunity to create a variety of suspenseful multiplayer horror experiences. The game requires for you to stay on your toes and use your survival instinct to win. 


We have big plans for Horror Legends; but it would be unrealistic for us to promise everything we want to make at this point in development. So what we are planning on doing is dividing the game's content into Volumes. These Volumes will come at no extra cost to you or to anyone once they have purchased the game! We will however increase the price of the game as we create more content for it. So in a nut shell, the more we make for the game the more it will cost. We want to reward early adopters since it was you kind folk that are taking a chance on us. We feel this is a fair plan to cover the cost of future Volumes so we wont have to divide our player base with excessive DLC walls. We want everyone to have access to all the content (With the exception of our Patron Character William Punkie.) So based on how well Horror Legends does after release we can develop addition Volumes in the future.

So Here is a break down of what you all are getting with Volume One's release of the game. Lets start with the Characters.

Now Lets look at the maps. For now The Farmhouse is the only one that is ready to show off. 

The Farmhouse Map
  • A large open map with a fully fleshed out corn maze and building interiors. The Cast have to find all the items to fix their car before the Legend kills them off.


Home Invasion Map (Under development) Available 10/2016

  • A smaller map where the Cast spawn inside of a nice summer home secluded in the woods. The Legends spawns outside and has to break in to kill the Cast member before the cops arrive. 

Graveyard Map (Under development) Available 01/2017

  •  A classic horror location that takes a lot of inspiration from horror films .

We will add more Characters and Maps in later Volumes depending how well the game does after release. 


Drake Kazmierczak: Lead Designer and 3D Artist.

Drake has over 6 years of experience working as a full time 3d artist on a variety of projects. Ranging from 3d visualizations for a market research company, to currently designing mobile games for the United States Military. In his spare time he leads the indie developer October Games on projects like Puppet Master: The Game, live interactive haunting events, and writing and illustrating the Horror Legends Comic book.  He is dedicated to completing his dream project Horror Legends!


James Tragresser: 3D Artist.

The creator of the October Game's name and a practicing 3d artist for the past 9 years.  James' professional career as an artist has lead him to work on many military visualization projects. He also work on many of the character for Puppet Master: Game, like Torch and Tunneler!


Roberto Aguilar: 3D and 2D Designer.

Roberto has been working as a professional designer since 2009, creating 3d Environments and Assets for Virtual Market Research as well as Environments for Client Visualizations. He is currently creating UI Design for Apps in the Game Mobile Industry. A proud member of the October Games team since 2012 Roberto is ready to help make Horror Legends come to life!


Daniel Picirillo: Professional Haunter, Audio Designer, Game Designer.

Dan has professional experience as a suited monster in a handful of haunted attractions. One being in 2014's west cost Great Horror Camp Out, and he also portrayed our character Punkie in our event Slasher Tag, which we hosted at Seattle Crypticon in 2015. His haunter knowledge has been extremely valuable to the game's core design and he also played a big part in the game's original inception!


Brock Purdin: Lead Programmer.

Brock's years of experience is mostly as a hobbyist, but don't let that fool you. He has a true talent developing for multiplayer games. He is always looking for a new ways challenge his skills has a programmer. He has done a wide variety personal projects ranging from creating an MMO infrastructure to building net-code for a fast past shooter! 


Kenneth R. Webster (Owner of Sinful Audio): Lead Audio Designer.

Ken Webster has enjoyed more than 20 years working as a composer and sound recordist in the Pacific NW.  Over the last 7 years, Ken has focused on Sound Design and Foley for Film and Commercials in addition to music scoring. The passion for sound design stems from his love of all things audio related, and making something new and never heard from the seemingly ordinary of every day sound.





We at Sinful Audio are excited to be providing music and sound design for Horror Legends.  Our goal is to help immerse you completely into the Horror Legends world and your character.  By taking a cinematic approach to the video game, we will provide you with an environment you’ll truly feel a part of.  We want you to feel that cold chill up and down your spine as you hear the cries of your friends, and…. what’s that?  Is that something behind you?

Imagine if you will, watching one of your favorite movies while muting the sound throughout the film.  Albeit the visuals may be stunning, the experience in and of itself would be less than satisfying.  No dialog, no sound effects, no music or atmosphere to carry the plot along.  How about your video games?  What would you think it would be like trying a FPS without audio references to guide you through the game, give you direction, or single out an opponent?  

The lack of audio, on its own, doesn’t necessarily drive the concept that audio is important to film or video games, but it gives us a great jumping off point.  I think we can all agree that without sound, one of the 5 senses that allow us to immerse ourselves both in our reality and fantasy worlds, we would be cognizant of something missing; our immersion that much duller and lacking.

Sign: Kenneth Webster.

Check out the Sinful Audio website for a more detailed look!





  • William Punkie  exclusive playable Legend character.

 Available if you pre-order the game. This is the Human version of Punkie featured in the comic book. William Punkie (Punkie's true name) will play like a traditional Slasher with the Scythe as his starting weapon. He will be exclusive to IndieGoGo backers for no additional cost and to October Game's patrons as our only piece of DLC after launch. (Details on this DLC are to be determined)


  • Physical Perks: 
Here is a small preview of what the physical Perks look like. T-shirts come in all sizes by the way. :)





Inside the comic preview





  • Punkie's Revenge


This one is for you Haunter enthusiast out there, get a one of a kind physical prop that we used during our "Slasher Tag" haunts last year. Punkie's favorite weapon, the one handed Broken Scythe! Created by buddy over at TK Studious Kevin Bacon, who made the original Punkie Costume. (Costume is not part of the Perk, just the scythe)


  • Producer Credit
Become part of the team a receive a October Games T-Shirt. Along with a the producer credit and every perk before it!

Your name on a game asset that can be seen in the Graveyard map! 

(Note: this is not final Tombstone Graphic)

Hey, Drake here,
One of the challenges that we are preparing for is managing a budget for the first time. Since 2012 we at October Games have been developing our projects based on our passion alone. Everything from Puppet Master: The Game, to the live events, the comic, and of course this game have all been created with no funding at all. Having a budget will come with some challenges, but that's to be expected. We are doing what we can to minimize any problems that may come up. The key thing to remember is that this will allow our key players to put in the time they need to get the job done. We have gotten this far with nothing, so think of what we can do with a little help from all you kind folk! 
I would have to say the biggest risk is on my end. I have already put so much of my own time, money, and energy into this project over the past few years, that quitting and going dark is unthinkable to me.  I believe in this project so much that I have kept developing it despite the fact that our Kickstarter from last year didn't reach its goal. This is truly one of my dream projects. I am telling you this to ensure you as potential backers that I will pull through and I will keep my word as I always have. This IndieGoGo campaign, if successful, will help minimize the risk of development. Also, I want you to know that I wont be taking any of the money for me personally. All of the money will be going to key October Games team members so that they can afford to spend the time to work on the game. 


Why was your Kickstarter from last year for 130,000 dollars and this one only 10,000 dollars?
Answer: Well, the Idea was to have everyone on the team work full time for a year straight. A goal we didn't reach. Now things are much different. Since then I have been developing the game non stop in my spare time. There are only a few major pieces to complete before our October early access deadline. Doing this has decreased the cost of development drastically.

Will this be coming to Xbox One or PS4?
Answer: No plans at this point. Right now we are just focusing on a PC and a possible MAC release. We will have to wait and see where things go after we finish Volume One.

I see you selected Flexible Funding. What happens if you don't reach your goal?
Answer: Like I mentioned in the Risks and Challenges section. This is a passion project of mine. We have been developing this game with no funding for 2 years, and I have no plans of cancelling the game. At this point any amount of money is going to expedite our development for sure. So the more money we can raise the more time we have to develop the game. If  we don't make our goal we will still push forward but our release dates might change depending on how much money we can raise.

How are you releasing the Early Access builds of the game? It's not through Steam Early Access is it?
Answer: Nope, we will send you an email with a download link! So only you backers will be able to play the early versions of the game! 

Will this support Controllers?
Answer: Yes! It will support both mouse/ keyboard and an Xbox 360 controller! 
Why is it 3 versus 1 and not more like 8 versus 1!?
Answer: I get this a lot. Well through prototyping we found that anything above 4 wasn't as scary. You felt safe surrounded by the other players. Three seemed to be the magic number.  This isn't to say we wont have a new game mode in the future that can suppot more players. We will have to wait and see.


Thanks again for checking out our indie go go campaign! If you want to help but can't afford to that's okay!  You can still support us by sharing this campaign on your social media of choice!

-Drake

story:
needs your help to get produced.

    

The creative and talented team at EQUUS 101 have spent the last nearly four years creating this REVOLUTIONARY new solo or social game.  Now it's ready to GO LIVE.  With your help.

NEVER has a game existed like it before.  No wonder it's called an Adventure game with such global talent in it.  Artists, Experts and Celebrities galore - hilarious, fun and a great adventure is only a lid pop away.  GAME on!

AND it even has it's own song - created by non-other than the 2013 International Songwriter of the Year winner, Tony King!  ROCK on!

It's got romance, mystery , mayhem and magnificent images.

Play it outside or inside - anywhere, anytime is HorsePLAY time.

 

It took a year longer than planned because "our illustrator is a perfectionist and a pain in the butt!"  (Do you believe this is what Lesley made me write for the introduction!)

It will sell for $59.95 RRP.  The recommended pricing because of its quality and design brilliance was $75-$82.  But we want it to be a game enjoyed by many, so we selected a lower price point.

Have a look at some of the Adventure cards.  If you get the card right you keep it.  The player with the most points wins.  Chance, luck, the roll of the dice and a good guess all play parts in who gets to be the Champion at the end of game time.

ADVENTURE cards = 1 point

GALLERY cards = 10 points

CROSSROADS cards = 5 points

 

Hmm - guess which illustrator has a mischievous sense of humour!

(Hint:  Her first name is Lesley)

CROSSROADS cards = 5 points (they're purple, in the headings)

 

 BUSKING cards = 1 point + some bonuses! 

 

REVOLUTIONARY in what way?

  • It’s DESIGN and QUALITY. 

  • Quality of production AND content quality.                     

  • NEVER EVER before has global talent partnered together in a game product like this before.  (Mega Artists, Experts, Celebrities and Bucket List worthy locations have a great time here).  ***This is BIG – a WORLD first………..is that singing from the roof tops I hear?

  • If we listed all the AWESOME talent harnessed together here the list would run for pages.  But up the top in the ARTISTS list would include greats such as Tim Flach, Robert Vavra, Bill Ray, Lesley Bruce, Bob Langrish, Christiane Slawik, Picasso, Sir Alfred Munnings, Tony King and Nina Vox, Rebecca Campbell, Katharine Hepburn, Katy Driver, Fiona Lake, Nicole Emmanuel, Paul Boromeo, Shelley Watson, Steve Panozzo, Ross Pulsford, Dale Durfee, Carol Heuchan, Charlie Chaplin, Alfred Miller, Stubbs, Landeer, Renoir, Rubens, Sorolla, James Seymour, Francis Reiss, Jeff Carter, Bruce Howard, Harold Cazneaux, Franz Marc, Darren Pateman, Darren Stones, Sidney Nolan, Monet, Arthur Boyd, Steve Bloom and William Shakespeare....to name but a few.
  • In the EXPERTS list you'd find inspiring people such as Nigel Carren, Albert Einstein, The Wright Brothers, Dr Robert Miller, John Whitaker,Sue-Ellen Lovett, Merv Hughes, Javed Miandad, Sir Donald Bradman, Lorenzo, Alycia Burton, Brenton Matthews, Allison Crompton, Dr Andrew McLean, Adam Sutton, the Crack Up Sisters, Pat Parelli, Monty Roberts, Muhammad Ali, Tim O'Brien, Tschiffely, Yannick Bru, Mark Todd, Michelle Dennis, Guy McLean, Boyd Martin, Stuart Tinney, Anky van Grunsven, Charlotte Allison-Bruce, Charlie Brister, Paul Cave, Paul Newman and Jackie Kennedy to name but a few and in no particular order.
  • It is like a board game but WITHOUT a board.  This changes the dynamic big time because now it’s much more portable and screams “take me with you." 
  •  SERIOUS hours of research and strategic design has gone into this product.  HorsePLAY has been designed to cater for the various ways people like to be entertained.  Ensuring there is something in it for everyone.
  • The GAME BOX is not cardboard which goes furry when added to water.  Or tin which looks like it’s having a serious fashion crisis after a few unflattering dints falling from a bench or two.  It’s……………..smooth, elegant, robust and plastic.
  • And…….and…….and..(look at the video and gallery images to get a peek at the impressive qualities contained in this elegant blue adventure box).
  • So good is this game you DON’T EVEN HAVE TO PLAY IT!  The feast for your eyes of engaging images will have you reach for the tissues in one hand and helping hold back the belly laughs with the other. 

 

 

WHY HorsePLAY?

Isn’t it a great name! 

The name is actually a play on words about what horses do naturally every day.  Having some horse play is really all about healthy frivolous fun on their own (solo), or with a herd buddy (social).  It’s what horses do every day.  They’ve been doing it for 55 million years.  And NOW - so can we!

Each of the PLAY graphics helps you see what fun stuff you get to do when hav'n some HorsePLAY:

P = Perform (mime, act out…)

L = Let out your artistic talents (draw, write)

A = Around the world via the images in HorsePLAY you can go. 

        No passport required!

Y = YES, definitely behave like no ones watching!

Now so can we!                                 

 

Is it primarily a game for Horsy People?

Ha ha.  ‘Horsy’ people don’t have the monopoly on frivolous fun and hors’n around.  It’s exciting fun for EVERYone.

Watch the other videos to get an idea of who would enjoy some HorsePLAY.

There’s John Hurt’s brilliant voice talking up this REVOLUTIONARY new game.

Even the not to be messed with voice of Jason Statham shares why he’s enjoyed this Adventure ride so much.

And WHO knew the Doctor had already discovered HorsePLAY - the ride of your life game EVEN before it went up on this campaign.  Ah, but he can see the future can’t he!

None of the RAH, YIPPEE, its BRILLIANT stuff they say surprises us.

HorsePLAY has been strategically designed so no matter how smart you are or how clever you aren’t everyone has the chance to be the Champion (the winner).  Chance, luck of the dice, luck of a good guess and the ability to behave like no one’s watching all come into who wins.

    

For the young, older, in-between or in-DENIAL, HorsePLAY’s got something in it for everyone.

 

 EQUUS 101 is based in Sydney, Australia.  It specializes in making entertaining products.  Think lasting learning that entertains your brain.  In this case it’s a game + a book.

The ‘101’ is because we don’t like to aim for 100%.  And no matter which way you write it, back to front or front to back, 101 is always 101. We’re solid in what we do and the Team we do it with.

Our Team is spread far and wide.  Some are in France, others America and
England, one is currently holidaying in Brazil. Most are in Australia.  Some are
full time, others part time, others who have separate careers and no time still contribute enormously as part of what we call our ‘Executive Team'.  From around the world their talents flow – right into the HorsePLAY game box where you can soon go.

  To blow our own trumpet on how awesome Team EQUUS is guess who was recently awarded the International Songwriter of the Year for Best Lyrics?  Judges included Tom Waits and Bernie Taupin.  Drum roll…our very own Tony King.  And which great mum just had both daughters kick of their bike’s training wheels in the same week!  Our very own Finola.  And which Team member had the close encounter with the ground to help remind them we don’t bounce so well when we’re 60 something.  That would be Lesley, our artistic guru.

HAVE A LISTEN TO THIS AWESOME SONG - it's in the Gallery.

Jacqueline our Team leader has the illustrious title of being the only Australian to have ever been granted a license by Discovery Communications Inc. (USA), think Discovery Channel, to put their brand on a previous game product.

Discovery QUEST was a more traditional board game design – albeit with some extra special quirks and fun bits.  It sold successfully around the world and is
currently being relicensed.  At the premium end of the game market Discovery QUEST sold for $85 AUD.

The EQUUS Team are not new kids on the block in this making a game space.  Rest assured all the previous lessons learned (the good, the bad and the ugly) have gone into making HorsePLAY the REVOLUTIONARY game that it is.

 

Even a REVOLUTIONARY game like HorsePLAY needs to plan ahead to keep its customers full ‘entertainment’ range satisfied. 

So here’s our plan of EVOLUTION:

  1. First comes HorsePLAY the game in its sexy robust “take me with you” game box. 
  2. Then the Monty the Monster fantasy fiction book (Trilogy) which brings the characters illustrated on the game cards to life.  In all the glory of their extremely colorful rainbow. 
  3. Next is HorsePLAY video game.
  4. Then voila……..the HorsePLAY App.  No excuses now for not setting your real horseplay spirit free and discovering how much horsepower you really have.

 

                               

OUR GOAL - $47,500   (5,000 units, Nov 2014 – Game Launch)

This will enable a small production run of 5,000 units to be made. 
Such a small volume WILL NOT ALLOW supply to outside Australia EXCEPT to
those lucky international people who pre-order via this IndieGoGo campaign.

It doesn’t provide any extra to go into the marketing kitty for launch events (November 2014) and the additional staffing costs.  These have to be provided for out of pre-orders from retail stores.  (Which we’ve got great interest from – but more funding means more staff.  More staff mean more sales, better economies of scale in production since we can then order more units.)

Monty Book progesses but only as a distant relative to the full focus of GAME on!  We are mindful of the ideal timing in release of each of the books in the Monty the Monster trilogy.  Ideally each book is ready for release within a month of each other.  Longer delays between releases increases the marketing costs signifcantly.   At this goal no additional focus can be given to Book 2 and 3 beyond the work already completed.


1stSTRETCH GOAL - $92,450 (15,000 units, Nov 2014 – Game Launch)

This is where the game starts to walk faster.

  • We can afford to keep our Marketing Manager Mikaela full time from now until well into next year. 
  • We can afford to engage a Fulfilment company to do the distribution and not have to spend hours providing such a service which is not EQUUS’s core business.
  • We can supply our overseas network of Agents and retailers with game samples.  And proceed to take orders accordingly.

Monty Book still progressing, albeit slowly.  Focus still - GAME on!  This goal does not provide the financial support for greater progress on Book 2 and 3.


2nd STRETCH GOAL - $135,000 (Begin supply to USA, UK, NZ, Asia Pacific)

This is where the game is jogging along nicely.

We can afford the additional staff member and associated costs that go with being able to supply more product to more retailers/agents and customers. 

and

Monty the Monster Book 1 gets enough attention to finish it and start production.  The sooner Book 1 is finished the sooner Book 2 get finished…..and so on.  (3 books @ $19.95 is current suggestion for market positioning).


3rd  - THE BIG KAHUNA STRETCH GOAL - $182,581  RECORD BREAKER

Not only does this break the Australian IndieGoGo Campaign record set last year but it would also allow for:

  • the video game version of HorsePLAY game to be finished).
  • the hilarious HorsePLAY app to get finished.
  • increased staff, increased sales and a quicker grasp on HorsePLAY taking its position as a game like no other.  It’s already being spoken of as a “Must Have” game.  Randomly we continue to get the comment from people in the test plays “it’s the kind of game that’s so much fun, yet so easy to play, you wonder what we did without it?”

 

We have loads of great rewards for our supporters.  We make sure we get them to you with all the TLC we can muster – even including a GOLD STAR!

ALL of these rewards are unique to this HorsePLAY GO LIVE IndieGoGo
campaign.

These rewards will not be offered like this again.

Each Limited Edition certificate has a number on it.  From 1 to how ever many backers we get.  No one else can ever get that certificate let alone get it with that number on it.

Imagine if you’re the 101st to back that Perk?  We’ll have to do something extra special for those people.

Now by ‘never be offered like this again’ please believe that to be true.

Market research specialists positioned HorsePLAY in the $80-$95 RRP bracket.  We decided we’d rather have more people enjoy it than that price allows.  Hence we priced it at nearly HALF the recommended retail price for such quality and design.

To now be offering HorsePLAY at a special campaign price of $35 which is 40% less (than the $59.95 RRP) isn’t something we expect to see happen EVER again.

So congrats on finding your way here.

Enjoy it.  This is a special occassion.

Once the campaign starts, we will begin the Limited Edition Certificate perks right away. We’ll do an update each week PLUS special updates when particular milestones have been reached.  Like the 101st person to pledge – what a brilliant number that will be on their Certificate.

Imagine if J K Rowling had done such numbered certificates if she’d looked to self-publish Harry Potter.  What would those certificates be worth now!

Extra cool will be 1001, 10001, and 100,001 certificates.

Game ON!  Let’s aim to have your certificates evolve to be a highly prized auction item at Christies.

 

Contributing is wonderful (thank you) but if you can’t do that right now we appreciate that doesn’t mean you can’t help. 

Here’s some things we’d looooove people to help with:

  • Pass the word around, help make some noise about the Billy Connolly talking horse.  Let people know about this AWESOME game that’s so brilliant you don’t even have to play!
     
  • Use the share tools to help spread the word.
    •  
  • Contact your local game store – ask them have they got their order in yet?
     
  • Watch the other videos – John Hurt’s brilliant voice talking up HorsePLAY. And the ever enforcing voice of the man not to be messed with Jason Statham.  And WHO knew the Doctor had already discovered HorsePLAY -the ride of your life game before it even went up on this campaign.  But he can see the future can’t he!

 

  • PLEASE like our campaign video and facebook page.  That helps a lot.

 

THANKS for your support. 

We really appreciate it.

story:
Update: We reached our primary goal, and the site is saved for at least another year! See the What We Need Section and Perks Section for updates!

TLDR Summary:

Hosting all of those mods for Torchlight 1 and 2 and containing the huge database of users costs a significant amount of money every month. Lately the money from advertisements and contributors hasn't been enough, to the point that we'll run out of funding in two months at this rate. To determine whether or not the website survives or will be shut down, I'm trying to get enough funding to hold out for a year.

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of hosting the website on a capable server and dishing out the bandwidth for all of those mods is currently about 70 dollars a month. Over the past few months traffic has decreased to the point that the money from advertising and people contributing just isn't enough, and right now I estimate about two months worth of funds before there isn't enough money left to pay the bills.

Here are the goals and what they unlock:

  • 700 Dollars - This is my estimate of what I would need to pay for a year of server hosting with the supplemental advertising money on the side cover the remainder of the costs. This is the base goal. (including bank, Paypal, and IndieGogo transaction fees) 
  • 924 Dollars - This would cover an entire year's worth of server hosting (including bank, Paypal, and IndieGogo transaction fees). Reaching this goal would mean no Advertisements on the site for registered members for an entire year. An additional round of fundraising would occur at the end of that year.
  • 1200 Dollars - All server fees covered, as well as most software renewals/upgrades and covering the cost of using Dropbox to keep manual backups on hand. Reaching this goal would mean a significant site upgrade (visual and functional) within the next year. Updated: If we reach this goal the entire site will be ad-free for everyone for a year AND everyone who contributes above 5 dollars will receive a lifetime of ad-free RGF, even if ads come back for other people!
If we don't reach the initial goal, then the money will still go to paying server costs, but when it runs out if there isn't enough money from advertising or contributions coming in then the site will shut down at that time. Hopefully even if we don't reach the goal then the Mac version of Torchlight 2 will come out, or Runic will have another game announced, or even Grim Dawn (for which I host Grim Dawn Mods, another fansite on the same server sharing the costs) could reach the point of mod support and could bring in revenue. In the end, the goal is to have enough money to make it to a point where the site can stay afloat again. We reached the goal, so this part isn't important anymore! :D

Perks!

There are a few perks available, some which can be tracked via the sidebar. Currently these include:

Update: If we reach the 1200 goal ANYONE who contributes 5 dollars or more to the campaign will be ad-free on RGF for the life of the site!

  • 5 Dollars - As with the previous contribution system if you pay 5 dollars you will receive one month without advertisements whenever you are logged in to your account. If we don't reach our goal and the site does go down this will give you plenty of time to download and stockpile as many mods as you want without advertisements getting in your way.
  • 70 Dollars - Any person who covers an entire month's server fees will receive an Advertisement-free experience for this site and any others that I host for all time. If the site still gets shut down, I will personally supply a dropbox link to the donator to a folder that contains every mod file that was contained on the site.
  • Highest Bidders! - The two people who contribute the most to the campaign will receive EXTREMELY rare mini statues of Torchlight 2's Dark Alchemist, courtesy of the people at Runic Games. At least one of the donations needs to be via the 25 Dollar Perk, so as to include your address, but the final result will be cumulative for all donations. The page will be updated with the latest Top Two amounts regularly, so check back to see if you are in the running!

    The Impact

    When Torchlight 1 was released there were three main mod sites for it, but as time passed RGF (Runic Games Fansite) became the only one remaining, and thus became the sole concentrated source of Torchlight mods. The mods helped the site stay paid for and everyone stayed happy, and we built a nice community and a cool Mod Manager.

    When Torchlight 2 came out Steam became an alternate source of mods for people playing the Steam version of the game, which meant we lost the monopoly on mods and thus a lot of the traffic. However, there are still many people who own the non-Steam version of Torchlight 2, and still play Torchlight 1, and thus RGF is their only source for mods. If the site goes down it will kill a huge part of the game for many people.

    I'm not trying to make Steam out to be the bad guy here, as I use Steam for most of my games these days, but the truth is with the implementation of traditionally community-supported functionality (such as mod hosting and installation) into Steam it kills off community-based sites where modders can congregate, share information, help each other, and collaborate on projects. In other words, the convenience of the big name companies taking over modding undercuts the number and quality of mods you get in the end. I'm trying to keep this little portion of the web that so many people have contributed to alive.

      Risks & Challenges

      You don't know me. I am just a guy with a day job who has been running a fansite as a hobby since 2008. When the site started it was before the economy got really bad, advertisers were paying better and forums were still a bigger part of the web than they are now. I've tried to keep these sites paid for over the years without a bunch of highly intrusive advertisements, mandatory registrations, or any of the other now common signs of a monetized website. Maybe that is why I'm in this mess now.

      There is a risk giving money to any person or website that isn't a big name, well known company, but in a sense that is why we're in this mess now. Help the underdog.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you don't have the means to help monetarily, there are still a couple things you can do. Spread the word of the campaign to your friends and family. If you have mods you've hosted on steam, try adding them to RGF as well. It's a quick registration and upload away, and every mod we get will help the non-Steam users of Torchlight 2 as well.

        Additionally, if you have some artistic skills and would like to help make some perks or stretch goals, contact me at webbstre@runicgamesfansite.com and we'll try to work something out.

        Please do not contact me offering to host the site on your server. I am not willing to trust the security of the people visiting the site to someone I don't know, and that is essentially what would happen if the site was in someone else's hands.

        The Final Note:

        A year ago I became a father. A lot of my waking time has gone into helping out at home, but that hasn't stopped me from monitoring the site, trying to help out the odd person who comes by and asks a question, or even moving the site onto a cheaper (and less annoying) webhost. I've been trying, but the main reason I've been able to keep going with the site is because between the people contributing to the monthly costs and the supplemental advertising money the site has financially taken care of itself. I want that to continue, but if it turns out the time of the lowly individual fansite is over, then I'll let it go and spend some more time with my family and my other personal projects.

        What happens next is up to you.
story_txt:
Update: We reached our primary goal, and the site is saved for at least another year! See the What We Need Section and Perks Section for updates!
TLDR Summary: Hosting all of those mods for Torchlight 1 and 2 and containing the huge database of users costs a significant amount of money every month. Lately the money from advertisements and contributors hasn't been enough, to the point that we'll run out of funding in two months at this rate. To determine whether or not the website survives or will be shut down, I'm trying to get enough funding to hold out for a year.   What We Need & What You Get The cost of hosting the website on a capable server and dishing out the bandwidth for all of those mods is currently about 70 dollars a month. Over the past few months traffic has decreased to the point that the money from advertising and people contributing just isn't enough, and right now I estimate about two months worth of funds before there isn't enough money left to pay the bills.
Here are the goals and what they unlock:


700 Dollars - This is my estimate of what I would need to pay for a year of server hosting with the supplemental advertising money on the side cover the remainder of the costs. This is the base goal. (including bank, Paypal, and IndieGogo transaction fees) 
924 Dollars - This would cover an entire year's worth of server hosting (including bank, Paypal, and IndieGogo transaction fees). Reaching this goal would mean no Advertisements on the site for registered members for an entire year. An additional round of fundraising would occur at the end of that year.
1200 Dollars - All server fees covered, as well as most software renewals/upgrades and covering the cost of using Dropbox to keep manual backups on hand. Reaching this goal would mean a significant site upgrade (visual and functional) within the next year. Updated: If we reach this goal the entire site will be ad-free for everyone for a year AND everyone who contributes above 5 dollars will receive a lifetime of ad-free RGF, even if ads come back for other people!


If we don't reach the initial goal, then the money will still go to paying server costs, but when it runs out if there isn't enough money from advertising or contributions coming in then the site will shut down at that time. Hopefully even if we don't reach the goal then the Mac version of Torchlight 2 will come out, or Runic will have another game announced, or even Grim Dawn (for which I host Grim Dawn Mods, another fansite on the same server sharing the costs) could reach the point of mod support and could bring in revenue. In the end, the goal is to have enough money to make it to a point where the site can stay afloat again. We reached the goal, so this part isn't important anymore! :D

Perks!
There are a few perks available, some which can be tracked via the sidebar. Currently these include:
Update: If we reach the 1200 goal ANYONE who contributes 5 dollars or more to the campaign will be ad-free on RGF for the life of the site!



5 Dollars - As with the previous contribution system if you pay 5 dollars you will receive one month without advertisements whenever you are logged in to your account. If we don't reach our goal and the site does go down this will give you plenty of time to download and stockpile as many mods as you want without advertisements getting in your way.


70 Dollars - Any person who covers an entire month's server fees will receive an Advertisement-free experience for this site and any others that I host for all time. If the site still gets shut down, I will personally supply a dropbox link to the donator to a folder that contains every mod file that was contained on the site.


Highest Bidders! - The two people who contribute the most to the campaign will receive EXTREMELY rare mini statues of Torchlight 2's Dark Alchemist, courtesy of the people at Runic Games. At least one of the donations needs to be via the 25 Dollar Perk, so as to include your address, but the final result will be cumulative for all donations. The page will be updated with the latest Top Two amounts regularly, so check back to see if you are in the running!





  The Impact When Torchlight 1 was released there were three main mod sites for it, but as time passed RGF (Runic Games Fansite) became the only one remaining, and thus became the sole concentrated source of Torchlight mods. The mods helped the site stay paid for and everyone stayed happy, and we built a nice community and a cool Mod Manager.
When Torchlight 2 came out Steam became an alternate source of mods for people playing the Steam version of the game, which meant we lost the monopoly on mods and thus a lot of the traffic. However, there are still many people who own the non-Steam version of Torchlight 2, and still play Torchlight 1, and thus RGF is their only source for mods. If the site goes down it will kill a huge part of the game for many people.
I'm not trying to make Steam out to be the bad guy here, as I use Steam for most of my games these days, but the truth is with the implementation of traditionally community-supported functionality (such as mod hosting and installation) into Steam it kills off community-based sites where modders can congregate, share information, help each other, and collaborate on projects. In other words, the convenience of the big name companies taking over modding undercuts the number and quality of mods you get in the end. I'm trying to keep this little portion of the web that so many people have contributed to alive.

  Risks & Challenges You don't know me. I am just a guy with a day job who has been running a fansite as a hobby since 2008. When the site started it was before the economy got really bad, advertisers were paying better and forums were still a bigger part of the web than they are now. I've tried to keep these sites paid for over the years without a bunch of highly intrusive advertisements, mandatory registrations, or any of the other now common signs of a monetized website. Maybe that is why I'm in this mess now.
There is a risk giving money to any person or website that isn't a big name, well known company, but in a sense that is why we're in this mess now. Help the underdog.

  Other Ways You Can Help If you don't have the means to help monetarily, there are still a couple things you can do. Spread the word of the campaign to your friends and family. If you have mods you've hosted on steam, try adding them to RGF as well. It's a quick registration and upload away, and every mod we get will help the non-Steam users of Torchlight 2 as well.
Additionally, if you have some artistic skills and would like to help make some perks or stretch goals, contact me at webbstre@runicgamesfansite.com and we'll try to work something out.
Please do not contact me offering to host the site on your server. I am not willing to trust the security of the people visiting the site to someone I don't know, and that is essentially what would happen if the site was in someone else's hands.

A year ago I became a father. A lot of my waking time has gone into helping out at home, but that hasn't stopped me from monitoring the site, trying to help out the odd person who comes by and asks a question, or even moving the site onto a cheaper (and less annoying) webhost. I've been trying, but the main reason I've been able to keep going with the site is because between the people contributing to the monthly costs and the supplemental advertising money the site has financially taken care of itself. I want that to continue, but if it turns out the time of the lowly individual fansite is over, then I'll let it go and spend some more time with my family and my other personal projects.
What happens next is up to you.

story:
RunAround is an endless running game in low poly, with minimal textures and cartoon artstyle.It was born by the idea of making a simple videogame based on the tipology of endless running games, easy, for everyone and you can relax playing with it. It's basically a character that as first walks around the world, you have to avoid obstacles like cactus, trees and buildings that spawn randomly on the surface of the planet, then this become more difficult as long as you walk around the world because the character speed up and become bigger. You can find perks like "double-point", "ghost" and "magnet" to pick up that helps you. The terrain and the ambient mutate everytime you do a full run-around the world and you can go everywhere you want, you're not forced on pre-enstablished routes but you can do an "U" turn or, for example, go full right if you want, the possibilities are infinite.




POINTS: PERKS AND COINS.

More you run-around more points you gain.  Pick up coins to become smaller and earn extra points.  
Perks available:



COIN MAGNET DOUBLE-POINT GHOST MODE
Helps you capturing the near coins without running on it.
When it's activated, every coin and distance unit you accumulate, is multiplied by 2, making your points grow up faster.
This perk allows you to go through the obstacles on the planet, like trees, cactuses, houses etc.




TERRAIN AND OBSTACLES.

This world is in constant mutation, you can go from an hot desert to a crowded city. This means that the types of obstacles change in base of the ambient you are in (for example, in the desert you can find cactuses and in the city lampposts). As written before, the terrain changes everytime you do a full run-around of the planet. If you hit these obstacles, you loose, only your skill with little helps from the perks can make you go farther in the game.




SOCIAL.

The in-game integration with Facebook and Twitter gives you the possibility to share your record with your friends and compete with them.




PLATFORMS.

This game is a cross-platform and supports Android, iOS, Windows Phone and Windows Store App.



THERMO-TIMELINE.

the perk will be delivered on expiry of the campaign


TEAM.

Leo Iezzi - 3D Arts, Technical Director and Project Managment
He's an important member of the group for his knowledge in videogame production, he's 21 from Treviso (Italy) and worked at BigRock, a famous CG school in Italy, nowadays works on his own for national and international customers.

Daniel Sartorato - Programmer Boss
All he wants is types line of code and make RunAround grow up as fast as he can, he's 21 from Silea (italy) and got a degree in computer science. He's very into the project and works hard for it.

Glenn Cappelletto - Art Director and Copywriter
He's 21 from Treviso and is very enthusiasts to be part in the development of this game, works on the game's public image as Art Director and Copywriter and manages the Press.

Matteo "Giga" Granzotto - Programmer 
He's is 21 from Giavera del Montello (Treviso) . He is particularly attached to the indipendet way of development ideas, from music to games. In the project, he mostly works on the integration with social networks. He's studying computer science at the University of Padoa. He's an hard worker in everything he does.

Gianluca "Borto" Bortolanza - Programmer
He dedicated his life to videogames and now for the first time joins the opportunity to make one of them, programming with the others to develop RunAround. He mostly works on the GUI and various features of the game. He got a degree in programming and he is very versatile with various knowledge as game development with Unity and computer graphics.
SHARE on Facebook and Twitter!
