story:
Thanks to everyone who supported our campaign! Khordz mugs production is now in full swing. If you missed out on the campaign you can now get you Khordz from our website www.khordz.com! 

Cheers!

-Khordz Team


Design

Khordz mugs are designed to go everywhere you do. The 25 foot section of paracord wrapped around each mug provides a sturdy handle, cool grip, and proven survival utility. Khordz mugs are the perfect companion whether you need to snare-a-bear or simply take your joe-to-go.

Dishwasher/Microwave Safe


Materials

Khordz Mugs are hand-wrapped and tied in Santa Cruz, CA with the following materials:

  • 16 oz. food grade heat-resistant glass canning jar
  • 25 ft. of mold/mildew resistant 550 pound rated paracord

Goals

Our funding goal for this project is $5,500. Reaching this goal will enable us to purchase the tools and materials needed to start full-scale production. We have set our minimum target goal at 1,000 mugs in order to achieve minimum purchasing requirements for materials and offer Khordz mugs at a competitive price. 

Project Expenses

  • Mug materials (bulk paracord, jars, and glass etching)
  • Tools (rope cutter, hand tools, storage and organizational equipment)
  • Shipping (packaging and postage)
  • Labor/production
  • Project fees (Credit card processing and Indiegogo fees)

Khordz logo is etched into the glass jar


Rewards

Collections and Colors

Indie Colors: Turquoise, Black, Mustard Yellow,  and Maroon

Muted Colors: Teal, Grey, Maroon, and Black

Neon Colors: Purple, Flamingo Pink, Pacific Blue, and Neon Green

Motif Colors: Tree Stand, Plumb Crazy, Jamaica-Me-Crazy, and Camo

The Khordz Story

Coffee, lots of coffee…

Knots, lots of knots…

Fun, tons and tons of fun!

Khordz designer, Daniel Fontius, loves coffee. He also loves the ocean. Unfortunately, his love for coffee and coffee shops was having a negative impact on the ocean. He sometimes finds himself at one, two, or even three different coffee shops a day. He has always felt guilty about the number of single-use cups and lids he has consumed in his life, since he picked up the habit at the age of 10.

In July of 2013, Daniel and his partner Krista Harris, were presented with a challenge... to cut out as much single-use plastic as possible from their lives for one month. At the top of the list of worst pollution offenders was Daniel's favorite, the to-go coffee cup lid… bummer! So, they decided to commit to the challenge. In order to do this, they started toting their favorite to-go mugs that Daniel had fashioned the year before out of some leftover venetian blind cord and empty honey jars. (At the time Daniel was really into tying knots, having just returned from a sailing excursion in the Caribbean.) As it turned out, the leftover blind cord was the perfect length for making a hand-wrapped sleeve and handle. The design has been a huge hit (having now gone through several prototypes). Daniel and Krista constantly receive comments and requests from friends and strangers. Thus, Khordz was born!

Handmade Mugs That Make a Difference

The goal of Khordz is to get others excited about keeping plastic out of the landfill, off the beach, and out of the ocean. We aim to help support those that make it their mission to protect the ocean and ensure that everyone can enjoy the beauty and resources it offers. 

Khordz mugs are also a handy companion for the adventurer and outdoor enthusiast. You can do a lot with a jar and 25 ft. of paracord. Some of our favorites are the handy snare trap, hanging your hammock, tying up hyper siblings, suspending your bear canister from a tree, clothes lines, and the fire starter bow! Stay tuned... we will be adding videos that highlight the many uses of Khordz mugs! 

Mission Statement

We’re Khordz. We live simple and sustainable lifestyles that keep us in touch with our roots right here in coastal California. We take care in producing individual, hand crafted, multi-purposed drinkware that allows us to stay connected through what some may consider unexpected means. We don’t always know where we’re going, but we know what we need to take with us. We keep our products close to our hearts, crafted with the individual and the environment in mind.

Challenges

We are aware of the various challenges involved in bringing a product to market.

Our first challenge will be getting the word out and meeting our funding goal. We have a plan to engage all of our professional and social networks... this includes you! We hope you will be excited and want to help spread the word through your own networks as well. We'll also be posting updates and entertaining videos to engage new backers and supporters.

The second possible challenge will hopefully be that Khordz is a huge success!! While this would be awesome, we also know it will take a lot of work to meet demand. This is the kind of challenge we like! Our experience and hardworking background will provide us with the tools necessary to meet this challenge.

We, Daniel and Krista, come from hardworking families that have been producing American products for generations. Daniel's family manufactures engineered fabric structures that are used all over the world. He has participated in every aspect of the business, from welding fabric on the shop floor, to installing 20,000-square-foot structures in Nigeria, and product development and design.

Krista's family has been farming in eastern Washington for five generations. The fruit from their thousands of acres of orchards and vineyards is shipped and consumed all over the world. She began working on the farm at age 10 and has since received her business degree and managed several businesses.

We are very confident in our ability to see this project through and address any issues that may arise. Every project has its challenges, but we know that with your support and the support of our families, friends, education, and experience, Khordz survival drinkware will be a success!

Our experience and hardworking background will provide us with the tools necessary to meet this challenge.We, Daniel and Krista, come from hardworking families that have been producing American products for generations. Daniel's family manufactures engineered fabric structures that are used all over the world. He has participated in every aspect of the business, from welding fabric on the shop floor, to installing 20,000-square-foot structures in Nigeria, and product development and design.Krista's family has been farming in eastern Washington for five generations. The fruit from their thousands of acres of orchards and vineyards is shipped and consumed all over the world. She began working on the farm at age 10 and has since received her business degree and managed several businesses.We are very confident in our ability to see this project through and address any issues that may arise. story:
Hi everyone. We’re Laia and Ian, founders of Sukubus Studio We’re delighted to show you the third miniatures range we’ve developed on 3D for our studio.
Thanks to this platform we are glad to show you our creations and would like to know your thoughts. We hope you like them as much as we’ve enjoyed developing.

Witches Team is made up by a group of dark elves warriors. In it there are diverse kinds of Witches that represent the diverse roles in a Fantasy Football match.
The idea came to us when Valkyries Team campaign finished. The feedback from backers was amazing during Sukubus Team and Valkyries Team. Thanks for their support, encourage us to continue producing Fantasy Football Teams. For this occasion we decided to do something different again, and continue to offer alternative quality miniatures.


Production will be made in high quality resin on a 32 mm scale. We’re certain of the finishing of each miniature, as they will be made by our friends at RN Estudio, great professionals that have a lot of experience in this kind of campaigns.



This counter is an exclusive gift for this campaign. Each backer will receive only one counter per package or one per each complete team in case that you order more than one.


We want to offer the best quality for our backers. That's why we have managed to make the production of Witches Dices with Chessex. A great customized dices company that get the best results.






Thanks to your support we’ll be able to carry out production and all costs that it implies:

  1. Production of master models (3D printing).
  2. Serial manufacturing of your miniatures (resin copies).
  3. Packing, shipping and taxes costs.



We expect to be able to deliver the product by October 2016. Thus, once the campaign is over, we’ll need 4 months to make the serial production and few weeks more or less to send you your miniatures. It depends on the number of backers.


Thank you beforehand for your support!
We’d like to thank particularly to all campaign collaborators and all those who have shared our links or send us funny comments.

RN Estudio - 3D print, cast and copies production.

Chessex - Customized dices.

on 3D for our studio. Thanks to this platform we are glad to show you 
our creations and would like to know your thoughts. We hope you 
like them as much as we’ve enjoyed developing.Witches Team is made up by a group of dark elves warriors. 
In it there are diverse kinds of Witches that represent the diverse 
roles in a Fantasy Football match.The idea came to us when Valkyries Team
 campaign finished. The feedback from backers was amazing during Sukubus Team and Valkyries Team. Thanks for
 their support, encourage us to continue producing Fantasy Football 
Teams. For this occasion we decided to do something different again, and
 continue to offer alternative quality miniatures.



Production will be made in high quality resin on a 32 mm scale. We’re certain of the finishing of each miniature, as they will be made by our friends at  RN Estudio, great professionals that have a lot of experience in this kind of campaigns.













This counter is an exclusive gift for this campaign. Each backer will receive only one counter per package or one per each complete team in case that you order more than one.


We want to offer the best quality for our backers. That's why we have managed to make the production of Witches Dices with Chessex. A great customized dices company that get the best results. 











































Thanks to your support we’ll be able to carry out production and all costs that it implies:
Production of master models (3D printing).
Serial manufacturing of your miniatures (resin copies).
Packing, shipping and taxes costs.




We expect to be able to deliver the product by October
 2016. Thus, once the campaign is over, we’ll need 4 months to make the serial production and few weeks more or less to send you your miniatures. It depends on the number of backers.


Thank you beforehand for your support! We’d like to thank particularly 
to all campaign collaborators and all those who have shared our links or
 send us funny comments.RN Estudio  - 3D print, cast and copies production.Chessex - Customized dices.

story:
'Game Over, Man. Game Over!'

The campaign has finally come to an end.

But the game is far from over. In fact, it has only just begun!

A lot of wonderful people donated a total of 1368$. This will help cover some expenses during the first year of development.

The two most important things we gained from this campaign, is the licenses for the game engine (Thanks Rob) and you, all of our fans.

Next stop: Early alpha game…
Time to destination: Hopefully within a years time.

Follow our progress by checking our webpage www.theuniverse4x.com and liking us on facebook www.facebook.com/theuniverse4xgame.

We will primarily use the facebook page to issue updates, untill the website has been properly built.

The Final 24 Hours

While it does not look like we will make the goal, this campaign has been invaluable in the experience we have gained from our budding community.
We are happy about all the donations and they will help us immensely during these first baby-steps of the game.

One of our primary goals with this fundraising wasn’t really about the money.
We wanted to ‘kickstart’ a community for the game. More and more people are ‘liking’ us on facebook, allowing them to follow our continued progress.

The past couple of weeks have all been about spreading the word, but soon the campaign is over and we can shift focus to more planning and building the ever-important first Alfa game, which will eventually lead us to the even more important Beta.

What really surprised us at the beginning of the campaign, was the donation of the licenses for the game engine we intend to use (414$ value). This allowed us to start development/programming, regardless of the amount of donations that followed.
Once again, thank you Rob Evans from Irrelon Software!

March 29th, 2012: Important update

We've been in contact with Rob Evans at Irrelon Software, who created the Isogenic Engine, which we intend to use for the game.

They decided to donate the engine license as well as two developer licenses toward our game!

As a result, we've altered the funding calculation, so the 414$ for the license is now part of the funds destined for graphic artists and sounds.

This means that we can begin programming even before this campaign ends!

Thank you Rob and Irrelon software

-------------------------

Introductions

Peter is 34 years old and lives with his girlfriend somewhere in Central Copenhagen in Denmark.
 
Jon is 29 years old, lives with his girlfriend and baby daughter somewhere in the Greater Copenhagen Area in Denmark.
 
A bunch of years ago, Peter and Jon were both studying to be Data Technicians. It was a 5-year education which focused on Cisco networks and a general, broad knowledge of different IT technologies, as well as programming. This is where they met and sweet music happened. Well, no music. But they did become friends.

How the idea started

Peter and Jon both have been doing a lot of gaming throughout their lives. Over the past couple of years Peter has been thinking more and more about the gameplay and their individual restrictions. One night, not very long ago, he started putting together a concept for a new game uniting many of the gaming concepts he liked from the other games. He presented the (very) raw concept to Jon and he was hooked too.
 
After months of thinking, writing, scheming, drinking, eating and whatnot, they ended up with a well defined concept for this new amazing game.

The Game

Basically it is a 4X game. 4X is an acronym for eXplore, eXpand, eXploit and eXterminate. Most will know these games as Strategy games. Unlike most other 4X games (e.g. Civilization, Galactic Civilizations, Master of Orion and Sins of a Solar Empire) this game will be Massively-Multiplayer oriented and set in a persistent world.
It focuses on construction, economy, diplomacy, research, cooperation and trade; but warfare and other naughty gameplay will also be implemented.
It will mostly resemble a mixture between SimCity and Civilization, but different and much more intertwined in the persistent world. Your village only has two limits:
  • Available land
  • Money

Eventually your "village" could encompass an entire planet and your empire half a galaxy, but most likely not without aid.

Friends are not required

This game is intended to be playable as a casual browser game, similar to CastleVille, GalaxyLife, AirportCity.
One of the differences from those browser games, is that you are not required to have or help friends in order to obtain some special item which (in the other games) would be required to complete a tutorial or mission.
You will not be forced to add your friends. That is a trend with many popular browser games, which we will not indulge.
We may add a sort of bonus for inviting friends, but none of that "promote us on facebook by sending your friends resources", which ends up spamming their facebook-wall.
 
That being said, you can still benefit from having friends near you in the game, as they are more inclined to accept cheaper trade deals, because they trust you to do the same.
It makes it easier to teach each other technologies (for a price of course) to enable quicker improvements to your community as a whole.
You can make a municipality from the beginning and have someone you all trust run the eco-political game, creating better trade deals for you all to benefit from, so you don't have to do the legwork of securing trade deals.

Money CAN buy happiness

Despite the topic, the game will be completely free to play.
Using only your ingame funds (no real money needed), you can purchase your way through the game, instead of researching.

Economy, as well as trade, is an integral part of this game and you can always purchase whatever you need to get ahead.

To be able to buy something you need, another Player must have produced and put that something for sale first (ingame funds only).
  • This enables an entirely Player-driven market where Players set the price and supply and demand has a very real impact on your income.
  • Make the best product in your general area, and you decide the price, at least untill someone else makes a better product or sell a slightly inferior product at low, low prices.
  • As trade routes and interactions grow, so does the range and knowledge of your products. You may end up getting orders for your special goods from further away than you knew existed.

Stockpiling and wearing down

Just because you can produce something in large volumes, doesn't mean you should produce a lot of goods and stockpile them for better times. All goods are perishable to a degree and have a limited lifespan after production (some are long, though).

  • This includes vehicles, buildings, food, power lines, roads and basically all goods.
  • Better storage/production methods can improve or even suspend their lifespan, but eventually things will wear out.
  • Upgrading anything with better materials or production methods will increase their lifespan. As lifespan nears the end, the quality and function/speed of the building/vehicle is reduced; and eventually ceases to function.
    • Bad news if you are in a spaceship in between planets. But hey, at least your communication equipment is still working, so you can call for help. 
      • You did remember to replace that old radio, didn't you?
  • As a consequence of wearing out, an entire village can wear down if it is not attended to by a player. We aim to implement a simple upkeep to handle the village repairs and required materials can be automatically purchased to facilitate this repair. But here you can also save some money by micromanaging the purchase of materials.
    • Eventually a player decides to leave the game as-is and never to return. This will leave weathered and abandoned villages for other players to pick apart for resources or unknown technologies; or to restore, as they see fit.
  • A time limit will be determined for how long a player can stay (completely) out of the game, before upkeep payments are suspended and owners rights are lost. Maybe 1 or 2 months. We are not sure yet, but it will be a fair limit.
    • People should be able to go on extended vacation without attending to their village. They will miss out on big trade deals or have someone else build resource gathering equipment on their turf while they are on vacation, but at least they will not lose their village.
    • If owners rights are lost, other players can claim the village (and lands) as theirs. The original player is of course also able to reclaim the village after the time limit, as long as it is unclaimed.

Politics, alliances and communities

Production and trade will be a big part of the game, as they drive the economics, but at some point, you may tire from constant production and wish to learn more about the politics of the region you inhabit.

If you are part of a Municipality, you can contact your Mayor (a player democratically elected), or other leading character (a selfproclaimed dictator perhaps?) and let him know you are interested in joining politics to allow him to make the introduction to other leading characters in the (geo-)political circles/players currently active.

But you can also just introduce yourself, if e.g. you intended to run for Mayor yourself, or just wish to learn more about what is going on. Do note that the Mayor may have access to political discussions you don't, so going through him may help you get into the inner political circle faster.

Help build alliances for your community, help mediate warring (internal?) parties to enable peace and trade, or help covert operations to gain information about your enemies.

You do not have to involve yourself with the community at large, but the political opportunities and power are there for whoever grabs them first.

Research and Technology

Advancing in the game does not require you to do massive amounts of research, although it certainly helps. Research being mostly optional is also what makes this game differ from all the other 4X games. You have the option of purchasing technology from other Players, or simply buying the weapons, goods or services (e.g. competent workforce) you need, regardless whether your own technological level is high enough to create it yourself. All you need is (ingame) money!

The technology tree will be large and intricate, and we do really mean large and intricate. Researching technologies does not just happen over night.

Basically it should not be feasible for a single player to research the entire technology tree alone, at least not without spending a large amount of time playing the game.

The reasonning behind this is to enable (or rather force) Players to create product niches where they produce a superior product that, e.g., other Players require to construct weapons, which they sell to other Players, who use them to conquer and subdue unsuspecting Players.

Some might call this Specialization and cruel. We call it fun and believe it will make the game interesting, because not everyone has the same (technological) advantages. The game will be dynamic and new players in populated areas will probably be asked/paid (or forced) to produce food and other general resources needed by your thriving city (state).

Micropayments

We have played our fair share of browser games which block some advancements or actions, untill you pay. And we don't like that any more than you do!

At some point, micropayments will be enabled, but the game will not require any payment to play to its fullest extent.

Implementing micropayments will not limit the free players or the game experience.

Micropayments will only be intended to give ingame cash advantages:
  • Pay extra cash as an incentive to workers, so they work longer hours and finish faster, but they cannot complete production in an instant.
  • Hire extra workers to help speed production along, just make sure your production facility has space for them to work in.

Playing the game

Playing the game should be as easy as possible for those players who just wants to play casually, but there will be options to delve into the micromanagement hell that lies frothing beneath the surface. Micromanaging can result in better products, faster research, cheaper expenses in production and many other benefits. Or micromanaging can cost you precious time that could have been better spent on expanding your knowledge of the territory (available resources) and gaining access to Players (friends/enemies/business partners) to peddle your products to, or spy on for future wars.

The Platform

Well, that sure sounds like a complex game. The big question is, will we release it for Windows, Linux or OSX?
 
The short answer is: For Java and HTML5.
 
Those two technologies should be able to run on basically any platform with an Internet Browser: Windows, OSX, Linux, Unix, Sun, Android, iPhone, and so on, and so forth.

What We Need & What You Get

At the moment Jon and Peter are continually working out the finer details of the game, but needed a game engine to program the game in.

For this purpose, we've come across the Isogenic Engine by Irrelon Software.

Update: Irrelon Software donated the Engine License and two Developer Licenses toward this game on March 29th, 2012. Thank you Rob Evans from Irrelon Software!

This engine has a lot of features working out-of-the-box, which will save us from months, if not years of programming to create something similar ourselves.

Among its features, which we intend to use, you will find:

  • Advanced Realtime Multiplayer
    • All nearby players will be able to see and interact with each others villages as they grow, in realtime!
  • Facebook-integration
    • Primarily to make it easy to log in and invite your friends (entirely optional of course)
    • Eventually you can be alerted about important events or problems in your village, without even logging into the game (entirely optional of course)
  • Very fast canvas-renderer (HTML5)
  • Using only Java and HTML5 on the clients

 

Update: We can acquired the Game Engine and is now able to start programming. Yay!

Your donation will be used for

  • Programming and other game-related software.
    • We try for freeware where possible, but if paid software can noticeably decrease programming time, that would be better.
  • Travel expenses
    • Jon and Peter lives about 40 km (24 miles) apart from each other and gasoline/public transportation is not cheap.
  • Graphic artists, sound, other expertise
    • Neither Peter nor Jon are strong with graphics or making sounds for games and need to pay someone else to do quality graphics and sounds
  • Taxes and costs
    • We live in Denmark and the government here claim about 40-45% of what you donate, as it will be considered a "regular income", because we are private people and not running a company (yet).
We plan to create a company at some point in the future to handle the game when it is mature enough, but for now, we need to hang on to our regular incomes to pay our regular expenses.
 
Radically more funding would enable us to hire even more talented people to help build the inner workings of the game faster.

Our target donation is 4884$

Minimum success criteria reached!

Update: Our minimum donations was 834$ as the leftover amount (Indiegogo at 9% did-not-reach-target) of 414$ would cover only the Game Engine.

On March 29th, 2012, only 4 days after the campaign went live, Irrelon Software donated the licenses for the engine and two developers, so we can now start programming!

Donation calculations

Any donations we receive, even if target is not reached, will go toward these expenses, in the order mentioned (except for taxes, which are unavoidable):
  • Isogenic Engine - Free, as it was donated by Irrelon Software!
    • Covers independent license + 2 developer licenses
    • The game engine is absolutely essential to proceed, and now we got it!
  • Travel expenses - minimum 238$
    • As not all discussions and planning can be done online, we will need to meet up about every 3rd weekend for the next year
      • That equals 17 weekends * 2 trips (1 person to and fro) * 40 DKK (7$) per trip using a 10-trip discount card
  • Graphic artists, sound, other expertise - 1972$ + 414$ that was destined for the game engine
    • Neither Peter nor Jon are strong graphically and need to have someone else do quality graphics and sounds
  • Taxes and charges - 2260$
    • See calculation below

Donations needed: 4884$

The taxes and charges calculations

  • Subtract 25$ for non-us campaign
  • 4859$ * 4% for Indiegogo = subtract 194.36$
  • 4664.64$ * 3% credit charges = subtract 139.94$
  • 4524.70$ * 42% danish personal taxes = subtract 1900.37$

Leftover: 2624$, which corresponds with above mentioned expenses:
238$ (Travel expenses) + 1972$ + 414$ (hiring professionals for graphics and sound).

Taxes and charges: 4884$ (total) - 2624$(leftover) = 2260$.

The Perks

Of course there will be perks! As an added bonus, all Perks are cumulative ;)
  • 1$~ Anyone who donates will be given an in-game cash advantage, when the game goes live
    • Amount will be determined at game launch, but will be substantial
  • 5$~ Special invitation to the Closed Beta
    • The cash advantages will be given once at Closed Beta and once on the final launch, if progress during Closed Beta is deleted
    • It may take a year or more before the Closed Beta is ready
    • You get 1 extra Closed Beta invitation per 1$ extra up to 9$
      • Share these with your friends
      • They also get a cash advantage, but smaller than yours
      • You can max get 4 extra invitations
  • 10$~ This deserves an honorable mention.
    • Your name will be mentioned on the credits page of the game website, expressing our gratitude
  • 25$~ All technological advances in the game will be accredited to a random name of a fictional character in your village, who made the technological discovery.
    • With this perk, your real (or a chosen) name will be mentioned instead for a randomly chosen technology. Every time any player discovers that technology, your name will be mentioned.
  • 42$~ You get to say you donated The Answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything.
    • You can only truly say that, if you donate exactly 42$, but feel free to donate more
    • See The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy for explanation.
  • 50$~ Your village will be fortuitously placed and have valuable resources nearby.
    • Placed on a resource rich planet and in or near some large resources.
  • 100$~ Your village will be placed near Peter's and Jon's in the game.
    • We cannot promise it will be on the same planet, but then at least on a nearby planet.
  • 250$~ You get a 1 hour skype-video-call with Jon and Peter to learn even more about the game and our ideas for it.
    • The date of the call can scheduled as soon as the campaign closes. You don't have to wait till the game is completed ;)
    • If you happen to be able to reach Copenhagen (in Denmark), we can change this to a meeting at a café. Brunch and local travel costs will be on us!
  • 500$~ You get an extra hour on the 250$ perk.
    • Perk is not added to the list on the right, as we reached the limit of perks at 250$ ;)

Help spread the word

Help our campaign by spreading the word.

  • Like/link to this campaign.
  • Like/link to our Facebook page
  • Tell your friends/family/strangers

Indiegogo has some great tools to help you help us.

Facebook-integration

Primarily to make it easy to log in and invite your friends (entirely optional of course)
Eventually you can be alerted about important events or problems in your village, without even logging into the game (entirely optional of course)


Very fast canvas-renderer (HTML5)
Using only Java and HTML5 on the clients

 
Update: We can acquired the Game Engine and is now able to start programming. Yay!
Your donation will be used for


Programming and other game-related software.
We try for freeware where possible, but if paid software can noticeably decrease programming time, that would be better.



Travel expenses
Jon and Peter lives about 40 km (24 miles) apart from each other and gasoline/public transportation is not cheap.



Graphic artists, sound, other expertise

Neither Peter nor Jon are strong with graphics or making sounds for games and need to pay someone else to do quality graphics and sounds



Taxes and costs

We live in Denmark and the government here claim about 40-45% of what you donate, as it will be considered a "regular income", because we are private people and not running a company (yet).



We plan to create a company at some point in the future to handle the game when it is mature enough, but for now, we need to hang on to our regular incomes to pay our regular expenses.
 
Radically more funding would enable us to hire even more talented people to help build the inner workings of the game faster.
Our target donation is 4884$
Minimum success criteria reached!
Update: Our minimum donations was 834$ as the leftover amount (Indiegogo at 9% did-not-reach-target) of 414$ would cover only the Game Engine.
On March 29th, 2012, only 4 days after the campaign went live, Irrelon Software donated the licenses for the engine and two developers, so we can now start programming!
Donation calculations
Any donations we receive, even if target is not reached, will go toward these expenses, in the order mentioned (except for taxes, which are unavoidable):


Isogenic Engine - Free, as it was donated by Irrelon Software!

Covers independent license + 2 developer licenses
The game engine is absolutely essential to proceed, and now we got it!



Travel expenses - minimum 238$
As not all discussions and planning can be done online, we will need to meet up about every 3rd weekend for the next year

That equals 17 weekends * 2 trips (1 person to and fro) * 40 DKK (7$) per trip using a 10-trip discount card





Graphic artists, sound, other expertise - 1972$ + 414$ that was destined for the game engine

Neither Peter nor Jon are strong graphically and need to have someone else do quality graphics and sounds



Taxes and charges - 2260$

See calculation below



Donations needed: 4884$
The taxes and charges calculations


Subtract 25$ for non-us campaign

4859$ * 4% for Indiegogo = subtract 194.36$

4664.64$ * 3% credit charges = subtract 139.94$

4524.70$ * 42% danish personal taxes = subtract 1900.37$

Leftover: 2624$, which corresponds with above mentioned expenses:238$ (Travel expenses) + 1972$ + 414$ (hiring professionals for graphics and sound).
Taxes and charges: 4884$ (total) - 2624$(leftover) = 2260$.
The Perks


Of course there will be perks! As an added bonus, all Perks are cumulative ;)



1$~ Anyone who donates will be given an in-game cash advantage, when the game goes live
Amount will be determined at game launch, but will be substantial



5$~ Special invitation to the Closed Beta

The cash advantages will be given once at Closed Beta and once on the final launch, if progress during Closed Beta is deleted

It may take a year or more before the Closed Beta is ready
You get 1 extra Closed Beta invitation per 1$ extra up to 9$
Share these with your friends
They also get a cash advantage, but smaller than yours
You can max get 4 extra invitations





10$~ This deserves an honorable mention.

Your name will be mentioned on the credits page of the game website, expressing our gratitude



25$~ All technological advances in the game will be accredited to a random name of a fictional character in your village, who made the technological discovery.
With this perk, your real (or a chosen) name will be mentioned instead for a randomly chosen technology. Every time any player discovers that technology, your name will be mentioned.



42$~ You get to say you donated The Answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything.
You can only truly say that, if you donate exactly 42$, but feel free to donate more
See The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy for explanation.



50$~ Your village will be fortuitously placed and have valuable resources nearby.

Placed on a resource rich planet and in or near some large resources.



100$~ Your village will be placed near Peter's and Jon's in the game.

We cannot promise it will be on the same planet, but then at least on a nearby planet.



250$~ You get a 1 hour skype-video-call with Jon and Peter to learn even more about the game and our ideas for it.

The date of the call can scheduled as soon as the campaign closes. You don't have to wait till the game is completed ;)
If you happen to be able to reach Copenhagen (in Denmark), we can change this to a meeting at a café. Brunch and local travel costs will be on us!



500$~ You get an extra hour on the 250$ perk.

Perk is not added to the list on the right, as we reached the limit of perks at 250$ ;)




Help spread the word
Help our campaign by spreading the word.

Like/link to this campaign.
Like/link to our Facebook page

Tell your friends/family/strangers
Indiegogo has some great tools to help you help us.

story:
Welcome to Micro Art Studio’s Wolsung Steampunk Skirmish Game!

For the last two years we have been working on a skirmish game based on the world of Wolsung: „Steam Pulp Fantasy“ roleplaying game. We’re now just giving it some finishing touches and the game is ready to be enjoyed by gamers all around the world. Almost all of the miniatures are ready but we still need to print the Rulebooks and manufacture the laser-cut terrains.

Overview of the Game:

Wolsung SSG is set in the world which is similar to our world in the turn of nineteenth and twentieth century but filled with magic, steam-powered machines and fantastic creatures such as Elves and Dwarves. The game focuses on the city of Lyonesse – the Pearl amongst cities – and adventures of its residents - Extraordinary Ladies and Gentlemen. In the game, players control clubs made of a few such characterful personalities and their servants, to fight for fame and fortune.

Why do we need your contribution:

After the division of the company the Wolsung SSG project slowed down a bit, because we weren’t able to fund everything at once: beautiful graphics, minis, website, the layout of the rulebook and lasercut terrains. We expect that the money gathered on IndieGoGo will help us to speed up the production process – we would really like to have everything done for Essen Spiel 2012 – and let us work on the first big addition to Wolsung SSG – new clubs, new rules and even more fun!

What happens if we surpass our goal:

5000 dollars is enough for us to print the rulebooks and prepare the terrains, but we already have three new clubs which are almost ready to go, as well as the campaign rules and maybe (?) the rules for vehicles. That is a lot of content but we still lack the capacity to fund everything at once. That is why every dollar helps, and brings us closer to expanding the game and allow players to better explore the universe of countless possibilities and Extraordinary Ladies and Gentlemen – the world of Wolsung.

You can find more information on:

www.microartstudio.com

www.wolsung-ssg.com

http://www.steampulpfantasy.com/

The rules for Wolsung SSG are available to download on:

www.microartstudio.com/_Products/Wolsung_SSG_zdjecia_do_podrecznika/Wolsung%20SSG%20rules%20v1.2%20internet.pdf

 

All the models are supplied unassembled and unpainted. You have to bear in mind that all painted sets are hand painted, so it takes time before we can send them.

Please add 5$ for shipping to europe and 10$ outside europe. You just have to add for the shipping once, no matter how many times you contribute. ;)

You can find more photos of the minis in the gallery, or on shop.microartstudio.com

Wolsung Steampunk Skirmish Game - Tutorial 01 - Movement

 

 Perks:

 

NEW!! Wolsung Miniatures Deal!

With Customizer and Customizer + Perks you get points to choose your own models with!

 

 

 

 

 

With Wolsung Supporter Perk you gain one Wolsung Playing Cards Deck.

 

  

 

With Wolsung Collector Perk you gain either Mary Fearless, Thomas Rockheart Jr. or Mr. Cheng model. The models come unpainted and unassembled.

 


 

With Wolsung Collector Plus Perk you gain one Ingrid Rangvaldottir with mirror Golems set, or one Zachary Fiercebatten III with Hounds set or Wandering Actor with a Shade. All models come unpainted and unassembled. 

 

 

 

With Wolsung Beginner Perk you gain one beautifully printed hard-cover, full color Wolsung Rulebook. 

 

 

 

 

 

With Wolsung Gamer Perk you gain one Ash and Oak Starter Set (consisting of lord Lance Oakroot, lady Petronella Ellendeanne, two butlers and a bruiser), a Scientints Club Starter Set (Thorvald Nielsgaard, Alice Tinkerly, 2 Lab Golems and one Lab Assistant) or Triad of Lotus Dragon Starter Set (Phoenix, Xen Jidao, Trader, Fisherman and a Shade). All models come unpainted and unassembled.

 

 

 

With One Player Set Perk you gain one Starter Set of your choice, one hardback, full color Wolsung Rulebook and a deck of Wolsung Playing Cards. All models come unpainted and unassembled.

 

 

 

With Wolsung Builder Perk you gain two HDF, laser-cut Wolsung XIX Century Walkways + one lasercut Wolsung XIX Century Block of Flats set with removable stories and roof. All terrains supplied unpainted. HDF terrain requires assembly.

 

 

 

 

With One Player Set Plus Perk you gain one Starter Set of your choice, one hardback, full color Wolsung Rulebook a deck of Wolsung Playing Cards, one HDF, lasercut building set and ware piles set. All models and terrains come unpainted and unassembled.

1 Starter Set (5 models) from a chosen Wolsung faction painted and based on Micro Art Studio bases of your choice. Painted by top Micro Art Studio painters. The miniatures will be painted like shown in the catalogue (similar to that you can see on the perk pictures) [Of course the unpainted miniature from triad of lotus will be also painted ;)]

To boost up our indiegogo campaign we want to reveal our stretched goals:

If we reach:




Each supporter from 10$ gets extra resin wround base from Micro Art Studio line for each mini in his perk and additionally all supporters above 75$ will get an exclusive acrylic wolsung style measurement template.

6000$ = extra points for One Player Set (3 points) and One Player Set +(5 points)

7000$ - each supporter from $75 and up gets an additional set of (HDF) XIX Century Stands

When we reach 8000$ :) Each supporter from $75 and up gets an additional set of (HDF) XIX Century Walls

9000$ - each supporter from $75 and up gets an additional XIX Century Walkway (take notice that this one is shorter than the regular one)

And the last one ;) if we reach 10000$ each supporter from $75 and up gets an additional set of (HDF) XIX Century Block of Flats

story:
Help Me To Entertain You!

The main goal that I am trying to reach is $800 to build a pc in order to keep making videos on youtube. Recently the computer I was using completely died on me, so now I am unable to make any videos.

I tried everything to fix my computer and am completely devastated at the fact that i can't make videos anymore.

My family and I have been trying our hardest to raise money but it has been impossible due to other things that have been going on.

It honestly feels like i'm nothing when i'm not making videos so please guys help me raise enough money for this pc. Even if I don't raise enough I'll still be happy that people actually tried to help me.

I love you all and thank you soo much for supporting me :)

story:
Introduction

We are working on a game that takes the concept of the old text based RPG but with today’s web technology’s. HTML5, CSS3, JQUERY and awesome art-work to give the player the best gaming experience.

Instead of boring little clicks to progress there are mini games to satisfy your appetite. This combined with awesome artwork to go through cool storylines in an on-line world with generic content.

And all of this is happening in a large and social world where every player is bound to clash into another.


ShotCallers

ShotCallers takes place in a dark and twisted copy of our real world. Players will start as an nobody and need to work their way up.

Players can work alone, start a crew or join an existing group.  There are lots of assets and rewards to get, and there will be different ways of achieving them.

Play quests, mini games by yourself or with a group. The aim of the game is to gain money and power, but this is not a must.

The players can choose to play the game however they want.

In our concept we have developed a system that can create new storylines for every player.

These storylines will be based on user´s content. Which means that the game´s main content will come from the players who play the game.

This also means that the content of the game is constantly changing. No longer will you play a game twice and experience or encounter the same as you did before.

Every time you start again you will see new content. Besides the human players in the game there will also be artificial intelligence players.

They will do whatever they want. Once our development team releases a set of these players they live their own live and will be your competitor or friend.

Games within the game

ShotCallers has a variety of mini games that will be able to entertain any kind of player. From single players games to multiplayer games.

Action, Strategy, Gamble, puzzle, race, etc... games it´s all in the game. Whatever game you like to play, the choice is yours.

We even created a new game type we would like to call semi multiplayer where players need to work together to get a total group score.

The mini games within the game will challenge the users to master different games, so within the game world there will be lots of things to do.

In our first version of the game the amount of games will be limited. But no worries we are dedicated to this project and promise that the amount of games will keep growing.

Social

Since the web is more of a social tool nowadays we want to make use of this. In ShotCallers you need to be social and work together. There are different ways of being social.

Play games together with random strangers or with your friends. Help out your crew and friends with their drugfarm and get rewarded.

Or just start a rampage by killing other players and take what is rightfully yours.

Besides mini games, you can make or join a team, to work together and gain domination.

Joining a crew will also result in more options for the players since the crew can have missions and status as well.

Cities and certain parts of the game world will have domination aspects. A smart and cooperative crew will be most likely the one to dominate this area.

Communication and cooperation will be key, and the game supports a lot of features to communicate with your friends and enemies.

Development

Shotcallers is currently in early alpha. Our goal is to have a playable version in Januari.

After that, development will continue with regular updates and expansions.

We want to keep the world alive by keep releasing new content and keep a close eye on the world so we can give our gamers the most awesome and fun gaming experience.


Why Indiegogo

We're now at the point in development where we have finished a lot of illustrations and code, but there is still a lot of production, as well as a ton of polishing and testing left to do. We want to take our time and make the game as good as possible.

We don’t want to lower our expectations to the quality of the finished game, or delay the release so we hope we can realise this with this Indiegogo campaign. We've found that $20.000 is the amount we need to quit our part-time jobs, and continue working full-time on finishing ShotCallers.

Stretch goals

20k.000 – minimum release

  • We will launch the beta in Januari

20.020 -cold beers for the team

  •   Cheers

40.000 - android + IOS versions

  • We are going hire some extra muscle to make sure you can enjoy the game on your phone

50.000 - 4 extra country’s + tons of extra graphics

  •  More content for the game, we will be adding more country’s web + Phone apps

60.000 – more story lines, features, characters etc.

  •   More features for the game web + Phone apps

1.000.000 - our own organised crime syndicate

  • We have now enough to play the game IRL and get filthy rich together with all our backers

Funding

The project needs the Indiegogo funds to expand the core team.

The goal will help us pay for finishing the game our goal is to create a huge amount of art and code that this game demands.

Breakdown:

40% Visual content; illustration, models and animation.

30% Programming.

15% Sound design, soundtrack creation.

10%-15% Backer rewards.

5% Writing storylines and game content.

Contact us

If you have any questions please feel free to add us on skype or mail us at: info@shotcallersgame.com

story:
Whiteland has been plagued with violence between the Imperials and Barbarians for the past century. Draenneld Ostrek, leader of the Barbarians has been fighting for control over Whiteland in the hopes to dethrone the Imperial King and assume total control. 

King Gauteron, leader of the Imperial army has been fighting off the barbarians, still maintaining control over most of Whiteland, however due to political pressure and internal family struggles, confidence in the Monarchy is dwindling in the civilian community which is only aiding the Barbarian agenda.

However, there is caution to this tale… dark energy surrounds the land of Whiteland, unexplainible events are happening, some sort of unheard of dark magic is rising…

The open world is detailed full of 100s of monsters, wildlife and creatures.

story:
Shin Doraigo

 

 
Vertical Scrolling Shmups. You know them, you love them, right? Bullet Hell type games, in which you are rewarded by your reflexes and skills.

Shin Doraigo is a vertical shmups. With a twist, the game never ends, it only gets harders. If you want to achieve a high score, you have to risk yourself to achieve it. Featuring almost no power ups and plenty of enemies ready to kill you, Shin Doraigo is a old-school, barebones action vertical shmup. It can be overwhelming, but the sense of reward is great.
 
Hello there, i'm tibone. I like to make games in my spare time. Usually they are free and you can play them if you want.
 
 

UPDATED BETA VERSION NOW AVAILABLE TO ALL CONTRIBUTORS!

 

Game Modes

You can play in either a 2 minute Challenge, 5 minute Challenge or the timeless challenge.
 

Web Leaderboards

Impress your friends and show the world your highscores in the web leaderboards.
 
 

Web as Platform

Using the web as the platform, the game will run directly on your browser, so every OS capable of running Flash will be able to play the game.
 
 
 

What I Need & What You Get

Shin Doraigo is being developed in Stencyl. However the game is going beyond the scope of the free version, so i want to be able to buy the Pro version of Stencyl to get the game to fully work as intended.
 
Also, i want to be able to hire an artist. To have an HD version on Desktop PC, version that will be exclusive to all contributors.
 
So what i need:
- Stencyl paid version
- Hire an artist for HD graphics.
 
And you can help me, become a contributor today and get in on the shooting frenzy, with some exclusive rewards :
 
Baby Dragon - $1
- Exclusive PC Desktop Version and all future updates to the game on all platforms.

Dragon - $5
- Exclusive PC Desktop Version, all future updates to the game on all platforms.
- Immediate access to a exclusive developer forum.

Raging Dragon - $10
- Early Access to the exclusive PC Desktop Version, all future updates to the game on all platforms
- Immediate access to a exclusive developer forum.

Dragon Spirt - $20
 Early Access to the exclusive PC Desktop Version, all future updates to the game on all platforms
- Immediate access to a exclusive developer forum
- In-game credit in the funding credits.

Gold Dragon - $50
- Early Access to the exclusive PC Desktop Version, all future updates to the game on all platforms
- Immediate access to a exclusive developer forum
- In-game thanks in the Gold Contributor section of the game.
- In-Game thanks in the Gold Contibutor section of the site.
- Special subforum on the Developer forum.

 
 
------------

More than just one game.

 
Shin Doraigo is not alone. It can and it will be updated and modified on the future, and you can get exclusive access to these updates, and also to the developer forum, where not only Shin Doraigo is discussed but future projects (some already in the working) also. Ever wanted to help develop a videogame? Now you can!
 
Consider that you're getting access to opinate on more than one game.
Consider that you're helping make more than just one videogame. You're helping a developer.
 
Consider that you're helping a fellow gamer, someone who is passionated about videogames, who is a collector and who loves videogames.
 
That's who i am. A gamer, a collector, someone who is passionated about playing and making videogames.

 

------------

You can help by sharing this campaign and getting the word out.

Every little bit can help.

 

Gamers helping gamers making games, let's make this happen!
story_txt:
Shin Doraigo

 

 
Vertical Scrolling Shmups. You know them, you love them, right? Bullet Hell type games, in which you are rewarded by your reflexes and skills.

Shin Doraigo is a vertical shmups. With a twist, the game never ends, it only gets harders. If you want to achieve a high score, you have to risk yourself to achieve it. Featuring almost no power ups and plenty of enemies ready to kill you, Shin Doraigo is a old-school, barebones action vertical shmup. It can be overwhelming, but the sense of reward is great.

story:
About myself
  • I have been obsessed with video-games since the 1990's  , I have made various games over the years.
  • I want to make a full fledged Japanese style 2D RPG for Windows Systems.


About the game


  • The game "Legend of Aldenia" is set in a medieval world much like the worlds of Breath of Fire and Final Fantasy 6 , but will also have a few bit of Sci-Fi like the Phantasy Star games. The main charactor  must save the world from an evil group that is trying to destroy the world! The game will be a mix of classic 2D JRPG with some features of modern RPG such as quick travel and Day/Night cycles.
    The game is designed for Windows Systems but can be played on a Mac
    using Winebottler(Winebottler is a windows emulator for Mac).

  • Over 120 Hours of gameplay!
  • High Quality 16-Bit Graphics and Sound.

Project Outcomes

  • Even if the Project Goal is not meet I will continue to work on the game and fund the game myself. The funds raised from Indiegogo will be used to make the game and release it. 
  • All Contributors of $10 or more will receive a copy of the game.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can promote "Legend of Aldenia" using word of mouth and Facebook.

story:
What is a BetNPlay ?

It’s a chess game with added features of “Betting” /  “Challenging” and it is all about “WINNING $$$$”; an app which you could use to invite your friends or challenge anyone with "VIRTUAL CURRENCY" and win, while at the same time perusing your interest to play chess.  

Users would have to pay to purchase the App. after the initial free period.

What will BetNPlay Have to Offer?

•  An option to invite friends

•  Any player registering will get 2000 $ (Virtual Currency / points) to start with, and which the user could use to play and challenge opponents under the below category. 

•  An option to challenge anyone with real money, to play under the below categories:

     o  0 $ challenge

     o  10 $ challenge

     o  20 $ challenge

     o  50 $ challenge

     o   100 $ challenge

•  Rankings given to players based on the amount they win

•  Several modes of play 10 options of “Tile Set”, 10 options for “Piece set”, Animation modes with sound

•  Option to play in differnet time limits: 30 mins, 60 mins, 1 day, 2 days

•  Real time notification in whenever opponent makes a move

•  A tracking system to keep track of all the WINS / LOSS and the balance amount.

Why Do We Want to BetNPlay

•  As a regular chess players, we feel there is a need to “Challenge” and give users the feeling of winning, of having achievd something and thus reward them with V$ (Virtual Currency).  

•  Currently no other chess game provides such an option to its players.

•  We love the idea of creating an app which will allow players to win real V$, having fun together without breaking the bank.

•  The market surveys which we have done recently prove to us that there is a need in the market for such a game and we are sure to succeed.

Why We're Crowdfunding

•  Building a app costs a LOT of money, specially more if it is a gaming app.  I am putting lot of my own funds in and also getting investors on board, but also wanted to give the community the opportunity to supplement our funds.  This will help us to ensure I am making BetNPlay the best app for chess I possibly can

•  The $15,000 we're raising will help cover the cost of building the app, building the website and expanding our game with new features.

Funding Target Breakdown

  USD       List

12000

Building App

500

Basic website

1000

Business Registration

1500

Contingency & Marketing & Indiegogo Fee 

Risks & Challenges

Opening any business is always risky.  We've been working on the early stages of opening BetNPlay for almost 3 months and have become accustomed to the fact that things will very seldom go as planned, there were always be one more thing to do and its important to be flexible.  However, we've also put in a ton of time and research and done every thing we can to meet with people who know better than us to make sure we've accounted for all the pieces we need to complete in order to successfully open in the Fall of 2015.

To do away with the risk of "legality" we have opted to use Virtual Currency instead and then allow the user to redeem the virtual currency on the website for vouchers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you aren't in a place to contribute right now, doesn't mean you can't help:

•  Tell your friends!


Request for your support to create an exciting product !!

Thank you !!

story:
(Light effects not included)

(NOTE: Although Inidiegogo requires a minimum funding target of $500 for a campaign to be considered "successful," this is a "flexible-funding" campaign.  Even if we don't reach this arbitrary target, backers will still be billed at the end of the campaign, and all orders will still be fulfilled.)

Welcome to my 2nd Indiegogo campaign! Once again, I'm revisiting the papercraft concepts I initially presented in my second Kickstarter campaign, 3-D Fortress. While technically successful, this early campaign proved to be too ambitious, and for the most part, I ended up refunding my backers on that one.

You can see the original 3-D Fortress campaign HERE: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/worldswithin/3-d-fortress

Since then, 3-D Fortress has become the springboard for an ongoing series of smaller scale campaigns, including Fantasy Forest I and Fantasy Forest II. One by one, I've continued to develop each of those prototypal scenery pieces into finished products that I feel confident about releasing commercially.

This time, I'm putting out the first finished versions of the thatched-roof cottage model, and the barren tree model. These will be available together through this campaign, as my Village in the Woods combination set!

This campaign will be unlike the others in a few ways. It will be the first one in which I present my new and improved template for collapsible buildings and architecture, which I plan to adapt to more elaborate structures in the future. It's also the first campaign to be a full-fledged collaboration! Although I've used commissioned artwork in the past, this is the first time I'm working side by side with a dedicated artist. Justen Deluca is one of my oldest and closest friends, and a fellow gamer-geek I've been playing Magic cards, D&D, etc. off and on for almost 20 years now. He'll be contributing hand-painted artwork to this set, and will also be working as a production assistant. The Worlds Within sweatshop of one has just doubled in size!

While the basic concept art is more or less finished, backers will have the opportunity to give feedback and make suggestions before we go to the final print and production runs. This is also a bit of a first for my Kickstarter campaigns, and we're both greatly looking forward to hearing your thoughts and ideas, and bringing you the best possible scenery pieces we can!

As with all of my previous papercraft creations, each piece is hand-assembled from color-printed, laminated, machine-cut card stock, for a light but sturdy design. The laminated surfaces are wet and dry erasable, and each piece collapses quickly and easily into a flat configuration for travel and storage. All pieces come ready-to-use, and no painting or assembly is required!

The house model measures approximately 4"x4", and is about 3" tall. It includeds roof panels that can be propped open for a view of the interior, a chimney, a functional front door that can be opened or closed, and functional window shutters that can also be opened or closed.

The barren tree model follows the same general template as that used in Fantasy Forest I-III, but has a much more delicate and detailed cut pattern, and is thus more decorative than structural.

I hope you like what you see here! Thanks again for taking the time to check out my work!

-Mike Mitchell

Risks & Challenges

Another recent development I'd like to add here, is that I'm now pursuing game design and product development as a full-time, self-employed profession.  So although I've hit some snags with production and fulfillment deadlines in the past, I think that from here on in, that isn't going to be so much of an issue.  As I've also mentioned, I'm now fully splitting the production and fulfillment workload with my new collaborator and business partner.
