Short Summary
Star Wars: The Old Republic is a Massive Multiplayer Online Game (MMO) developed by Bioware. One the of the classes players can choose has been so poorly managed by the developers at Bioware that it has become nearly unplayable at the highest level of the game. The developers have ignored the warnings, evidence, and fixes offered by the community on SWTOR's official forums and we would like to send the message in a different way.


What We Need & What You Get
We want to deliver a message to the developers in the form of a cake, cookies, or other edible item. The message might be snarky, witty, plaintive, or plain. We just want Bioware to see how serious we are about this class imbalance being an issue in their game.
Each delivered cake would be about $85 and 3 dozen cake balls would be about $75. We will send as many items as we can afford based on donations, and those with perks will be able to make their choices well ahead of time.

story:
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Vector Scissors feature a unique flat edge design that allows you to cut perfectly straight lines every time.




The handle is designed with a lip that can grab the edge of a table using it as a guide

You start going forward and it glides along a sheet of paper slicing it perfectly apart.

You can also cut a right angle without measuring and drawing the angle by using the corner of a square table as a pivot.

As a result, you don't need to use a ruler and a pencil to pre-mark the cutting line, or use a blade with an under-plate in order to prevent scratching your tabletop.

They feel natural in the hand for any other cutting task. But whenever you need Vector will cut a straighter line than any other scissors.


Choose from five fancy colors


Main advantages

- Cutting curves and cutting straight with one tool

- Cutting length is not limited

- Comfortable an convenient to use


"Yet when to comes to the common task of cutting in a straight line, craftspeople would have little choice but to break out heavy-duty solutions like paper cutters. Concepts like the Vector Scissors..., may someday fill that void...

"Genius! Scissors have evolved slowly over the years ... Designer Tamás Fekete has sliced through millennia of shear repetition and designed a new pair of scissors…"

Vector Scissors are one of those designs that make you say “duh!” For the 99.9% of us who can’t cut a straight line, they make getting it right each time a cinch.


The early concept of Vector scissors was the end result of my first year project at the Moholy-Nagy University of Art and Design where I study at the faculty of product design. After the concept created quite a buzz around the web and a lot of people were interested in having Vector Scissors, we decided to make it become a real product!

Handcrafted in Hungary

The blades of Vector are handcrafted in Hungary. They are made of stainless steel from Solingen which are tempered, individually whetted and adjusted by hand. Therefore Vector scissors are not just precise, but  they are also beautiful pieces of craftsmanship.


But we need your help

We have a large connection of suppliers and manufacturers who are ready to start the manufacturing. Even though Vector Scissors look very simple, they are difficult to manufacture. They require a lot of stages and components are expensive. In order to make this project economically feasible, we need to begin the production with a minimum order number.

We would be paying the cost of materials, tools, production, packaging and shipping with the help of the collected funds. 


Risks & challenges

We are very confident and enthusiastic about Vector Scissors. We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. If we missed something, we will let you know and make it right as quickly as possible.

If we don't reach our funding goal or we stop below a critical amount, we will send back all of your contributions!

Minor changes may occur with the final design due to ergonomic and manufacturing requirements. It is absolutely mandatory for us to give you a product with the highest quality.

Component supply, manufacturing delay and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work very hard to quickly solve everything.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the campaign with your friends and encourage them to spread the word. One share can make a huge difference too.

If you have ideas for perks that you would like to see and contribute to, feel free to contact us, we would love to hear about it! Thank you for every help.

- The Vector Scissors team

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Copyright © 2013 Vector scissors. All rights reserved
story_txt:
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////Vector Scissors feature a unique flat edge design that allows you to cut perfectly straight lines every time.







The handle is designed with a lip that can grab the edge of a table using it as a guide




You start going forward and it glides along a sheet of paper slicing it perfectly apart.



You can also cut a right angle without measuring and drawing the angle by using the corner of a square table as a pivot.



As a result, you don't need to use a ruler and a pencil to pre-mark the cutting line, or use a blade with an under-plate in order to prevent scratching your tabletop.

They feel natural in the hand for any other cutting task. But whenever you need Vector will cut a straighter line than any other scissors.


Choose from five fancy colors









Main advantages

- Cutting curves and cutting straight with one tool
- Cutting length is not limited
- Comfortable an convenient to use




"Yet when to comes to the common task of cutting in a straight line, craftspeople would have little choice but to break out heavy-duty solutions like paper cutters. Concepts like the Vector Scissors..., may someday fill that void...

"Genius! Scissors have evolved slowly over the years ... Designer Tamás Fekete has sliced through millennia of shear repetition and designed a new pair of scissors…"

Vector Scissors are one of those designs that make you say “duh!” For the 99.9% of us who can’t cut a straight line, they make getting it right each time a cinch.


The early concept of Vector scissors was the end result of my first year project at the Moholy-Nagy University of Art and Design where I study at the faculty of product design. After the concept created quite a buzz around the web and a lot of people were interested in having Vector Scissors, we decided to make it become a real product!

Handcrafted in Hungary


The blades of Vector are handcrafted in Hungary. They are made of stainless steel from Solingen which are tempered, individually whetted and adjusted by hand. Therefore Vector scissors are not just precise, but  they are also beautiful pieces of craftsmanship.






But we need your help
We have a large connection of suppliers and manufacturers who are ready to start the manufacturing. Even though Vector Scissors look very simple, they are difficult to manufacture. They require a lot of stages and components are expensive. In order to make this project economically feasible, we need to begin the production with a minimum order number.
We would be paying the cost of materials, tools, production, packaging and shipping with the help of the collected funds. 



Risks & challenges

We are very confident and enthusiastic about Vector Scissors. We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. If we missed something, we will let you know and make it right as quickly as possible.

If we don't reach our funding goal or we stop below a critical amount, we will send back all of your contributions!
Minor changes may occur with the final design due to ergonomic and manufacturing requirements. It is absolutely mandatory for us to give you a product with the highest quality.
Component supply, manufacturing delay and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work very hard to quickly solve everything.


Other Ways You Can Help
Please share the campaign with your friends and encourage them to spread the word. One share can make a huge difference too.
If you have ideas for perks that you would like to see and contribute to, feel free to contact us, we would love to hear about it! Thank you for every help.
- The Vector Scissors team


////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Copyright © 2013 Vector scissors. All rights reserved

story:
Short Summary

Terry & I (Clinton) stumbled upon each other while beginning our game making journey on related forums. We found that our values, vision and thinking are very alike and decided to partner up to form a startup to make the creations in our minds.

Pariunos Entertainment is our startup that concentrates on making mobile games. We try to make our artwork attractive, kids friendly and aim at making fun games with less blood. Our targeted audience are children, teenagers and young adults. And apart from making mobile apps, we wish to make our creations a part of our player’s lives by building a brand they will come to love.

It has been our thoughts that we wish to launch a game for each big festive occasion so that people can enjoy their time while traveling around or if they have nothing to do during these days.

Our idea “No Dracula” came up due to the upcoming Halloween as well as a new Dracula movie coming out in October. As mentioned before, our games are aimed at a younger group so all our artwork are cute and simple and the gameplay design are also simple to grasp. Having said that our game will be hard to master and will hopefully be having monthly updates to keep players coming back for more by growing the content.

The game will be free to download with in-app purchases to help players out when it gets too hard.

At the moment, our game is in demo stage in which the link is available here. The demo is only available for devices with touch screens. Best tested on smartphones.


Terry與我(Clinton)對製作遊戲都有濃厚興趣，我們在相關的網上討論區上認識對方。我們發覺大家的價值觀、願景‏及思維都相約，於是我們便合作把心中的構思製作成遊戲。

一等娛樂(Pariunos Entertainment)的成立是在於專注手機遊戲的製作。我們理念是會創作畫面吸引、受兒童歡迎及一些沒有血腥暴力的遊戲。我們的目標市場是小朋友、少年和年青成年人。在製作遊戲之餘，我們都希望我們的創作能夠成為每個玩家都愛戴的品牌。

我們的構思是想在每個重要節日都能夠推出相關的遊戲，令玩家在旅行中或百無聊賴的時候可以享受遊戲的樂趣。

我們創作遊戲“No Dracula”的構思是由於萬聖節將到，而且10月也會有一齣關於德古拉的電影會上映。以上提及過，我們的遊戲的目標是較年輕的市場，所以圖像走簡單可愛路線而玩法也容易上手。話雖如此，遊戲是易學難精的。我們希望每月都能提供更新讓玩家繼續會玩這遊戲。

遊戲是免費下載的，備有軟件內付費內容能幫助玩家通過難度高的關數。

現時我們的遊戲還在試玩階段，你可在此下載試玩版。試玩版只支援有觸控輸入的裝置，建議在智能手機上試玩。


What We Need & What You Get

Because we're a startup, this is our first proper project and we hope we can get help from all interested players to support us through crowdfunding.  We have very limited resources for our startup, so we wish to raise some funds using this method as well as to gain some exposure for what we're doing.

The game is actually quite simple to make for a professional programmer. Maybe take them a few days to complete everything. For us, since we're amateurs it will probably take us one or two months, which will be past the Halloween period. That is why we'll leave it to the professionals, but at a cost.

We also need to raise funds for marketing the game once it's done and there really isn't a limit to the amount of marketing that needs to be done to any product or service. But as our first project, we're happy to get 100,000 downloads. So apart from the supporters from indiegogo we would most likely promote our game via Facebook ads, YouTube ads, etc.


We're looking to raise $5000 USD in which  more than half will be for making the perks and sending them out. Some parts of it will be deducted from PayPal and Indiegogo for their services. The rest of the funds will be used on marketing our game out & hiring part-time helpers to manage the marketing aspects of our game.


The perks available for supporters include stickers, T-Shirts & Glow-In-Dark T-Shirts with our designs on them. Some of them will be limited editions that will only be available on our Indiegogo project and never to be made again.

因我們剛剛起步，這是首個正式作品，我們希望感興趣的玩家可以藉著群眾集資平台來支助我們。我們只有有限的資源來起動，所以我們希望用此方法募集資金及爭取多點曝光率。

對專業程式編寫員來說，這遊戲其實是很容易製作，可能幾天就可以完成。但對業餘的我們來說，可能要用上一兩個月的時間，到時萬聖節都已經過去了。所以我們要交給專業的人員製作，但這是有成本的。

遊戲完成後我們也需要透過集資得來的資金來做營銷推廣，一般產品或服務的營銷金額可以是無上限的‏。但以我們的首個遊戲來說，如能達到十萬次下載已很滿意。所以除了在Indiegogo的支持者外，我們應會投放資金於Facebook及Youtube廣告等地方。

我們希望能募集到5000美元，其中超過一半資金會用作製作及寄出津貼禮品。當中一部份花費是Paypal及Indiegogo的服務費。其餘的資金會是用於遊戲的營銷推廣及聘請兼職員工來處理營銷推廣方面的事務。
計劃支助者的津貼禮品包括有我們設計的貼紙、T恤及夜光版T恤。當中有些會是Indiegogo計劃的限量版，以後不會再生產的。

貼紙支持者 (Nothing in return support)

雖然寫是沒回報，其實是有的，我們會在Facebook專頁列出您及其他無論支助多少的支持者名字，並附上真誠的感謝。而且我們當遊戲正式推出時會電郵寄出一張手機螢幕壁紙給您。

貼紙支持者 (Sticker Supporter)

除了會把您名字放在Facebook專頁的感謝名單上，我們更會寄出限量版貼紙（實體貼紙）以表謝意，而且您更會得到在$2支助計劃裡面的手機螢幕壁紙。

T恤支持者 (T-Shirt Supporter)

以此金額的支助，我們會在Facebook專頁向您表示衷心感謝，更會送出您要求尺碼的T恤（有小童尺碼），T恤圖像可以2選1。價錢已包括包裝及送貨。T恤圖案及尺碼會在募集資金計劃完結後以電郵確定。

夜光版T恤支持者 (Glow-In-Dark T-Shirt Supporter)

以此金額的支助，我們會在Facebook專頁向您表示衷心感謝，更會送出您要求尺碼的夜光版T恤（有小童尺碼），T恤圖像可以2選1。價錢已包括包裝及送貨。T恤圖案及尺碼會在募集資金計劃完結後以電郵確定。

家庭裝 T恤支持者 (Family pack T-Shirt sponsor)

以此金額的支助，我們會在Facebook專頁向您表示衷心感謝，更送您4張貼紙和4件您要求尺碼的T恤（有小童尺碼），T恤圖像可以2選1。價錢已包括包裝及送貨。T恤圖案及尺碼會在募集資金計劃完結後以電郵確定。



Risks & Challenges

In regards to our game development, there really aren't many risks. The only challenge is to market the game out to enough people in order to bring more income in for the team to continually update new content to keep players interested.

On the other hand, the perks aren't something that will create technological issues. We will personally check each and every one of the T-Shirts before packing them and sending them to supporters to ensure there are no major issues with them.

關於遊戲開發，是沒有存在任何風險因素的。唯一的挑戰就是要推廣遊戲去到足夠的人群為我們帶來收入，藉此可以讓我們製作更多遊戲更新，使遊戲保持樂趣。

另外，津貼禮品亦不會有技術上的問題。我們會親手監管每一件將會寄出的T恤，確保沒有問題然後才會寄出給計劃支助者。


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people might not be able to help us financially even if they wanted to, either because they don't have a credit card, Paypal account or other reasons. But you can also contribute by sharing our project via Facebook or other social media you use. This way, others can also try to help while getting quality goods in return.

我們明白有些人就算想用金錢支助也未必能支付到，比如沒有信用卡、Paypal帳戶問題或其他種種原因。但你也可以付出貢獻如在Facebook或其他社交平台分享我們這個集資計劃。這樣其他人都可以幫助我們而又可以得到高品質的商品。

story:
We successfully raised money to develop and publish our game. Now thanks to Indiegogo InDemand you can join The Wild Eight's backers community and help us reach updated Stretch Goals!

The Wild Eight is a co-op survival game with a mysterious storyline featuring a procedurally-generated world. Coming Fall 2016 for Windows, Mac, and Linux with XBOX One and Playstation 4 later on.

 

 

 

 

 

The game tells the story of eight people whose everyday lives are forever changed after a horrific plane crash. They now find themselves stranded in the middle of nowhere, deep in the forests of Alaska. Welcome to a world without civilization, where you and the other survivors are at the mercy of nature — and wild animals starved by the cold!

 

 

While the survivors await rescue, their lives are threatened by a number of mysterious entities, unseen creatures and objects that definitely don’t belong in this world. And the deeper you go, the harder it gets to survive. Through the storyline you’ll desperately try to reach help on the radio, but no one’ll answer you. Something is wrong here. In here is no room for mistakes: if you went hunting but forgot to cut some wood for the fire before nightfall, you’re dead. If you didn’t have time to cook your meat, you might have to eat it raw — and if you don’t have medicine, you’ll surely die from food poisoning. To stay alive, you’ll need to scavenge and craft like a pro.

 

 

You can play The Wild Eight on your own, but the game fully opens up in co-op mode. Other players are your only backup — either by sharing resources or covering your back! Even if you were mauled by wolves and "you died" appears onscreen, your teammate can still resuscitate you with a defibrillator (which are very rare to find, by the way).

  • Release Date: December 2016 (Steam) 
  • Languages: English, Spanish, German, French, Russian, Japanese
  • Platforms: Windows, Linux, Mac, Xbox One, PlayStation 4
  • Website: thewildeight.com

 

 

 

 

 A Mysterious World Outside Time and Space

 

 

The game world is a little like a chessboard. It’s made out of tiles, and each of them is unique. At the start of the game, every tile is used to randomly generate a new world and distinct locations for each quest.

 

 

Time here moves fast: Temperature drops as it gets darker (you’ll need a bonfire!), and you’ll also need to secure some food if you intend to survive until morning. Weather varies from sunny to severe storms, with duration and intensity randomly decided by the game engine.

Are They All Friends?

 

 

Survive and explore the forest side by side with other players or go solo. Cooperation is the right way to face this harsh world — that is, until a psycho is revealed to be part of the group! Will he or she go for the prize... or taste human flesh?

Survival is Not a Given

 

 

Death is at every corner — especially hunger and cold. Make sure to secure a constant supply of food by hunting or gathering, and spend time to cook it so that you stay healthy and warm.

New Skills = Better Chances

 

 

Leveling up is represented by linear categories, which are divided by related quests. Just as in real life, if someone suddenly turns away from civilization, he or she has to start by learning the basics: how to make a fire, how to navigate the woods, and how to craft armor, spears, bows — along with more sophisticated tools and weapons.

Crafting is the Only Way to Stay Alive

 

There are two types of crafting: on the go, and at the workshop. You can build base equipment like flares or basic weapons on the go. At the workshop, you have more resources: it is now possible to create and upgrade complicated objects such as custom backpacks, traps, bandages, and lots of other useful trinkets.

 

Motivation

 

The game’s plot is divided into a main campaign and additional quests. You can finish the game without completing a single side quest; however, side quests are essential if you want to have a shot at a happy ending. 

We’ll split the story into three; each one will be associated with the current location. When the location of the main story is initially generated, the location of all side quests will be randomly defined — placing key events in locations equally distant from one another.

Your Choice: Killing Vs. Running

 

 

The game features two types of creatures: passive and aggressive. Passive are animals that don’t want to harm you. These are the easiest to hunt for: rabbits, deer, wild boars, etc. Passive behavior can also differ; for example, rabbits run away when you approach, while boars always try to fight back.

 

 

Aggressive animals can and will kill you in a head-to-head scramble. You’ll need to run or kill them with a good weapon. Keep in mind that even one bite might ruin everything; you’ll start to bleed immediately and there is only one chance to stay alive: bandaging yourself.

 

 

The soundtrack plays a key role in conveying the emotional undertones of the game to players. We are currently working on the main theme, which you'll hear during gameplay at different times.

Here are a couple of tracks hosted on Soundcloud:

 

  • Imperception // Main Theme
  • Go far, go wide // Snow desert

A vertical layering interactive music system maximizes player immersion in The Wild Eight. Music will be composed of different layers, which can be switched on and off depending on what’s taking place in-game.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

In August 2015, we were about to make a racing game with guns (like Twisted Metal), but we decided that it would be best to make a game based on life itself. Our life, that is — something that we remember from childhood. So in September, we assembled a team of eight people. Each of us had previous experience in game development, so we knew what to do and what it took to ship a game. We were ready to work late, get almost no sleep, work on weekends — and fully devote ourselves to the game. 

 

 

By the end of 2015, we came up with the core gameplay loop and made it into a a small demo with all the necessary design elements and 3D models. We spent all of January getting ready for the first announcement, which took place on February 11th. Today we have already reached alpha. We're now working on multiplayer, quests, animations, and more — which is why we need your help!

 

 

 

8 Points was founded in 2015. We’re all from different studios, where many of us had been working on casual games. We quickly realized our passion was not with casual titles, but for deeply immersive experiences — which led the team to The Wild Eight!

 

 

Our team consists of 9 developers: 4 programmers, 3 artists, CEO, and CMO. We live in one of the strangest and coldest places on Earth: It’s called Yakutia, where people eat bears for breakfast, develop games for lunch, and gather firewood for dinner — because electricity is too expensive. Who else would know anything about surviving in the wild if not us?

 

 

“When I first was told about The Wild Eight, I was expecting another cookie-cutter indie game, but this is definitely something different. One of the good ones. It’s got many components of a standout game - stylish graphics, captivating atmosphere, a compelling narrative hook, mysteries that beg to be investigated, and heavy consequences for player choices. I don’t play games often anymore, but this is one of the few that has my mouth watering.”

– Zach Hanks, Voice Actor & Director

 

 

Whether you’ve backed us or not, we want to sincerely thank you your interest in our project. We are constantly working on the game and would love to share some interesting news through our social networks. Looking forward to seeing you take part in The Wild Eight communities on Facebook and Twitter!
story_txt:
We successfully raised money to develop and publish our game. Now thanks to Indiegogo InDemand you can join The Wild Eight's backers community and help us reach updated Stretch Goals!
The Wild Eight is a co-op survival game with a mysterious storyline featuring a procedurally-generated world. Coming Fall 2016 for Windows, Mac, and Linux with XBOX One and Playstation 4 later on. 

 
 
 
 
The game tells the story of eight people whose everyday lives are forever changed after a horrific plane crash. They now find themselves stranded in the middle of nowhere, deep in the forests of Alaska. Welcome to a world without civilization, where you and the other survivors are at the mercy of nature — and wild animals starved by the cold!
 
 
While the survivors await rescue, their lives are threatened by a number of mysterious entities, unseen creatures and objects that definitely don’t belong in this world. And the deeper you go, the harder it gets to survive. Through the storyline you’ll desperately try to reach help on the radio, but no one’ll answer you. Something is wrong here. In here is no room for mistakes: if you went hunting but forgot to cut some wood for the fire before nightfall, you’re dead. If you didn’t have time to cook your meat, you might have to eat it raw — and if you don’t have medicine, you’ll surely die from food poisoning. To stay alive, you’ll need to scavenge and craft like a pro.
 
 
You can play The Wild Eight on your own, but the game fully opens up in co-op mode. Other players are your only backup — either by sharing resources or covering your back! Even if you were mauled by wolves and "you died" appears onscreen, your teammate can still resuscitate you with a defibrillator (which are very rare to find, by the way).



Release Date: December 2016 (Steam) 

Languages: English, Spanish, German, French, Russian, Japanese

Platforms: Windows, Linux, Mac, Xbox One, PlayStation 4

Website: thewildeight.com


 
 
 
 
 A Mysterious World Outside Time and Space
 
 
The game world is a little like a chessboard. It’s made out of tiles, and each of them is unique. At the start of the game, every tile is used to randomly generate a new world and distinct locations for each quest.
 
 
Time here moves fast: Temperature drops as it gets darker (you’ll need a bonfire!), and you’ll also need to secure some food if you intend to survive until morning. Weather varies from sunny to severe storms, with duration and intensity randomly decided by the game engine.
Are They All Friends?
 
 
Survive and explore the forest side by side with other players or go solo. Cooperation is the right way to face this harsh world — that is, until a psycho is revealed to be part of the group! Will he or she go for the prize... or taste human flesh?
Survival is Not a Given
 
 
Death is at every corner — especially hunger and cold. Make sure to secure a constant supply of food by hunting or gathering, and spend time to cook it so that you stay healthy and warm.
New Skills = Better Chances
 
 
Leveling up is represented by linear categories, which are divided by related quests. Just as in real life, if someone suddenly turns away from civilization, he or she has to start by learning the basics: how to make a fire, how to navigate the woods, and how to craft armor, spears, bows — along with more sophisticated tools and weapons.

There are two types of crafting: on the go, and at the workshop. You can build base equipment like flares or basic weapons on the go. Motivation

 
The game’s plot is divided into a main campaign and additional quests. You can finish the game without completing a single side quest; however, side quests are essential if you want to have a shot at a happy ending. 
We’ll split the story into three; each one will be associated with the current location. When the location of the main story is initially generated, the location of all side quests will be randomly defined — placing key events in locations equally distant from one another.
Your Choice: Killing Vs. Running
 
 
The game features two types of creatures: passive and aggressive. Passive are animals that don’t want to harm you. These are the easiest to hunt for: rabbits, deer, wild boars, etc. Passive behavior can also differ; for example, rabbits run away when you approach, while boars always try to fight back.
 
 
Aggressive animals can and will kill you in a head-to-head scramble. You’ll need to run or kill them with a good weapon. Keep in mind that even one bite might ruin everything; you’ll start to bleed immediately and there is only one chance to stay alive: bandaging yourself.
 
 
The soundtrack plays a key role in conveying the emotional undertones of the game to players. We are currently working on the main theme, which you'll hear during gameplay at different times.
Here are a couple of tracks hosted on Soundcloud:
 

Imperception // Main Theme
Go far, go wide // Snow desert

A vertical layering interactive music system maximizes player immersion in The Wild Eight. Music will be composed of different layers, which can be switched on and off depending on what’s taking place in-game.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
In August 2015, we were about to make a racing game with guns (like Twisted Metal), but we decided that it would be best to make a game based on life itself. Our life, that is — something that we remember from childhood. So in September, we assembled a team of eight people. Each of us had previous experience in game development, so we knew what to do and what it took to ship a game. We were ready to work late, get almost no sleep, work on weekends — and fully devote ourselves to the game. 
 
 
By the end of 2015, we came up with the core gameplay loop and made it into a a small demo with all the necessary design elements and 3D models. Pretending to be rock stars in front of the famous Lena Pillars 
Our team consists of 9 developers: 4 programmers, 3 artists, CEO, and CMO. We live in one of the strangest and coldest places on Earth: It’s called Yakutia, where people eat bears for breakfast, develop games for lunch, and gather firewood for dinner — because electricity is too expensive. Who else would know anything about surviving in the wild if not us?

I don’t play games often anymore, but this is one of the few that has my mouth watering.”
– Zach Hanks, Voice Actor & Director

story:
An idea comes to life

Daniel Solis and Terry South are the founders of CGA, the Classic Gaming Association. The CGA was created just over a year ago to bring people and classic arcade games together. The CGA does this thru free public events and monthly meet ups in our own facility. That, in turn, is sponsored by  Arcade Wizards, which does service and repair for classic cabinets.

We knew right away we needed room to do the work and a place the public could meet with access to our classic games so the CGA could get off the ground. Arcade Wizards allowed the CGA to be born. But, the building we have cannot accommodate all the classic arcade games and the monthly meet ups since the CGA attendance has outgrown our facility. A larger building is needed and access to the games by the public more often than once a month. Necessity gave way to the creation of Z82. To both have a building for the restored games and daily access for the public.

Daniel Solis is a 20 year veteran of the amusement industry. He is a restoration specialist and historian who knows what the classics should look and play like.

Terry South is a 35 year veteran of the amusement industry who is board level in repair of classic arcade games. He strives to return these games to full glory.

  • We are building a Retrocade here in the Central Arkansas area. We have purchased 115 classic arcade machines over the past year. 50 of our machines are in working condition with 10 games already totally completed. We are proactive. You can see our work in youtube videos on the Z82 Retrocade channel. We really can do this.
  • Your contributions help with restorations, repairs and prep for the Grand Opening and the high cost of materials to complete the work.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funding we need is $45,000. This will cover the cost of materials for not only restorations and repairs but, renovations to the building bringing everything up to code ensuring the safety of our guests and making sure the Retrocade sustains itself from opening day.
  • The gift for your contribution is more than a way for us to say thank you. It will allow you to enjoy your investement and experience why it's important.
  • Even if we don't reach our funding goal, the materials your contributions will make possible will put us ahead of schedule.

A new twist on a great idea

This is our philosophy. Don't just buy some old machines for a few hundred dollars and line the walls of a building with games in dismay. Take the time to hunt down the classic machines that everyone really enjoys playing, repair and restore them to look and play like they were intended. Back that up with a fully emersive atmosphere to captivate the imagination of all ages with sights and sounds that will bring the building to life and provide a safe family friendly destination, that's what we will do.

  • We have the talent and skills to complete this project so we combined our efforts and resources to do something either of us on our own could not have achieved. There are not many people who can repair these classics correctly.
  • In our lifetime, we have restored dozens of classic machines and will use all the experience we have brought to the table to really deliver the WOW Factor. This has really been a labor of love for us. Being veterans of the amusement industry we both feel a strong commitment to keep these games up and running for future generations to enjoy.
  • We just need a boost to get our doors open. It's for everyone in our community. For the gamers. For the World. We've both had the option to make more money. We've been there and done that. If we don't do this, we're going to regret it.

Everyone can help

We realize not everyone can contribute financially, but you can tell everybody you know about us, what we've done and our dedication to making this a reality for all.

  • Tell friends, co-workers, let us know what you think. Go visit our website:
  • CGAUSA.ORG and visit us on facebook: Classic Gaming Association
  • Tell everyone where to find us at Indiegogo

Thank you for investing your time in us and our work. Please Contribute. We are giving this everything we have. We can do this, and hope you see that we can too.

Everyone can help
We realize not everyone can contribute financially, but you can tell everybody you know about us, what we've done and our dedication to making this a reality for all.

Tell friends, co-workers, let us know what you think. Go visit our website:
CGAUSA.ORG and visit us on facebook: Classic Gaming Association
Tell everyone where to find us at Indiegogo


Thank you for investing your time in us and our work. Please Contribute. We are giving this everything we have. We can do this, and hope you see that we can too.

story:
Update: STRETCH GOAL! 

   We broke the $1000 funding goal in 4 hours! This is awesome. Thank you for your support!

   If we break $2500, then another weapon will be added to the game. After the campaign I will send a survey out to each backer to determine which weapon should be featured in the HEMA game expansion.

The choices will be:
A. Dussack / Messer
B. Singlestick 
C. Rapier 
D. Sword and Buckler

The Longsword part of the game will be finished first and released. The expansion will be released at a later date.

Short Summary

 Our goal is to try and capture that good old SNES style and combine it with a combat system based on Historical European Martial Arts. Characters are based on real HEMA practitioners! Equipment is based on real HEMA gear! Fighting moves are based on real Longsword techniques!

The Mirror Sword Combat System


   As a HEMA practitioner and a  retro game enthusiast, I have taken it upon myself to create a historically influenced combat system. I call this combat system "The Mirror Sword System". The Mirror Sword system is based on the Liechtenauer tradition of the late Medieval period. Use 3 guards, bind your opponent and use mastercuts. Button mashing will not help you here! To win you must learn to use the appropriate technique at the correct time. 

What We Need & What You Get

   I hope to release the game as a free game by Summer 2016 (Sooner if all goes well). Most of the art and design of the game is finished. However there is still alot of work needed to finish and polish the game. To make the Summer 2016 goal I will need at least $1000 to help fund development. 

   We have some exciting backer rewards. For $35 I will make a pixel version of you and put you in the game! 

The Impact

   The HEMA Longsword Tournament game is a test run for the Mirror Sword Combat System. If all goes well I will use this historically based combat system for a larger game in the future. 

   Additionally I am active in a few online Indie Game Developer communities. I  hope to spread HEMA awareness to other Video Game Developers. As a video game enthusiast I am often let down by the lack of realism in video game combat systems.  HEMA is making bigger splashes in the entertainment world than ever before. Currently I can think of 3 other video games that incorporate some type of realism into their combat systems. I hope to help continue this trend!

Risks & Challenges

   Currently I am not a professional developer. I do this as a hobby and balance a full time job, a marriage and an obsession with HEMA. I will finish this project, but delays are possible. The amount of money I raise will help determine how quickly I can finish development. 

Other Ways You Can Help

   If you would like to help this campaign, then please help spread the word! You can share our posts on Facebook or other social media sites.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MirrorSwordGame/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/MirrorSwordGame

Special Thanks:

Harry Williams for providing the awesome music for the trailer. You can find him on twitter here: https://twitter.com/hwilliamsaudio

Michael Sims for providing advice and helping along the way.

Also Special thanks to all the HEMA folks who have let me put them into the game:

Amanda Trail

Axel Pettersson

Ben Floyd

Ben Strickling

Carl Ryrberg

Dustin Reagan

Erik Bailey

Eric Wiggins

Jake Norwood

Jessica Finley

Joe Brassey

Kiana Shurkin

Mike Edelson

Natasha Darce'

Richard Marsden

Ties Kool

Rebecca Glass

Sam Street

story:
What is Terrabeats ?

Well Terrabeats is a music and rhythm based colourful game for mobile devices. My goal was to make a different and fun game with simple yet exciting design. I always thought that there are not enough games with an original idea and I thought maybe I could make a game that it's different than the others even if it's not much. So that's how I started making the Terrabeats and I'm really happy with the ongoing process. But there are things that I can't deal alone and that's why I'm asking you to help me because when we go out and see a person playing this game we will all be proud that we were a part of making this game a reality.


What needs to be done ?

Terrabeats is still in very early development process and there are still many things to be taking care of that I can't do it alone. Need of making the final version of the game is roughly 1200$ for the things like Creating a music, graphical designs, licenses and things like that. Contributors are going to be given perks that I think pretty awesome. Every contributors that helped out higher than 20$ will their names be listed in the credits section, there are perks for advertisement and check them out if you want to promote yourself or your company. Every little help this game get one step closer we get to making it real I will try my best but if we don't get enough help it will be pretty hard to keep it together and it will take longer to finish.


Worst case scenario

Worst case scenario is that I will loose everything and live in the streets with a long and dirty beard although this scenario is not about the game and just my worst case scenario. Although I will try to publish the game with everything I've got it will be pretty hard for me to do it without the help I get from you guys. Other than that I don't think there will be any problems that we can't deal with together.

What else can you do ?

What do cool kids use to chat these days I don't know but if you have friends that love play with their phones until their charge reaches zero I would be really happy if you shared this with them. And if you are like me and have no friends whatsoever you can still share this with strangers and maybe you like each other... You can be my friend too... I mean if you want to... Just saying...

story:
COMPLETE: Thank you everyone for getting us to where we did. Though we didn't reach our full goal we had enough to order some new patches and shirts, which are all going to look fantastic. As a thank you we will be sending out our best looking patches to those of you who contributed, as for everyone else, the new patches will now be available on our website.

Thank you again and we'll be posting pictures of the new patches and the printing shop proofs for all of you!

Our Facebook page:

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Pixel-Patch/201458453240861 

The gameplay video:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPj2IKOVHXQ&feature=plcp

Our Website:

http://www.pixelpatch.webs.com

Pictures of our epic patches and incentives:

 http://www.indiegogo.com/pixelpatch?c=gallery&a...

 

Pixel Patch is a new company offering unique RPG products for the gamer and non-gamer alike. Combining old school epic with new ideas, Pixel Patch brings the game to the real world. We've approached a few stores with our products and the customers have loved it, so we decided it was time to bring our products to the greater gamer scene: the World Wide Web!

 

Pixel Patch creates high quality, well-priced RPG patches. Harkening back to 8-bit days, these patches include standards like Speed, Health, Attack and Defense, as well as specialized additions like Charisma and Frost Defense. Each patch can be ironed or sewed onto a wide variety of surfaces, including but certainly not limited to hoodies, hats, backpacks and bags, coats, and even shoes!

 Image Gallery: http://www.indiegogo.com/pixelpatch?c=gallery&a...

There are two sets of patches available through Pixel Patch; Incognito and Full. Incognito patches are simpler black and white patches for a more subtle approach, while Full patches radiate the awesomeness of full color and unique design. So, whether you are an avid and proud gamer or a subtle fan of the RPG and 8-bit worlds, there is a patch for you!

The benefits of Pixel Patch are multifaceted. Answering the dilemma of limited and expensive gamer-wear. Pixel Patch brings a cheap alternative to pricey t-shirts and gear with patches ranging from a couple of dollars to five or six dollars. In addition, the patch format allows for ultimate customizability and reusability.

 

A large portion of the funds raised here will help us advertise in places like boardgamegeek.com and on other popular gaming sites. We'll also be firing up a database so we can get our shop off ebay and allow us to work everything internally, which means we can have awesome sales and combo packs made for you guys.

In addition the money will greatly assist in funding new patch designs, such as health and speed:

 

 

 .

 

 

We have a lot of extra goals and gifts in mind, so if we reach our $2200 goal we won't turn away donations. Every penny goes towards new designs, company expansion and advertising, and possible pixelated projects beyond patches.

Check out our knight here below to keep track with us as funds are raised.  He will encounter new quests as donations come in, and each time he reaches a new area he will defeat the boss and the loot will go directly to you donators! The higher you’re donation level the more likely you are to receive bonus loot!

 

Mirror Self: 2200$ - Stamped bandage healing item with every donation level! (still locked)

Great Boar: 4400$  (Locked)

Goblin King: 6600$  (Locked)

Giant of Legend: 8800$  (Locked)

 

Each donation will receive a PDF copy of our RPG game, which we will be selling at 10$ once our fundraiser is complete.

When you receive the RPG game, you’re not just receiving a game, but a work of art. We’ve worked hard to make each rulebook chapter unique and artistically pleasing, ensuring that your contribution will be worthwhile.

The game itself is a basic RPG, starting with a battle system, but expanding into full quests as we get to work on co-operative adventures. Using a standard deck of 52 cars, it can be played by 2-6 players. We wanted to keep things are simple as possible for you so all you really need is a pad of paper and some cards to play, but if you want to go all out, you can print up all the components that will come with the game files in order to create a sweet looking board game out of it.

And of course each of our products grants you boosts that you can use in battle!

 

The Pixel RPG is a School themed RPG in which you can ascend through the various ranks by passing ‘exams’ and gaining school certificates, similar to the standard RPG jobs of warrior, thief and archer. The entrance exam determines your personal stats, your characters strengths and weaknesses.

 The game is played in rounds, with each round consisting of drawing cards that deal damage to your opponent. The game ends when a player’s health reaches 0. At this point, experience points are handed out, which allow you to level up, boosting your original stats from your entrance exam.

This game is all about getting to know you opponent, figuring out when he’s going to take risks and saving you special abilities for that one perfect opening.

You can view a quick demo of the gameplay here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPj2IKOVHXQ&...

 

 

We have a lot of really cool incentives for our donators. Each one is not only unique and awesome on its own, but also gives boosts in our RPG game, helping you draw more cards, do more damage, etc.

 

Patches:

Donators will be receiving various patches ranging from our first set of black and white, to the newest full color Speed and Health patches seen above.

 

Health Regen Shirt:

The t-shirt, printed by the awesome people down at Forward Printing (http://www.forwardprinting.com/), is made using a method of printing called "discharge” which burns the ink onto the shirt and makes it look like natural cotton. The design isn’t half bad either!

http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/232/shirtl...

*Note: Make sure to specify your shirt size when you order or you will receive a Large.

 

Santa vs Narwhal:

Drawn up by Calgary artist, Maria Dillman, this awesome and random piece is available as a print when you donate 60$ or more. If you get the highest level upgrade you will get the signed inked original! We’re totally stoked at how awesome this piece is and we know that it will be a great addition to anyone’s wall.

Print dimensions: 8.5” x 11

 

Earphones:

Kindly donated by a friend of Pixel Patch, the BOSE earphones offer an audible experience unlike any other. Listening to your favorite tracks and chip tunes has never sounded so good! You can view all the specs on them here:

http://store.apple.com/ca/product/H2771VC/A

 

So there you have it, we hope you love these patches as much as we do! Thank you for you support and enthusiasm as we strive to keep Pixel Patch high quality and affordable.

If you can’t donate we ask that you ‘like’ this page AND our company page:

 http://www.facebook.com/pages/Pixel-Patch/201458453240861

That way we can bring this product to more great gamers. The more people know, the more we can grow!

Thank you for your time,

Sincerely,

JP Giguere,

Pixel Patch Overlord
story_txt:

As a thank you we will be sending out our best looking patches to those of you who contributed, as for everyone else, the new patches will now be available on our website.Thank you again and we'll be posting pictures of the new patches and the printing shop proofs for all of you!Our Facebook page:
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Pixel-Patch/201458453240861 
The gameplay video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPj2IKOVHXQ&feature=plcp
Our Website:

story:
EPICA REX RESOURCES

http://www.facebook.com/EpicaRex

Otherworld Portal - http://otherworldgame.com/news/

Epica Rex Track "By Yourself", DJ Orician (@Orician on Twitter)

https://soundcloud.com/barryvandijk/by-yourself-epica-rex

Mr360Game (Double)'s Reddit Post (Upvote it!)

Reddit Link

 

 

WHAT IS EPICA REX?

"Project Epica Rex" (The working title, which very loosely means 'The King of Stories") is a multiplayer sandbox RPG system.  It is not an MMO, but rather a multiplayer experience.  Each person who has a copy of Epica Rex will be able to join existing worlds, or run their very own world.  It is styled in  retro-2D pixel sprites using an isometric perspective.

Since players get to run their own worlds, the goals and situations upon each world are totally up to the owner of that server.

Players will be able to explore, adventure, collect, own land, build structures, form alliances, politic for control, and possibly go to war with others.  The possibilities are nearly endless.

Characters in Epica Rex will be able to select from a multitude of skills that will help them collect resources, craft and build, fight off threats or just make life easier.  Currently the list of skills is nearing about 220, which doesn't even include special abilities, spells or implants.

DESIGN INFLUENCES

Ultima Series, Ultima Online, Age of Wonders, Fallout Series, Dwarf Fortress, Minecraft, Dungeons of Dredmore (and many other roguelikes), Terraria

ROGUELIKE

Epica Rex will feature dungeons, labyrinths, caves, ruins, military bases, and defunct labs which are randomly generated much like any roguelike game.

THE AGES

Eventually Epica Rex will span four ages, which will be released as the game is developed further.

The Archaic Age : An age of low technology, and high magic.  The first of the four ages.

The Steam Age: Gadgetry, top hats, and gunpowder!  The second age to be developed.

The Modern Age: Introducing electricity and electronics, advanced weapons and building materials.

The Future Age: Lasers, Teleporters and Robotics.  The most advanced building materials are introduced.

Administrators of worlds will be able to pick and choose what they want out of any age, or enable or disable the specific features, skills and abilities.

WORLDS AND EDITOR

While the worlds are randomly generated, the game will feature a world editor where administrators can build the world they want to run!

 

FUNDING BREAKDOWN

The hope for Epica Rex is to release the first age, and thus the game by the end of 2013.  This is a tentitive date and depends on many factors.  Between now and then there will be a testing period.

The funding recieved will help:

  • Pay for entry onto Steam's Project Greenlight 
  • Pay for small account advertising
  • Legal and Copywright
  • Language Localization
  • Pay for music talent to add atmosphere to the game.
  • Pay for additional artists or programmers to come aboard
  • Pay for new equipment to test and develop the game with
  • Pay for further software development tools and aids
  • Pay for an official web site, its development and security
  • To help keep my focus on developing the game
  • Your rewards =)

 

REWARD LEVELS

These rewards only extend to people who contribute to this campaign specifically.  Upon the game's release, prices and specials will change.  The Special Edition and Super Special Edition, along with Unique Editions are ONLY availible through this campaign.  

Create A Creature / Character Reward - With this reward you will be able to design a creature or special character that will appear in the game.  The creature can have skills and abilities you specify and will become one of the default spawning creatures in the game!  A special character is a 'leader' type character - a named monster - which can either hinder or harm players.  While only one will spawn in the world at a time (perhaps multiple times in the life of a world), the impact can be much greater than a normally spawning  creature.  The choice is yours!

Note that such a creature or character must conform to the skills and abilities built into the design of the game and must be fairly balanced.  Not going to allow an uber beast of ultimate destruction, nor a weak creature that drops every rare item in the game with maxed benefits!

$75 AND OVER - Unique T-Shirt. 

Any reward that included the T-Shirt, is a unique T-Shirt.  All rewards over $75 will be gifted with a unique T-Shirt which will include a custom designed Epica Rex Avatar and the official game name (or "Project Epica Rex").

 

FUNDING UNLOCKS

As a group, you all have the power to unlock the secrets of Project Epica Rex.  Reach these funding goals and the secrets will be unlocked!

First Goal - Skill List Revealed!

$5,000 UNLOCK - Still Locked!
Takes 500 x $10 Backers to get here!!!

$10,000 UNLOCK - Still Locked!
Only 1,000 x $10 Backers would not only fullfill the goal, but unlock something ultra special!

+$5,000 GOAL - Still Locked!
Even more backers can unlock the greatest of the secrets!  Aim high!

 

Contributors

For funding contributors, your help will go a long way into the development of this game and make it the very best it can be.  Along with the rewards you will recieve, you will be making a contribution to the Indie Industry on it's most primal level.  

Virgo Palace Software is about as small, mom and pop as you can get out of a company.  Putting your trust in VP is a contract in getting out a product that is not only what is shown here, but a proof that if people work hard towards their goal, they can achieve their dreams.  VP is working on just such a dream, and it can become a reality with your help!

When Epica Rex is funded, it can be used as a beacon for hope in the entrepuenueral small business world that anyone who dares light a torch can find the way!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It is understandable that not everyone can contribute funds towards such projects as life can be pretty tough.  But the life's blood of this type of campaign relies also on people to help get the word out.  

Referrals from people will have rewards too should I get referrals.  This includes inclusion into the testing period of the game, and perhaps getting free copies of the game.

 

Though tweeting or retweeting about the game are certainly helpful, if you are looking to get involved, and get one of the rewards listed; you'll need to be vigorous.  If you are a student, make a poster at your school or college.  If you are part of a club, make mention of the game!  Tell your fellow parishners at church!  As a Rexian, we need as many eyes and ears on this thing to help make it live!

Follow the hash tag #Rexian on Twitter, tweet to game industry people you follow (on a fairly constant basis).  Keep an eye out for tweets from me aimed at a particular person, maybe we can catch some attention.

Very important! Keep this page active! Post comments, talk to each other, ask questions about the game! I'll be around constantly.  Traffic needs to keep on the high side in order for this project to hit the front page!  Tweet about it, share it on facebook, tumblr, ..wherever you are active!  Share it! Talk about it.

 TECH DEMO DOWNLOAD (Windows XP/Vista/7 - DirectX 9)

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ii0ae26355r0a33/ERa1_1_ReadTheManual.zip

story:
What do backgammon, go, and chess all have in common? They are board games that have stood the test of time. Built on simplicity but with potential for complexity these games provide a challenge for players at all levels. Tao of Peg is designed to use a combination of luck and strategy to win in a variety of ways. Tao of Peg is the perfect game for family fun or for more serious gaming nights.

Each game is hand crafted right here in Portland, Oregon. The board and pegs are made of wood, and the board design is printed on a vinyl sheet and applied directly to a wooden base. The entire board is lightly coated with a protective varnish. Felt buttons are then added to the bottom corners to protect playing surfaces.

The Play 

Each player is dealt four cards. A player begins by discarding a card from their hand. The player then places a game piece in any space with the corresponding color on the board. The turns ends by the player drawing a new card from the pile. 

In addition to the 100 colored playing cards (25 per colored quadrant), each set also has two types of wild cards. Players may play a wild card instead of a colored card. Red wild cards allow the player to remove any game piece in play and black wild cards allow the player to place a game piece anywhere on the board.


The Win 
There are four different ways to win.

Tao of Peg is designed to balance skill with luck. There are multiple strategies to employ during play, such as: offensive (go for the win), defensive (block other players from winning) sneaky (try not to be noticed) any combination of the three!


* Please add $5 for shipped items.

We collected some great testimonials from folks during our first Game Night. Adults and kids alike absolutely loved Tao of Peg!

Tao of Peg has plans to expand! We need your help to do it.

We will produce educational packs for various age groups and interests. The initial expansion pack will be designed for elementary school age children focusing on reading, math and science. The challenge will be for them to answer a question to earn a peg. 

We also have plans for a Tao of Peg app for mobile devices and more!

Please stay tuned for more details as these additions move forward!

It will be extremely difficult to bring this project to the major market without the assistance of you, our wonderful backers. We recognize that and have provided incentives to encourage your support.

A few of your perks:

  • Based on your level of contribution you will receive more items than if you were to purchase Tao of Peg in the retail market.
  • You'll be the first to know when new Tao of Peg additions are going to market prior to availability in retail stores
  • How cool will it be to have a game not yet available in any store, BE THE FIRST ON YOUR BLOCK!
  • You have our sincere appreciation and your personal satisfaction knowing you have helped good people establish a new small business.
  • Families will laugh and play together even more thanks to your support.

Honestly, we need you. We're not begging, simply asking for help and doing our best to provide value for that support.

Family games are making a come back. We want to be part of supporting families who make time to play together. Now is the time to launch what we have tinkered with for almost 20 years.

We’re proud to support a variety of charities. In fact, we will donate 10% of sales to the following charities. You will have the option of choosing which charity your contribution will help support.

 We couldn't have done this without a fantastic team.

Tao of Peg is designed to use a combination of luck and strategy to win in a variety of ways. Tao of Peg is the perfect game for family fun or for more serious gaming nights.Each game is hand crafted right here in Portland, Oregon. The board and pegs are made of wood, and the board design is printed on a vinyl sheet and applied directly to a wooden base. The entire board is lightly coated with a protective varnish. Felt buttons are then added to the bottom corners to protect playing surfaces.The Play Each player is dealt four cards. A player begins by discarding a card from their hand. The player then places a game piece in any space with the corresponding color on the board. The turns ends by the player drawing a new card from the pile. In addition to the 100 colored playing cards (25 per colored quadrant), each set also has two types of wild cards. Players may play a wild card instead of a colored card. Red wild cards allow the player to remove any game piece in play and black wild cards allow the player to place a game piece anywhere on the board.
The Win There are four different ways to win.
Tao of Peg is designed to balance skill with luck. There are multiple strategies to employ during play, such as: offensive (go for the win), defensive (block other players from winning) sneaky (try not to be noticed) any combination of the three!* Please add $5 for shipped items.

We collected some great testimonials from folks during our first Game Night. Adults and kids alike absolutely loved Tao of Peg!




Tao of Peg has plans to expand! We need your help to do it.
We will produce educational packs for various age groups and interests. The initial expansion pack will be designed for elementary school age children focusing on reading, math and science. The challenge will be for them to answer a question to earn a peg. 
We also have plans for a Tao of Peg app for mobile devices and more!
Please stay tuned for more details as these additions move forward!


It will be extremely difficult to bring this project to the major market without the assistance of you, our wonderful backers. We recognize that and have provided incentives to encourage your support.
A few of your perks:

Based on your level of contribution you will receive more items than if you were to purchase Tao of Peg in the retail market.
You'll be the first to know when new Tao of Peg additions are going to market prior to availability in retail stores
How cool will it be to have a game not yet available in any store, BE THE FIRST ON YOUR BLOCK!
You have our sincere appreciation and your personal satisfaction knowing you have helped good people establish a new small business.
Families will laugh and play together even more thanks to your support.

Honestly, we need you. We're not begging, simply asking for help and doing our best to provide value for that support.
Family games are making a come back. We want to be part of supporting families who make time to play together. Now is the time to launch what we have tinkered with for almost 20 years.


We’re proud to support a variety of charities. In fact, we will donate 10% of sales to the following charities. You will have the option of choosing which charity your contribution will help support.



 We couldn't have done this without a fantastic team.

story:
Great place to work!

We zijn een organisatie in verandering. We omarmen innovatie, nieuwe manieren van samenwerking en nieuwe verdienmodellen. We zijn speels, fris en hip! Al die dingen.

Goed verhaal. Hoe gaan we dat realiseren?

Dieter (PD) Emiel (BD) en Pieter (PM) bedachten het volgende:  we gaan met zijn allen een voetbaltafel crowdfunden. De voetbaltafel is het begin van de game kamer. In de game kamer kunnen we lekker ontspannen, gamen en chillen. Volgens ons is dat de beste manier om weer gemotiveerd aan het werk te gaan! 

Het begin van de inzamel actie is gemaakt op de 5e verdieping (tip: zoek naar het spaarpotje) 

Met deze entry op indiegogo pakken we pas echt goed aan! 500 € is voldoende om een echte Deutsche Meister an zu schaffen. 

Komen we over de 500? Geen probleem, dan gaan we gewoon op zoek naar ander vertier,:een sjoeltafel, een dartboard, een wii, LAN-parties, de mogelijkheden zijn eindeloos.! Maar we beginnen met een voetbaltafel...

Doneer zodat we binnen no time een great place to work hebben!

story:
"In a world where magic is exiled... A world, where magic drains the life of all around it. One person discovers a plot far beyond anything he could ever have imagined... 

...And takes matters into his own  hands..."

Our aim is to create a unique, top-down 2D RPG, with a heavy focus on 'retro' graphics, a sophisticated AI, Radiant storylines, and allowing the Player to make a real impact on the game through their choices.

We are making a real effort to create a unique game, here are just a few ways that we're making this possible:

  • A unique, specially composed Soundtrack - The game will incorporate pieces of music specially created by two amazing composers.
  • Radiant storylines and quests - These are randomly generated quests, that the player will encounter through the game. Because of these, the game will never be the same twice.
  • Player-made choices and impacts - Choices that the player makes during their game, will affect not only how storylines pan out, but also how the AI in certain locations, and worldwide, will act towards them.
  • Sophisticated AI - As well as all of the regular 'actions' that AI perform, the AI will interact between eachother, in a unique 'AI societies' system. For example, the AI will have their own roles, and act differently depending on these roles, even when the player isn't there.
  • An ever-changing world - Ontop of the AI societies, the world will also shape itself around you. This means that you'll have a unique gaming experience each time.

What do you mean by "YourGame"?

A large aim of the project is to have an open development process, and more importantly INVOLVE you guys with everything too. 

You can use our Subreddit to make suggestions on what you want within the game, feel free to join and post your suggestions!
https://www.reddit.com/r/OpusYourGame/

Here are some ideas for what you could contribute to the game:

  • Banners and icons for reddit, videos, websites etc.
  • Game ideas - Things that could go ingame such as items, mechanics etc. 
  • Artwork for the game. (must be some multiple of 16 x some multiple of 16 pixels in size).
  • Much, much more! 
If you think you have anything you can contribute, head on over to the reddit and make a post! 

How will the game work?

The aim is to implement a very free, open-world aspect to the game, allowing players to roam freely. With an expansive map, and a plethora of towns, cities, encampments, monster camps and so much more, there will be loads to do as you wonder around the game world.
Combat takes place in real-time, in an attempt to make the game even more immersive. As well as this, it will require some skill (utilising blocking and dodging and kiting).
The main storyline occurs in a somewhat investigative style - The player won't be told to go to an exact location and speak to a specific person. It is down to the player to track down the clues and investigate the plot that they have uncovered. The experience will be different for every player.
As for shops etc., Their wares will be random, and become better, the further the player has progressed in the game.

What will my funds go towards?

Your funds will go towards three main things:

  • Upkeeping the website (and maintaining the website domain payments etc. )
  • Paying for private Github repositories for development.
  • Allowing us to 'reward' the amazing staff team that we have, since they are currently working on a voluntary basis.


We won't be able to afford these things without your help, and it goes without saying that we're all amazingly appreciative of any donations that we receive.

Who are the Staff Team?

Upon deciding that I wanted to create an RPG, I realised that I would be able to make a much higher quality game if I had a team to help me. 

What I wasn't expecting was what happened next. I spoke to a few people, and we decided to found a voluntary games studio :

"Opus Development Studio"

We are currently about 25-strong, and always looking for more friendly, enthusiastic and committed people to join the team, and hopefully, we will be able to expand even more than we have already.

Here is our current staff team, and their accompanying Twitter handles:

Owner: @TauOmicronMu

Engine Development: 

  • @TauOmicronMu
  • @fanzyflani
  • @Artbot345
  • @Mattt_RS
  • MLFGrapefruit

Content Development:

  • @fanzyflani
  • @TauOmicronMu
  • @rs_apelicious

  • @Mattt_RS
  •  MrKnowles100
  •  Josekai (MrLog)
  •  @Ambler3
  •  MLFGrapefruit

Audio:

  • @Abi_Tunecrafter
  • Josekai (MrLog) (https://soundcloud.com/Mrlog)

Graphics:

  • @KoalasRS
  • @JackDisrupt

Narrative Design:

  • @Lord_Zoinkwiz
  • @TauOmicronMu
  • @Aglarion_RS
  • @Abi_Tunecrafter
  • @SonicRS3
  • @MaxBury
  • MLFGrapefruit

Website Development:

  • @jzshwa
  • @rs_apelicious
  • Gavin Craddock
  • @Artbot345
  • @Mattt_RS
  • @LukeAspley

QA Testing:

  • @SonicRS3
  • @Mattt_RS
  • @DonzaRS
  • MrKnowles100
  • @JackDisrupt
  • @Ambler3
  • Karl92 
  • wurzel17
  • @MaxBury
  • @Ezeei
  • @LukeAspley
  • MLFGrapefruit
  • @openaffliction
  • Buttyboy63
  • StrangeSandvich

Social Media/Community Management:

  • @mrillustrial
  • @RiddleAOS
  • @Siragen_

What do you plan on doing once you've developed the game?

The aim is to try and get the game Greenlit on steam. This means we'll have an amazing platform to get the game out, so as many people as possible can enjoy it. 

If we reach our goal and with enough demand, we'll possibly add a multiplayer aspect to the game in the future.

On a final note,

You shape this game.


Risks and Challenges

As with any other game in development, there is no guarantee that we will be able to produce the game on time, due to setbacks such as personal issues.

Rest assured though, if this were to ever happen (which we're sure it wont), we will endeavour to get the game to you, as soon as possible.

No matter what we run into, we want you with us every step of the way.

Around 23 years ago when I was ten years old, video games were my passion and platformers in particular. I played them all day and soon I started inventing my own games, albeit on paper. Showing an early entrepreneurial trait, I created detailed level designs and drawings on paper for a game I invented and sent them to my favourite American game companies. They summarily rejected the ideas. Below is the first rejection letter I received: 

I couldn't quite afford a computer at the time (I was 10), so, undeterred, I designed another game and sent it off to a second gaming company. 

Both were rejected. So its something of a lifelong dream to build a game. Without further adieu, we introduce you to Danger Rabbit. 

Remember how much fun games like Super Mario and Sonic were?

Games back then were all about F-U-N. They were big, fun adventures with huge worlds to explore, different terrain to navigate and secret areas to discover. Games were vast and kept you entertained for weeks. They were challenging and hard to master, and beating them was an achievement to be proud of.

What happened to those games?


Somewhere along the way those types of games got forgotten and all we have now are strategy & battle games with money hungry IAPs, one-tap games a monkey could play or yet-another-endless-runner (that rhymes). 

To counter this, we at Flow Spark Studios are on a mission to bring back the charm and challenging gameplay of platformers to smartphones and tablets, and we need your help..

Danger Rabbit is an homage to the platformers of yesteryear. It's big, fun and addictive, and features an innovative touchscreen gameplay mechanic that you'll love. You have to draw 'planks' at just the right angle and length to bounce Danger Rabbit past obstacles and enemies in more than 5 worlds and 100+ giant levels. So you will be bouncing through each level rather than jumping. 

Can you master the art of drawing planks and making Danger Rabbit bounce just where you need him to go? Below is a gameplay trailer showing you how the art of drawing planks for Danger Rabbit works. 


So who are we? And how can you help? 

We are Flow Spark Studios, a small Australian gaming studio startup with a big passion for games. We want to make intelligent, original games designed for smartphones, tablets and eventually, consoles, PCs and Macs. 

Danger Rabbit is our first game. We have been working on Danger Rabbit for more than 18 months and we're now in the final stages of development. We need your help to bring Danger Rabbit to life and help bring back the magic of platform games to smartphones and tablets. We want to make Danger Rabbit bigger, badder and more awesome than even we imagined it could be, and we need your support. 

Not only that, we've reinvented platform games for touchscreen devices with a new gameplay mechanic that is fun and original.  

Not another endless runner, 

Not another strategy game filled with IAPs, 

Not another tower defense game, 

Not another retro one tap game a 2 year old could play.

Danger Rabbit is one big adventure from start to finish. Bounce Danger Rabbit through each level and collect carrots to unlock the next level and subsequent worlds for free. There are lots of fun power ups to collect throughout the game which adds variety to the gameplay. 

Powerups

The game will feature In App Purchases (IAPs) but it is entirely possible to play the whole game without ever spending and money (not great for us but it seems that is how it has to be with mobile games). No IAPs will exceed $4, and most are just 99c.

Why we need the money

We have been working on Danger Rabbit for more than 18 months now, and we feel like we are really close to having a truly awesome game that provides real value to players and hours of gameplay with more than 100 challenging levels. We have put all our own money up to this point and we've had friends and family help. We now need your support for final development and marketing. 

How we will spend the money

Any additional funds we earn will go into making the game even more awesome, making each level/world bigger and more visually spectacular, and lots of other original ideas we have. There are literally a tonne of ideas we've had that we'd like to include but simply can't afford to. 

We've even made a Danger Rabbit cartoon!

Getting noticed on the app stores is hard these days so we're taking a multi media approach with Danger Rabbit. Here is a little teaser of the Danger Rabbit cartoon!

    (and by supporting our campaign, you'll get early access)

    Risks & Challenges

    The game is almost complete so there is zero chance that we won't be delivering a product to you.

We've even made a Danger Rabbit cartoon!Getting noticed on the app stores is hard these days so we're taking a multi media approach with Danger Rabbit. Here is a little teaser of the Danger Rabbit cartoon!

  



  

(and by supporting our campaign, you'll get early access)





 
Risks & Challenges

story:
This is a multiplayer game for mobile platforms. It consist of more than 15 awesome games to challenge your friends and family

BlackBerry 10 / Android/ ios

Windows phone /Tizen / Windows 8

StoryLine

when the aliens spaceships was approaching the earth they fired a beam all over the earth that made everything come to life all the humans became scared and terrified because they thought the aliens plan was the Invasion of the earth but when the aliens spaceships was landing on earth and the aliens came out from their mother spaceship the military was ready for war but when the aliens came out they was planning a surprise party.

The 15 games:

1) Slice the pizza:

The Alien is hungry for the last slice of pizza you need to help it running from the Alien mouth.

2) Catch the egg:

The human told the Alien about the omelet dish and now they want to try it collect as much eggs as possible.

3) Kick the ball:

The Aliens dream to be in next shakira songs so they are training to join the world cup of 2014 but problem is which team is he gonna join.

4) Bash the wall:

The dumb Alienhas trapped himself in the room and Swallow the key now we gonna crack this wall down.

5) Shoot the target:

Maybe the Alien want to train to shoot the target to shoot us later................ops.

6) Cut the hair:


The Alien want a new hairstyle so you must cut his hair as he want or he will become angry so be careful.

7) Save the food:

The Beetle is hungry for any things meet ,cheeze . you need to save the last cheeze in the world .

8) Clean the shoe:

In this game you will have to defeat the bucket of sand after the alien has

transferred him to do nasty things.

9) Pop the balloon :

Today we celebrate the day when Aliens came to the earth by popping balloons

10) Escape the rocks:

The Alien has missed his way to home he is lost in the desert and the rocks fall away from the mountain so hurry up and rescue him back to his home.

11) Find the bug:

The Alien want to eat and they are lover to our bug its just like sweet to them so surve to the Alien there dessert .

12) Jump the alien:

The Alien want to try a kid life so he jumped and jumped.

13) Find the ball: 

The humans are playing hide the balland they are cheating the Aliens to get their money .

14) tap the floor:

Also my hand heard about the party and want to join the party.

15) It is bowlling time:

About the game

This game is a solo multiplayer game up to 4 player you can choose your (Female/Male) alien character in the game and compete with your friends by getting the highest score.

How to play

Every player will choose his character and compete with his friends and family in some games you can tilt the device ,move your fingers across the screen and tap the screen but you must be fast and accurate every tap count oh i forget do it before the time runs out

Online Capabilities

In the meantime you can post your name and your high score on the game leaderboard but if we reach the target you will let us do an online multiplayer game that will blow your mind

How to play online

You will choose your avatar to compete with it against people around the world with real time online competition by being the troll or by get trolled on for instance you can blow the wind on the rocks to troll your component or you can punch the chickens to make them egg faster .


Important Note

put your platform of choice on the comment and do not worry we will contact you to confirm your choice
