CowardThis little warrior has never distinguished himself as a courageous and strong knight. Unfortunately all the other knights have already been defeated by the evil master, so he has no option but to fight. In spite of his slight build, he is very skilful in the use of the sword, but he finds it difficult to face his enemies openly: you will better attack them in the rear!


Final Boss This mysterious and terrible monster is greedy for young princesses, he loves to eat them with onions and carrots! He fears nothing and he has faced all the knights the King sent him. He has many aces in his sleeve and he feels invincible at the top of his tower. Will Coward snatch the princess from his clutches?







PrincessAs in every fairy tale, the princess is beautiful like a goddess and bewitches everyone who looks at her. Unfortunately she has attracted the attention of the evil master too, who wants to prepare a big banquet with the princess as the main dish....


GuardsThese fearful muscle mountains are everywhere through the levels, and they will try to stop you from reaching the beloved Princess! Coward is very skilful in the use of the sword and with technique he can defeat them! But remember, the bigger they are, the louder they fall.


Flying EyesThese flying eyes cannot move, but they never take their eyes off! They cannot attack you, but be careful, because if they see you, they will attract every nearby guard!  


JellyfishThese disgusting creatures float everywhere through the levels. The worse thing is that, thanks to their shape, they can see 360 degrees! You should pay attention and avoid being too close to them! 


BansheeHey, you look like you’ve seen a ghost! Well, there are also ghosts that terrify our little spineless warrior with their terrible screaming!


SnailThese funny creatures wander about the levels carrying weak lights. There are some levels without any light, so you will be very lucky if you find one of these snails!



WormsWhat a disgusting creatures! These revolting one-eyed invertebrates are harmless, but if you trample on them, they will make loud noises and everyone around you will notice you! Be careful!

The setting of Coward Knight is a castle; there are 4 worlds, each of them is made up of 12 levels, with a total of 48 levels.
UndergroundsTavern

Gardens

Castle





Here you can hear 2 tracks of the game’s soundtrack, available with the Count (and higher) reward.





The soundtrack has been entirely recorded at Sun Keeper Studio. Visit the website:
http://www.sunkeeperstudio.com/



Studio Leaves is a small independent group of people who joined their experiences in order to improve the video game setting in the south of Italy, our small Silicon Valley 2.0. After hours spent playing Metal Gear Solid and The Legend of Zelda, we came up with the idea of Coward Knight. Even if the programming is self-funded, we need your help in order to pay for other key collaborators, to buy licences and to put the finishing touches to “Coward Knight: A Stealth Adventure”: thus you will be 100% satisfied with our game. Therefore we have chosen IndieGoGo to see our game grow and thrive, as we thought since the beginning!








Gaetano LenociGameplay, Programmer
I have been working for several years with other companies as a Game Programmer, now I'm working with our own company to realise our game! I’m the core programmer of Coward Knight and I’m dealing with the main features of the game too. While working on this project, I have been influenced by my favorite games: Shenmue, Castlevania: Symphony of the Night and Broken Sword. 





Marco ClaudioLevel Design, Programmer
I have been working for two years in a software house where I realised a little mobile game and an online card game. I deal with the creation of challenging and amusing levels. My favourite games are: Metal Gear Solid saga, Yakuza saga and Okami. 





Gameras Giuseppe Albergo3D Graphics
I’m the artist of the team. Previously I have been working on “Yes I can”, available on the Apple Store and Google Play. I deal with the 2D and 3D graphics of Coward Knight. My favourite games are The Elder Scroll V: Skyrim and Dark Souls.
Click on thumbnails to see more of my work...









Fabio MinennaMusic and Sound Effects
Music Producer at Sun Keeper Studio and guitarist of the band “Vinterblot”. I deal with the creation of atmospheric and absorbing soundtracks that can delight and make the gaming experience gripping. My favourite games are: World of Warcraft, Neverwinter Nights e TES V: Skyrim.

story:
The campaign is over but you can still order a Wizarm from www.wizarm.com 

Wizarm is a neo device, a kind of magic box packed with great features, incredibly powerful but yet as easy to use as your phone when it comes to capturing or recording a 2D or 3D movie clip.

Simply connect any HDMI source device and select Screenshot or Video clip as you would do on your smartphone's camera app, click the button and it starts recording! (as shown above, below and here).

Recorded digital video clips are stored and auto-magically scaled (if required by user) for your immediate or later playback and sharing.

Update 15 Nov. 2013: Wizarm is recording the PS4 HDMI output just like it does on the PS3.

Now you can handle, support, manage and record all latest video standards — from SD to Full HD 1080p60 and up to QuadHD(1440p)!  It redefines the current HD-PVR and DVR paradigm. 

Controlled entirely from a KB/mouse combo, a PS3/X360 pad, an Android phone or even from a Win/Mac/Linux computer, Wizarm combines an innovating recording, pass-through, scaling and overlay processing for digital video, on the Android/Ubuntu platform, with a PC-like connectivity, performance and features.

"There are already lots of devices out in the market that allows consumers to run Android apps on their TV, some even priced as low as $30, but none might be as powerful as the Wizarm" - TheDroidGuy.com

"While the specs alone are enough to help set this box apart from the crowd, the ability to act as a high-definition digital video recorder is probably its most unusual characteristic" - Liliputing.com

"It can process and store recorded video, as well as capture and enhance the video signal with features like scaling and overlay processing. Starting at $259, the box is touted for offering some features found only on PC video capture cards that cost hundreds of dollars more." - Linuxgizmos.com

"The possibilities are exceptionals and beyond the current standards of digital players, workstations and Android game consoles, the Wizarm offers a real platform to become more than just a DVR, ...The Holy Grail of TV box is at your fingertips" - MiniMachines.net (in french)

Are you looking for playing games, browsing the net or running apps and media center on the big Full or Quad HD screen? Either the standard/classic use or the most advanced one like streaming, scaling, capturing, recording, overlay. Wizarm provides them all into one powerful weapon of mass entertainment.

Wizarm is fully open source with a monthly independent and rewarded dev contest as an incentive to bring creativity around its hardware magic. Rooted out of the box and super easy (4 screws) to access either the Mainboard or the SATA3 SSD HDD bay on the other side. Completely silent with a passive cooling system. 

 

Wizarm have the hardware design to fully take advantage of its inner magic, with SATA3 (for SSD HDD 2″5), 6 USB ports (2x USB3.0), SDHC/SDXC connector, Display port output, HDMI input/output connectors, Microphone and earphone connectors, Optical Sound, Gigabit Ethernet, Dual Wifi, Bluetooth 4.0, IR and more…

Featuring the almighty Exynos5 Dual Core ARM Cortex A15 up to 2 GHz (also found on the Nexus10), a quad core ARM Mali T604 GPU @ 533 MHz, 2 GB RAM (DDR3) and 16GB on board eMMC 4.5, Wizarm is nothing but smooth, fluid and responsive.

We believe that everyone — not just the professionals or the wealthy — should have the ability to properly convert, scale, customize and record digital streams. We engaged in the product and user experience design of Wizarm with the following principles in mind:

Digital recording should not be frustrating or hard. Wizarm provides a bleeding marvelous HDMI input that feeds the Camera input of the Exynos5 SoC. Never before handling of digital video stream has been that easy! Retrieve your incoming video stream from most of the camera software available for android phone or tablet. If you can use a smartphone, you can use Wizarm.

An amazing pro scaler is included thus allowing a whole new type of digital control, whatever digital input is throw in, end users now have the ability to determine the output resolution of their choice, while still having the capability to determine a similar or different recording resolution. It’s flexible and versatile!

Looking to add some fun or informative content to your digital stream, WiZARM is giving you that possibility; freely choose the on screen location to add graphics, web elements, picture in picture and more. Create a truly unique and customized digital stream for you, your friends or your internet audience.

 

 

We set out to change the game in the PVR/DVR and android STB market by designing a synergistic solution that brings brand new features and addresses the major consumer pain points of existing products.

Wizarm provides state of the art PVR/DVR and capture features while giving the ability to the users to benefit of various others advanced features such as Scaling, Overlay, Media center, Gaming, Computer, Dev. Board.

Here's a breakdown of the perks you can choose from when you support this campaign (select your perk from the sidebar at the top of this page). All perks listed below include at least one brand new Wizarm.

In addition to our core team, briefly presented in our first video above, we've assembled and still looking to expand, an incredible group of engineers, designers, and industry experts who are collaborating with us to create the best possible hardware. 

Wizarm is hiring! Software&hardware engineers, talented people, brillant hackers: come join our core team! E-mail us at jobs@wizarm.com

We are citizens of the world, we love our children and we respect human beings and their dignity. For those obvious reasons, we selected a Taiwan located factory for the Wizarm production. Also, we carefully selected 99% of the Wizarm components in Taiwan, Japan and South Korea exclusively. Not only a sign of quality, it's a sign of respect towards the human dignity. 

 

 

We currently have several working prototypes on Android 4.2 and we're now focused on:

  • Polishing the Android software for release on the final product
  • Developing mobile app for remote control and wireless stream
  • Developing the recovery/backup/format/partition tools and menu.
  • Adding Ubuntu

We will soon begin the process of:

  • Designing packaging
  • Getting product certifications
  • Tooling
  • Materials procurement
  • Mass Production

We have been working on Wizarm for the past 18 months and we've come a long way. But now we need your help. Your support will allow us to initiate tooling and order components for manufacturing so we can make Wizarm available to you and the thousands of people who have never before had a digital recording solution. Let's make our digital life easier, our TV smarter and our streams brighter — together.

So why should you support us?

  • Be the first to get one (and we mean it).
  • You're looking for a digital companion, a secondary computer to handle some tasks such as capturing, web, email, ftp, games, streaming and so on...
  • You’ve never had DVR/PVR, digital recording solution, smart mediacenter, android stb before and think it’s awesome to have a simple and beautiful way to connect and enjoy your equipment.

There is quite a few great things possible when the production reaches successful numbers, if our campaign ever goes beyond expectations, we will be able to provide exciting bodywork and stand for your Wizarm.

If such wizardry ever happens, thanx to your support, we will contact all the magicians out there that make it happen, so they can select a bodywork or color of their choice.



Do you own a popular website or do you have a massive social network? If that's your case, then the chance are high that you could simply win a free Wizarm. At the end of the indiegogo campaign, we will announce the TOP5 referrers. Those 5 best referrers will get a Wizarm for FREE! Please make sure that you are logged in to Indiegogo — that's the only way we can track how many people follow the links you share! Share the Wizarm page on twitter, facebook, google+ or any way you want to use the links right below the video.

  1. RECORDING & STREAMING (format, options, devices, etc)
  2. TECHNICAL (Cert, Specs, power/voltage)
  3. WILL IT WORK WITH (my phone, my other device)
  4. CAN I USE IT IN ‘THIS’ WAY (storage, cloud)
  5. OTHER QUESTIONS

1a: Can the Wizarm records the HDMI output from a device such as the PS3 or the PS4?

We have a quick video answer to that question, check it out: here

Note: Recording and streaming can be done from most of the android camera recording or camera streaming softwares. We will of course provide our own version as well!

1b: Will the wizarm record any output from the cable box and in what format?

Yes! Not only from a HDMI STB, but from any HDMI sources. The format is defined by the user, you can input 1080p, display 1080p on the TV and record at 1080p all at the same time, but you can also decide to input 1080p, display 1080i and record 720p, the magic is in YOUR hands!

1c: Will the wizarm record and playback a 3D signal?

Yes! Side-by-side and Top-Bottom already work just fine. The team is working on adding support for Framepacked movies because the line count is larger than a normal frame (2250 lines) also some general tweaking are necessary for the 3D output to offer the proper 3D infoframes. We are on it!

2a: Are you planning to achieve Google’s Android certification such that it can use the Google Play Store?

Sure, our final device will be submitted to google cert, however the outcome cannot be guaranteed yet.

3a: Will you have all the same functionality on iPhone/iPad and Android devices to work with Wizarm?

We are working on our android app to take advantage of the Wizarm inner magic, once done the next step will be to release a similar software for iOS device.

3b: Would one browse the web over Wizarm using the android mobile version of Firefox, Opera, etc?

Yes, Firefox, Chrome, Opera or the default web browser, they will all work just fine.

4a: Will the wizarm connect between an hd cablebox/dvr and not affect the functions of the cable box…e.g., will the wizarm be a passive pass through of the cablebox/dvr functions when not in use?

Absolutely! You can watch your HDMI stream in fullscreen without any interaction from the Wizarm or you can watch it with/without scaling, with/without recording, with/without overlay, it's totally up to you!

5a: What are the shipping costs?

Take it easy, Worldwide Shipping charges in Express with tracking are FREE. Wherever you live, there is no extra charge. It's all inclusive.

5b: What are the challenges?

We are doing something that has never been done before: a completely revolutionary way of handling digital stream like nothing else in the market. While there may be manufacturing and production delays outside of our control, we promise timely and transparent communication throughout the process. Soon, Wizarm devices will be running the HD show at homes and connecting people's equipment like never before.

Any more questions? Ask away!

Join the Wiz Army!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Miroslav and I've created Supernova in one day. You can play it here: http://supernova.pixelablaze.com/. 

Other than that, I'm a game developer, living quite happily in Serbia.

Now, this is my game but I want you to help it grow further, as it would very much like to. Now, what's the fuss? What is this game striving to become? Well, it can't be summed up in one word but the short description (...the intellectual mindchild it strives to be. Riddled with emptiness, piano chords and philosophy) is kind of it. You can play it with one finger only, but to feel it, you have to give yourself whole.

When I first made Supernova into a playable thing, I felt right about it and I continue to feel so. It's a fast game that you can play without thinking about it, but - it's also a journey through the void, where the enemy becomes uncertain of what and why you are fighting. I want to add to that: to add levels, vast spaces that can be explored; add size to depth, make it immense. Go play it for a while and then come back here to imagine a world in that space. Giant monuments of lost civilizations, scrapyards in the depths of space, the slow rotating and humming cycles of an ancient mechanism, lost to time. This and more, could be your work, if you contribute.

What We Need & What You Get

Supernova is made with Unity3D, the free edition. I went through a lot of trouble to make it look as wonderful (it does, right?) as I could, but it could be even greater. When the ships warp in, time-space could ripple, structures could bend space around them and a lot of breathtaking visual moments could be added. For this, I would need Unity3D Pro, which costs $1,500.

If I had to write it all down, the game would get something along the lines of:

  • levels - not just fully random blank space like now,
  • more enemy variations, 
  • more things to save your life,
  • a plot much larger than the 30 sentences,
  • epic scale of surroundings,
  • the full feeling of loneliness only space can bring...

If you really had to ask, I like to think of it as a little bit like Journey, if you were hunted down through space in Journey from time to time. Of course, it's completely different and is more akin to some minimalistic space roguelike, but the feeling is what's important.

The demo you can see now is the part where you are hunted, with limited storyline exposure and focused on battling through hordes of enemies. I can promise that the game wouldn't be based on this, rather using it as a shift in dynamics, from exploring to combat, back to exploring.

I'd want to do this full time and pay some people to do some fine art stuff, so the rest of the money would go into keeping us alive and well while coding and refining the details. I made this in a day, imagine what a month could bring you. Also, for those worried about losing this style: the concept of minimalism stays, it's what can be built out of that minimalism that's getting paid.

If the goal isn't reached, the funding is still going to this game, to try and buy Unity3D and pay some fine people less than they deserve. If, however, we get more, there's oh so much we can do:

Unity Pro Android costs $1500, so we could deliver this game to your android phones in all of it's splendid graphics and visuals that we can make with Unity Pro.

Unity Pro iOS costs $1500 and afterwards, your nice iPhone or tablet can enjoy some heavy-duty supernova experience.

The perks are made so that you can choose what you want to give your money to: if you'd want us spend your money on, say, iOS more than Android, pick iOS perks and we'll see to buy that one sooner and go with that. It's our plan to roll this game out on all major platforms and, let me tell you, it's much better to play on a touch-sensitive device.

Now, the perks:

Starter perks

  • The "I enjoyed the game, keep it coming" perk ($2) tells me that you've enjoyed playing the game and that you appreciate the time and effort. I say thank you, dear player and know that it will keep coming. For this perk, you get a personal thank you from me.
  • The "I want more!" perk ($10) is where it's at! You clearly want more and I plan to hold to that. A personal thank you from me and a free digital download of the game is what you get!

Intermediate perks

  • The "I WANT MOAR!" perk ($25) gets you the game, once it's out, but before anyone else. You get it and you're in it, and you get a personal thank you in the game, redefining your goals.
  • The "I WANT MOAR... on Android!" perk ($25) is exactly like the previous one, but it lets us know that you want your money to go into Android development.
  • The "I WANT MOAR... on iOS!" perk ($25) is exactly like the other two, just with your cash going to iOS development. Neat!
  • The "Vault" perk ($100) gets you three games, so you can give it to friends and spread the joy, personal in-game thank you (and for all you out there thinking about this - yes, that means that you'll all coexist in the game, in a way) and an additional level in the game. Every $100 given here add a very specific, not-as-random-as-the-current-random, balanced level. We love to create and you'll get us to create just oh-so-much.
  • The "Vault... on Android!" perk ($100) gets you the same, just that your money goes into targetting Androids.
  • The "Vault... on iOS!" perk ($100) gets you the same as the above, just for iOS.

Advanced perks

  • The "Philosopher" perk ($500) let's you get an all-you-can-eat of our game, to spread it as far as you can, an in-game thank you, a written thank you and a copy of the Supernova limited-edition Thought Book, which will have great in-game moments caught in snapshots, a lot of thoughts (obviously) around that, our thank-you's written all over the place, fine paper and ink, sketches, diagrams, ideas, well - just about everything you could find on our desks while working.
  • The "Designer" perk ($1000) gets you all of the above and more, giving you a chance to add your own idea to the project, be it a new enemy ship, new philosophical sentences or ideas, new levels or tones - you're in. Your signature ends up in the Thought Book, too.
  • The "Pro" perk ($1500) gets us Unity Pro, plain and simple, and you get everything. No, I mean it.
  • The "Android" perk ($1500) gets us Unity Pro Android and you get the same as with the above. You're great and you've pushed in such a great way that we could write books about it.
  • The "iOS" perk ($1500) gets us the Unity Pro iOS and we can now go further, creating beautiful things on beautiful devices. They're quite a match, right? You get everything we said above.
  • The "Fan Pit" perk ($4000) you get a ticket to come and spend some time with us, we'll hand you all of the above when we meet and you can just relax and be a part of something great. Supernova becomes a real supernova because of you.

The Impact

I love great games. I really, really, love the feeling a great game can get you in. It's a one-of-a-kind thing to see yourself feel a moment in the game and observe what kind of gravity and grasp it has on you. I want more of that and if you want that too - join in, help out and let's make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign. You know some gaming communities? Push it through, let's see their scores. Have some people who love games for their plots? Supernova hides its plot pretty well behind a wall of enemies, but they can find it if they try.
  • Share via IndieGoGo, so that we are tightly networked.

More than anything else, please - enjoy yourselves and do what you think will make you enjoy your day even more.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi, I'm Miroslav and I've created Supernova in one day. You can play it here: http://supernova.pixelablaze.com/. 
Other than that, I'm a game developer, living quite happily in Serbia.
Now, this is my game but I want you to help it grow further, as it would very much like to. Now, what's the fuss? What is this game striving to become? Well, it can't be summed up in one word but the short description (...the intellectual mindchild it strives to be. Riddled with emptiness, piano chords and philosophy) is kind of it. You can play it with one finger only, but to feel it, you have to give yourself whole.



When I first made Supernova into a playable thing, I felt right about it and I continue to feel so. It's a fast game that you can play without thinking about it, but - it's also a journey through the void, where the enemy becomes uncertain of what and why you are fighting. I want to add to that: to add levels, vast spaces that can be explored; add size to depth, make it immense. Go play it for a while and then come back here to imagine a world in that space. Giant monuments of lost civilizations, scrapyards in the depths of space, the slow rotating and humming cycles of an ancient mechanism, lost to time. This and more, could be your work, if you contribute.
What We Need & What You Get
Supernova is made with Unity3D, the free edition. I went through a lot of trouble to make it look as wonderful (it does, right?) as I could, but it could be even greater. When the ships warp in, time-space could ripple, structures could bend space around them and a lot of breathtaking visual moments could be added. For this, I would need Unity3D Pro, which costs $1,500.
If I had to write it all down, the game would get something along the lines of:


levels - not just fully random blank space like now,
more enemy variations, 
more things to save your life,
a plot much larger than the 30 sentences,
epic scale of surroundings,
the full feeling of loneliness only space can bring...

If you really had to ask, I like to think of it as a little bit like Journey, if you were hunted down through space in Journey from time to time. Of course, it's completely different and is more akin to some minimalistic space roguelike, but the feeling is what's important.
The demo you can see now is the part where you are hunted, with limited storyline exposure and focused on battling through hordes of enemies. I can promise that the game wouldn't be based on this, rather using it as a shift in dynamics, from exploring to combat, back to exploring.
I'd want to do this full time and pay some people to do some fine art stuff, so the rest of the money would go into keeping us alive and well while coding and refining the details. I made this in a day, imagine what a month could bring you. Also, for those worried about losing this style: the concept of minimalism stays, it's what can be built out of that minimalism that's getting paid.
If the goal isn't reached, the funding is still going to this game, to try and buy Unity3D and pay some fine people less than they deserve. If, however, we get more, there's oh so much we can do:
Unity Pro Android costs $1500, so we could deliver this game to your android phones in all of it's splendid graphics and visuals that we can make with Unity Pro.
Unity Pro iOS costs $1500 and afterwards, your nice iPhone or tablet can enjoy some heavy-duty supernova experience.
The perks are made so that you can choose what you want to give your money to: if you'd want us spend your money on, say, iOS more than Android, pick iOS perks and we'll see to buy that one sooner and go with that. It's our plan to roll this game out on all major platforms and, let me tell you, it's much better to play on a touch-sensitive device.


Now, the perks:
Starter perks


The "I enjoyed the game, keep it coming" perk ($2) tells me that you've enjoyed playing the game and that you appreciate the time and effort. I say thank you, dear player and know that it will keep coming. For this perk, you get a personal thank you from me.

The "I want more!" perk ($10) is where it's at! You clearly want more and I plan to hold to that. A personal thank you from me and a free digital download of the game is what you get!



Intermediate perks



The "I WANT MOAR!" perk ($25) gets you the game, once it's out, but before anyone else. You get it and you're in it, and you get a personal thank you in the game, redefining your goals.

The "I WANT MOAR... on Android!" perk ($25) is exactly like the previous one, but it lets us know that you want your money to go into Android development.

The "I WANT MOAR... on iOS!" perk ($25) is exactly like the other two, just with your cash going to iOS development. Neat!

The "Vault" perk ($100) gets you three games, so you can give it to friends and spread the joy, personal in-game thank you (and for all you out there thinking about this - yes, that means that you'll all coexist in the game, in a way) and an additional level in the game. Every $100 given here add a very specific, not-as-random-as-the-current-random, balanced level. We love to create and you'll get us to create just oh-so-much.

The "Vault... on Android!" perk ($100) gets you the same, just that your money goes into targetting Androids.

The "Vault... on iOS!" perk ($100) gets you the same as the above, just for iOS.

Advanced perks


The "Philosopher" perk ($500) let's you get an all-you-can-eat of our game, to spread it as far as you can, an in-game thank you, a written thank you and a copy of the Supernova limited-edition Thought Book, which will have great in-game moments caught in snapshots, a lot of thoughts (obviously) around that, our thank-you's written all over the place, fine paper and ink, sketches, diagrams, ideas, well - just about everything you could find on our desks while working.

The "Designer" perk ($1000) gets you all of the above and more, giving you a chance to add your own idea to the project, be it a new enemy ship, new philosophical sentences or ideas, new levels or tones - you're in. Your signature ends up in the Thought Book, too.

The "Pro" perk ($1500) gets us Unity Pro, plain and simple, and you get everything. No, I mean it.

The "Android" perk ($1500) gets us Unity Pro Android and you get the same as with the above. You're great and you've pushed in such a great way that we could write books about it.

The "iOS" perk ($1500) gets us the Unity Pro iOS and we can now go further, creating beautiful things on beautiful devices. They're quite a match, right? You get everything we said above.

The "Fan Pit" perk ($4000) you get a ticket to come and spend some time with us, we'll hand you all of the above when we meet and you can just relax and be a part of something great. Supernova becomes a real supernova because of you.



The Impact
I love great games. I really, really, love the feeling a great game can get you in. It's a one-of-a-kind thing to see yourself feel a moment in the game and observe what kind of gravity and grasp it has on you. I want more of that and if you want that too - join in, help out and let's make it happen.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign. You know some gaming communities? Push it through, let's see their scores. Have some people who love games for their plots? Supernova hides its plot pretty well behind a wall of enemies, but they can find it if they try.
Share via IndieGoGo, so that we are tightly networked.


More than anything else, please - enjoy yourselves and do what you think will make you enjoy your day even more.

story:
Innovate's journey so far:

Innovate started as one simple idea, a dream of a game unlike anything we had played before, and has started to become a reality with the help of our team of enthusiasts, all working voluntarily towards making this game come alive; Innovate has grown and begun to flourish into a unique and immersive game.



Innovate's unique 3D physics crafting system creates a unique feel within the game, allowing the player to experiment with different materials, shuffling them around on a tabletop to craft some exciting tools and equipment. Throughout the game, your skills will develop and you will learn the abilities and skills needed to craft more advanced items with newer resources you have been able to gather.

Our free alpha demo is available to download at: www.ProjectKlowd.com

We recommend that you give Innovate a play and consider supporting our project if you would like take an active role in aiding the development of our game.

Innovate takes crafting to a whole new level. Our physics based crafting system allows for the intricate and realistic crafting you've always wanted from a game. Uniquely developed by ProjectKlowd, this never before seen system allows the player to take what resources they have gathered and then experiment and discover their applications using a 3D work bench interface. Using a variety of tools and components, the player can gradually build up their skills by crafting more and more challenging contraptions. Whether it's a chisel, hatchet or bridge, the planning and construction is all done via a 'hands on' physics experience.

                        

Choose your path, with a skill tree that will take you down one of many different career paths, each altering your gameplay as you train your skills in different areas.

As the player, you begin with nothing. Living out of a shed, you must gather basic resources and materials which you can experiment with, though trial and error. Learn and unlock the abilities to craft components using the unique 3D physics interface, and use raw materials to build structures in order to establish trade routes and open up a whole world of jobs, contracts and opportunities. While progressing and developing your skills, you will unlock and be able to achieve bigger and more challenging tasks which lie around every corner. You have one goal in sight, to become a Master Craftsman.  

Multiplayer gameplay will be available at a later date, to allow you and your friends to craft and build much larger items and structures on a grander scale. start with nothing and develop your skills until you build a busy town and expand into an in-game commerce system, where you can get paid for your work by in-game NPC's (non-player characters)

The Innovate team are campaigning here on Indiegogo to raise funds to develop our game, and these funds will allow us to pay for a whole heap more features that we can implement, as well as better software and hardware to aid with the development.

Innovate is being developed in the Unity 3D Engine, however we require Unity Pro in order to develop the quality of our game a lot further. We hope that Indiegogo can help us in achieving this, and allow us to get more professionals onboard with the team, to assist with specialised applications to get certain features implemented into the game.





What Is The Right Package For Me?

This all depends on how you feel about this project and its team. If you have some incredible ideas and concepts that would make this game truly amazing, and have found the same passion for the idea that we have, then naturally, we would recommend our top two packages. Although they might be a lot of money, these guarantee you some incredible creative input without the hassle of mis-communication and inbox pile-ups. However, we understand many people are unable to make such generous donations, so in that case, if you fancy some limited edition merchandise and a special in-game perk, then we feel that our 'Artisan' through to 'Mason' packages might be the perk for you! If you like the idea, but are a little unsure about making a major donation, then every £5 can go a long way for us. This will get you a copy of the 'Innovate' demo upon release, and full access to the game for you to play and review, along with all future updates. In many ways, this is equally as important to us. All of your feedback is read and acted upon, whether it's a bug or a suggestion. So whatever your choice, we thank you for your donation to our cause. All copies of the game will be available as soon as we release our first public demo, which should be shortly after the end of this campaign. Any other physical rewards will be with you as soon as possible after the end of the campaign. We will be sure to keep you informed via email of any other updates and details.


Why Donate?

With your help and support, we will be able to fully develop 'Innovate' to it's maximum potential. Here you will find a breakdown of how we plan to utilize the funding we hope to receive:

Unity Pro - This will allow us to use the unity engine to its maximum potential.

Adobe Creative Cloud Account - We will be able to make higher quality graphics, art and visual effects.

Hardware - Tablets, hard-drives, graphics cards and PC's, they all come with a cost. We hope to be able to fully equip our team with everything they need to make 'Innovate' an experience of the highest quality.

Dropbox Team Licence - Cloud storage enables us to communicate, store and transfer files to work more effectively as a team. This makes the movement of assets and files from one machine to another much faster.

Unity Assets - The vast quantity of unity assets available online mean that we can adapt and learn to improve the game for you. 

Eurogamer Expo 2014 - To make 'Innovate' a reality would be incredible, but to have it showcased at the UK's largest gaming expo in London? This would be truly phenomenal. It would be a fantastic opportunity for us to meet and have a chat to all of you, discuss your ideas, and for you all to have a play of Innovate.

Advertising & Marketing -  The majority of our advertising will be online. For this reason, we encourage you to play and record videos, show your friends tell them about 'Innovate'. However a percentage of our funds will go towards website advertising through platforms such as YouTube and other social media.

      


ProjectKlowd Game Studios:


'The volunteers at ProjectKlowd have been working together for the last two years. Innovate is the project we'd really love to bring to life. The one we want to become reality. Your donations will help us to not only achieve this, but will allow us to fulfil our dream: to make high quality games for the gaming community. Whether you're a 'Junior Craftsman' or a 'Master Craftsman', You can help us to achieve our goal' - Charlie Benson



Still Want To Help Us?

                                                                   


  • Follow us on Twitter: @AdamKarlFrancis @ProjectKlowd 
  • Share this project using the Indiegogo share tool.
  • Head across to our YouTube channels.
  • Check out our Facebook Page. 
  • Tell your friends and family about us! :)

story:
• New launch incentives! 

  • If we reach the $1,000 mark, the first 20 contributors of $20 or more will receive a Miffed Kitty Press T-shirt (mailed after the fundraiser expires).  ...and YES, that means contributors of the $50+ levels get 2!  REACHED!

  • If we reach the $2,500 mark, ANY contributor who donates $10 or more will receive a Miffed Kitty Press dog tag, for your neck, key-chain, or even your actual dog.  REACHED!
 

Everyone who donates $10 or more -regardless of whether or not we reach our goal- will get a 5 x 5 vinyl Miffed Kitty Press bumper sticker to show the world we appreciate their support  (mailed after the fundraiser is completed).  Donate $20 or more and get 2!   
  • _______________________________________________________________________________ 

  • We are Miffed Kitty Press, a collection of volunteer artists, game designers, and gaming enthusiasts with a simple but lofty goal:  To assemble enough talent and capital to create our own studio, and to release a game that will put us in the hearts and minds of fans around the world.  We have assembled a team of diverse talent, from a Dr. of music to professional game designers, all working hard on this "hobby project" in the hopes of showing the world a new and innovative gaming experience.  Projects of this scope take time and a lot of support, and we need your help to turn our dream into a reality.

 

Status Quo is a fast paced first/third person shooter using the Unreal 3 Engine; from the creators of the Status Quo: Chronicles of a Universe at War Roleplaying Game, Miffed Kitty Press ( www.miffedkitty.com ).  Status Quo: The Chronicle of Agent White will serve as an introduction to the series, allowing players to experience the story of one woman's fight to save a planet full of innocent people.  Status Quo features customizable single player, co-op and competitive multiplayer, leaderboards, in-game chat and mailbox functionality, and customizable multiplayer characters.

Status Quo was originally released by its creators, Miffed Kitty Press as a table-top roleplaying game available as PDF or in hard copy on Amazon.com in May of 2007.   The success of the initial release prompted Miffed Kitty Press to release the Complete Edition for free download in PDF in February of 2011.  The response was so positive, the creators of Status Quo were approached about the Status Quo Project and asked to produce a first playable video game to show potential investors that it could be done.  Now, we need help to keep the ball rolling, and to take this project to the next stage of production; a playable prototype that fans can truly get behind.

AUDIENCE

SQ is for players and fans of innovative science fiction, ages 13 – 60.  Our goal is to bring Status Quo to a broader audience, and generate enough hype to give the project momentum.  With help from your IndieGoGo pledge, we hope to make Status Quo into a working alpha, and pitch it to full investors that can help us finish the project and get it out to the masses.  As a standalone title we want to deliver a wide variety of options available to players for setting their own price-point.

THE GAME

 

In Status Quo: The Chronicle of Agent White, the player takes control of Agent Maddison White, a spoiled rich kid who ran away from home to avoid becoming her parents' idea of perfect.  After joining the Terran Defense Corporation, White becomes an agent trained to protect Humans wherever they colonize in space.  What she hoped would be a “blow-off” assignment becomes a tragic fight to save colonists under the threat of alien invasion; teaching her the value of Human life and her role in protecting it.  

What makes Agent White a solid leading character is the fact that she is an identifiable female protagonist, in the same vein as Buffy and other favorites, who is likeable, funny, and vulnerable; but strong and capable of keeping a world from being torn apart by alien invasion.  Her character will speak for itself, without the need for big boobs, skimpy uniform, or an over-sexualized persona.

 

 

While the game has strong elements of first or third person shooters, Miffed Kitty Press also wants to integrate a valuable part of the table-top gaming experience: the character sheet.  Known in SQ as the "Template", this aspect of gameplay has a striking impact on the player's experience and how they choose to play the game.  Players may adopt classes that make them a great pilot, a gun toting bad-ass, a medic, a leader capable of commanding “NPCs”, techs who are solid repairmen; or any combination of them all.  The Template allows for limitless replay value, urging players to think on their feet, and try gameplay styles they never would have considered in other first person shooters.  

There will even be a way to finish the game and save lives without ever firing a shot.


 

During the single player campaign players assume the role of Agent Maddison White, but this is only the beginning.   After completion of the single player campaign, other modes will be unlocked, along with another single player campaign that allows the player to assume the role of an invading Ji broodling (or one of her thousands of sisters).   Character customization becomes a vital part of the gameplay in multiplayer, encouraging the player to customize their “toon” for every match; changing load-outs or adding points to classes and skills they will need on the battlefield.  As the series continues, 24 races will take the field, each with new abilities, classes, and gear.

 

 

On the battlefield, a soldier itself is the best weapon; but it never hurts to have a lot of firepower.  Status Quo will feature dozens of weapons, vehicles, tool-sets, and equipment to further customize the gameplay experience.  Money will be earned in game by saving the lives of the colonists.  The more of them that stay alive, the more money the player gets to buy better gear.

 

 

Status Quo pushes the Unreal Engine to its limits, taking advantage of new features of the Unreal Developer's Kit.  Agent White and players of co-op or competitive multiplayer will have a huge sandbox to battle in, breaking down into over a dozen smaller maps for a variety of game modes and types.

 

DEVELOPMENT

 

Status Quo in its current form as a video game is incomplete, but it has the potential to become a groundbreaking single and multiplayer experience for a variety of audiences, from casual to avid gamers.  The Template System is in development now, and has the potential to gather a massive player community driven by bragging rights and collective accomplishment. Based on the Template System in Status Quo: Chronicles of a Universe at War, the integration of this stats, skills, and classes system will allow players to track progress, compare stats with friends, and improve their situational skills.

We intend to make Status Quo available on our website, as well as any other digital distribution platform worth consideration (such as Steam, etc).  This would allow for an ever growing community, as the player base grows and as the universe expands with each new title released.


PLEDGING

 

Your contributions will help pay for the following:

Continued Development: It costs money to keep a project like this going.  Contributions like yours allow us to keep working and moving forward on the SQ Project.  With your help, this one game could grow into a series that fans around the world can stand behind.

Software Licensing: Licensing isn't cheap, and we can only do so much with open source software.  We need the right tools for the job.  Considering the average cost of the software we use ranges from $700 to $7,500 per seat, we need all the help we can get.

Server Costs: Storage is important for development, and it isn't cheap. Once we open up for multiplayer testing, these costs will only go up.

Marketing and Advertising: We want to reach anyone who craves new and innovative science fiction gaming.  This means putting ads on websites, in magazines, and even on networks like G4 and MTV; and that takes cash... lots of it.

Legal and Accounting Consideration: We have to protect ourselves, and keep everything properly documented just as any other legitimate company would.

 

In the end, what we need the most is you. 

Up until now we have developed Status Quo using money from the sale of the original source book on Amazon, and from generous contributors like you.  These sales have brought us this far, but we still have a long way to go before our playable alpha is ready to show potential investors.  With pledge money received from  IndieGoGo, we hope to cover the various costs associated with creating a video game; from licensing the Unreal Developer's Kit and other software suites, continued development and maintenance efforts, and being a valuable member of our community by helping local artists to pay their rent while doing more great work for us.  We have delved deeply into our own pockets, and now we need a boost to continue making this project a reality.  

We know that our current goal will not even come close to allowing us to fully produce the game, but your contributions will help support this project and permit our team to have the tools necessary to continue forward.  Any amount donated in excess of our IndieGoGo goal will soften the financial strain on Miffed Kitty Press, and allow us broader access to more artists, tools, creative space, and hardware... Put simply, it will put food on artists' tables.  This IndieGoGo fundraiser is not an investment or charity.  It is an exchange: funds from fans for rewards from Miffed Kitty Press.  It's a great funding mechanism for indie projects: if we don't reach our financial goal, we still get to keep what we raise and keep moving forward.

Together we can accomplish what any single one of us cannot do alone.  With help from you and contributors like you, we can build a company, help artists and creative people feed their families, and work to produce something that people around the world can enjoy.

Even if you aren't able to contribute by pledging, you can help us out by showing support: Like us on Facebook!

Thanks for your time and attention.  Help us make this dream a reality!
story_txt:
New launch incentives! 

If we reach the $1,000 mark, the first 20 contributors of $20 or more will receive a Miffed Kitty Press T-shirt (mailed after the fundraiser expires).  ...and YES, that means contributors of the $50+ levels get 2!  REACHED!

If we reach the $2,500 mark, ANY contributor who donates $10 or more will receive a Miffed Kitty Press dog tag, for your neck, key-chain, or even your actual dog.  REACHED!

 

Everyone who donates $10 or more -regardless of whether or not we reach our goal- will get a 5 x 5 vinyl Miffed Kitty Press bumper sticker to show the world we appreciate their support  (mailed after the fundraiser is completed).  Donate $20 or more and get 2!   

_______________________________________________________________________________ 

We are Miffed Kitty Press, a collection of volunteer artists, game designers, and gaming enthusiasts with a simple but lofty goal:  To assemble enough talent and capital to create our own studio, and to release a game that will put us in the hearts and minds of fans around the world.  We have assembled a team of diverse talent, from a Dr. of music to professional game designers, all working hard on this "hobby project" in the hopes of showing the world a new and innovative gaming experience.  Projects of this scope take time and a lot of support, and we need your help to turn our dream into a reality.




 
Status Quo is a fast paced first/third person shooter using the Unreal 3 Engine; from the creators of the Status Quo: Chronicles of a Universe at War Roleplaying Game, Miffed Kitty Press ( www.miffedkitty.com ).  Status Quo: The Chronicle of Agent White will serve as an introduction to the series, allowing players to experience the story of one woman's fight to save a planet full of innocent people.  Status Quo features customizable single player, co-op and competitive multiplayer, leaderboards, in-game chat and mailbox functionality, and customizable multiplayer characters.

Status Quo was originally released by its creators, Miffed Kitty Press as a table-top roleplaying game available as PDF or in hard copy on Amazon.com in May of 2007.   The success of the initial release prompted Miffed Kitty Press to release the Complete Edition for free download in PDF in February of 2011.  The response was so positive, the creators of Status Quo were approached about the Status Quo Project and asked to produce a first playable video game to show potential investors that it could be done.  Now, we need help to keep the ball rolling, and to take this project to the next stage of production; a playable prototype that fans can truly get behind.
AUDIENCE
SQ is for players and fans of innovative science fiction, ages 13 – 60.  Our goal is to bring Status Quo to a broader audience, and generate enough hype to give the project momentum.  With help from your IndieGoGo pledge, we hope to make Status Quo into a working alpha, and pitch it to full investors that can help us finish the project and get it out to the masses.  As a standalone title we want to deliver a wide variety of options available to players for setting their own price-point.
THE GAME

 
In Status Quo: The Chronicle of Agent White, the player takes control of Agent Maddison White, a spoiled rich kid who ran away from home to avoid becoming her parents' idea of perfect.  After joining the Terran Defense Corporation, White becomes an agent trained to protect Humans wherever they colonize in space.  What she hoped would be a “blow-off” assignment becomes a tragic fight to save colonists under the threat of alien invasion; teaching her the value of Human life and her role in protecting it.  
What makes Agent White a solid leading character is the fact that she is an identifiable female protagonist, in the same vein as Buffy and other favorites, who is likeable, funny, and vulnerable; but strong and capable of keeping a world from being torn apart by alien invasion.  Her character will speak for itself, without the need for big boobs, skimpy uniform, or an over-sexualized persona.
 

 
While the game has strong elements of first or third person shooters, Miffed Kitty Press also wants to integrate a valuable part of the table-top gaming experience: the character sheet.  Known in SQ as the "Template", this aspect of gameplay has a striking impact on the player's experience and how they choose to play the game.  Players may adopt classes that make them a great pilot, a gun toting bad-ass, a medic, a leader capable of commanding “NPCs”, techs who are solid repairmen; or any combination of them all.  The Template allows for limitless replay value, urging players to think on their feet, and try gameplay styles they never would have considered in other first person shooters.  
There will even be a way to finish the game and save lives without ever firing a shot.


 
During the single player campaign players assume the role of Agent Maddison White, but this is only the beginning.   After completion of the single player campaign, other modes will be unlocked, along with another single player campaign that allows the player to assume the role of an invading Ji broodling (or one of her thousands of sisters).   Character customization becomes a vital part of the gameplay in multiplayer, encouraging the player to customize their “toon” for every match; changing load-outs or adding points to classes and skills they will need on the battlefield.  As the series continues, 24 races will take the field, each with new abilities, classes, and gear.
 

 
On the battlefield, a soldier itself is the best weapon; but it never hurts to have a lot of firepower.  Status Quo will feature dozens of weapons, vehicles, tool-sets, and equipment to further customize the gameplay experience.  Money will be earned in game by saving the lives of the colonists.  The more of them that stay alive, the more money the player gets to buy better gear.
 

 
Status Quo pushes the Unreal Engine to its limits, taking advantage of new features of the Unreal Developer's Kit.  Agent White and players of co-op or competitive multiplayer will have a huge sandbox to battle in, breaking down into over a dozen smaller maps for a variety of game modes and types.
 
DEVELOPMENT

 
Status Quo in its current form as a video game is incomplete, but it has the potential to become a groundbreaking single and multiplayer experience for a variety of audiences, from casual to avid gamers.  The Template System is in development now, and has the potential to gather a massive player community driven by bragging rights and collective accomplishment. Based on the Template System in Status Quo: Chronicles of a Universe at War, the integration of this stats, skills, and classes system will allow players to track progress, compare stats with friends, and improve their situational skills.
We intend to make Status Quo available on our website, as well as any other digital distribution platform worth consideration (such as Steam, etc).  This would allow for an ever growing community, as the player base grows and as the universe expands with each new title released.

PLEDGING

 
Your contributions will help pay for the following:
Continued Development: It costs money to keep a project like this going.  Contributions like yours allow us to keep working and moving forward on the SQ Project.  With your help, this one game could grow into a series that fans around the world can stand behind.
Software Licensing: Licensing isn't cheap, and we can only do so much with open source software.  We need the right tools for the job.  Considering the average cost of the software we use ranges from $700 to $7,500 per seat, we need all the help we can get.
Server Costs: Storage is important for development, and it isn't cheap. Once we open up for multiplayer testing, these costs will only go up.
Marketing and Advertising: We want to reach anyone who craves new and innovative science fiction gaming.  This means putting ads on websites, in magazines, and even on networks like G4 and MTV; and that takes cash... lots of it.
Legal and Accounting Consideration: We have to protect ourselves, and keep everything properly documented just as any other legitimate company would.
 
In the end, what we need the most is you. 
Up until now we have developed Status Quo using money from the sale of the original source book on Amazon, and from generous contributors like you.  These sales have brought us this far, but we still have a long way to go before our playable alpha is ready to show potential investors.  With pledge money received from  IndieGoGo, we hope to cover the various costs associated with creating a video game; from licensing the Unreal Developer's Kit and other software suites, continued development and maintenance efforts, and being a valuable member of our community by helping local artists to pay their rent while doing more great work for us.  We have delved deeply into our own pockets, and now we need a boost to continue making this project a reality.  
We know that our current goal will not even come close to allowing us to fully produce the game, but your contributions will help support this project and permit our team to have the tools necessary to continue forward.  Any amount donated in excess of our IndieGoGo goal will soften the financial strain on Miffed Kitty Press, and allow us broader access to more artists, tools, creative space, and hardware... Put simply, it will put food on artists' tables.  This IndieGoGo fundraiser is not an investment or charity.  It is an exchange: funds from fans for rewards from Miffed Kitty Press.  It's a great funding mechanism for indie projects: if we don't reach our financial goal, we still get to keep what we raise and keep moving forward.
Together we can accomplish what any single one of us cannot do alone.  With help from you and contributors like you, we can build a company, help artists and creative people feed their families, and work to produce something that people around the world can enjoy.
Even if you aren't able to contribute by pledging, you can help us out by showing support: Like us on Facebook!

Thanks for your time and attention.  Help us make this dream a reality!

story:
IMPORTANT NOTE (1):The $500 goal is not the money we need to fund the game. We set this as low because the game is almost in beta and we need your participation and support. Also we want to pay the lower possible commission taken out from our raised money by Indiegogo, but want to let you know this game has not received any kind of previous funding. Please support us also on Steam Greenlight, we need your vote to be one of the selected games to be published on Steam as soon as possible. Now we are getting less and less votes, because we are further from the home page!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

IMPORTANT NOTE (2): Darkout beta is out, if you purchase our game now you can access and play our closed beta through our game forums (www.darkoutgame.net).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

IMPORTANT NOTE (3): We are doing our best to keep up with everyone joining the forums and purchasing the game. Currently to gain access you will need to receive an e-mail confirming your purchase. We go through the list of new purchases frequently, but can't add everyone within 30 minutes of donating on Indiegogo. It can take up to 8 hours because the admin who can add your details to the server that generates your account and password for the game lives in the US and I am in the UK. We will get you access as quickly as we possibly can. :)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Hi, my name is Adrian Banninga, founder of Allgraf and Game director of Darkout. I would like to take a moment and tell you a little bit about myself and the team, and why we need your support to make Darkout a success.


Behind Allgraf, the name I used for my previous freelance works, there is a bunch of 9 people from all over the world who joined me on this project that I’m passionate about. All of them have been working for more than a year on Darkout with a royalty-based contract.

At this present moment, we wanted to start the sales for the game in its beta version on our website, because none of the team members have any funding and we need all the support we can muster from the game community in order to complete the game with as many features as possible for the initial release.

As you could  guess, we are not asking for a lot of money in our campaign, and the main reason is because money is not the main focus of our campaign. However, I have been working in this industry for 12 years, I have spent most of that time working on big budget games (UT2004, 007 Nightfire, Forza Horizon, among others) for big companies where gamers’ feedback is not really taken into account.

Here with our small and humble game Darkout we want to give you more than only a digital piece of entertainment. I’ve always wanted to let the community be a part of the game. The way to do that is by offering the chance to come up with new ideas about weapons and other new elements so that gamers can discuss them with the team. In this way we will be able to make the game you would love to play.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ABOUT DARKOUT

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Darkout is being developed by Allgraf, a new Indie developer founded by Adrian Banninga who has over 12 years of experience in the games industry, starting with the award winning intro for Gunman Chronicles. Working on many titles such as 007 Nightfire, Unreal Tournament 2004, and more recently Star Wars Kinect and Forza Horizon.

Pulling together a team of talented individual based all around the globe, ranging from experienced artists and programmers to new and upcoming talent as well as a seasoned Game/Hollywood composer.

The game is more than a passion for the team, and up to this point has had no financial backing of any kind, demanding over a year of late nights and sacrificed weekends for everyone. (our spouses and GF’s are not happy! those of us who have any left …)

You can learn all about us on our,
•Website.
•Forums.
•Facebook.
•Twitter. 
•YouTube. 
•Steam group.


To check out our press releases and previously published materials about Darkout, here is our press area.

Darkout has been featured in more than 30 sites from very different countries like Brazil, Czech Rep., Spain, France, Italy or Germany. For more details, you can check out our press appearances post in our game forums.


Platforms:
Darkout will be released for PC first and then Mac. We will port the game to Ipad 3 months after the initial release and if all goes well to Xbox Live soon after.

Note for people for those who think this game is a Terraria HD: 

It’s really hard  to create a new genre with every game you make. If you look around, you will notice that every innovation comes from a mixture between copying something that works well and adding some interesting new features that makes the game unique and with its own personality. Obviously we took some ideas from Terraria, as Battlefield took ideas from Call of Duty and vice versa. The difference here is that this game has been produced with 0% budget and 100% of passion, adding new features and with an atmosphere that no other game in the genre has at the moment.

story:
About Us:

     We are a group of people who loved to play a Minecraft gamemode entitled MCSmash which was based upon the game Super Smash Bros. MCSmash was made by Minecraft PVP (aka. Kookaburra Technology Inc.) , a minecraft server community, on February 12th 2013 and all of us at Smash PVP absolutely loved it! We had about 9 months of Smash, and we played and played for hours. Then in early November MCSmash was announced closed, it wasn't receiving enough profit, the main coder had left and it's player base was steadily declining. We were all so saddened. After a few days of the server being closed, Smash PVP was created, We are all the most enthusiastic smash players and really hope to bring back the amazing and wonderful gamemode once called MCSmash. We are now nearing the end of the coding stage and need your help to help us get this project rolling. All of the funds will be going into the server hosting and other things that will make the experience even better.

     I Harris Rothaermel (aka. 22vortex22) am the owner of Smash PVP,  I am a student but I spend most of my free time coding and playing video games. I was a very dedicated MCSmash player and I am still active in many communities. Helping me with this server are Peter (aka. WasabiLover), Clay (aka. VikingClay), Chris (aka. Cbenfie.) Peter and I are the main coders of the server. Chris is the social media admin who makes sure you guys always stay informed and up to date.Clay is the community admin, he deals with players, the forums and other things.  We have no other staff right now but we will be always watching for potential staff.


Smash:


     Smash was a gamemode made by Minecraft PVP based on the game Super Smash Brothers. The aim was to knock your competitors off the map with a range of buffs and a variety of kits. The more damage you took the farther back you would be backed up. You would keep on getting knocked off the arena but you would need to try and get back onto the map using your double jump rocket which is given to everyone. It was a fast paced, action packed game of you trying to knock other people off the battlefield but keeping yourself alive as well. We used to have tons of fun playing together as a community. We had separate teams and there would be tournaments. All smash players formed a family, the best family. We would spend hours of fun times together. You could become a part of this great community, made by the people who created the original one.

Progress:

     We are working very hard to get this server up and running as fast as possible. We will be making weekly updates to ensure you guys know whats going on and can keep track. So far we have made a lot of progress with the server and we are almost ready to release a Alpha version that anyone that bought the Alpha/Beta Tester or higher will be able to join and test out. We are also 75% finished with our spawn that our amazing team of builders are finishing up. Here is a photo of the spawn so far.

    More information coming in the next update which will be added every Friday from now on.  Also if you'd like you can follow us with our social media sites.

Perks & Ranks:

      In this section of the post I am going to be describing in detail the ranks and perks you buy.

Free Kit:

 

   When  you join the server or a code is sent to you, you will be allowed to pick any kit you like and keep it permanently. While the campaign is going on kits are 20% off then what they will be. Also as the server becomes more popular the prices are subject to change. This is a great perk to buy if you just wanna help out a bit and get something cool for it.

Smasher: 

  

    The Smasher rank is the cheapest rank you can get on the server. It allows you to join games when they are full,receive a lot in-game features such as more kits and get a lot of cool in-game aesthetics, for example a colored name, to make yourself even cooler.

Normally the Smasher rank is 5$ a month but if you buy it now and help fund us you will receive a free kit to keep permanently.

Brawler: 

 

     The Brawler rank is the mid range priced rank on the server. It allows you to have all the features that a Smasher has but more. You receive in-game aesthetics as well as cool features such as spectating.

     Normally the Brawler rank is 10$ a month but if you buy it now and help fund us you will receive a free kit to keep permanently.

Champion

This is the highest rank you can buy on the server, it gives you every in-game perk, feature and benefit we offer. You also get to try new and upcoming features before any other rank can besides staff.

Normally the Champion rank is 25$ a month but if you buy it now and help fund us you will receive a 5$ discount and you will receive a free kit to keep permanently.

Alpha/Beta Tester:

    You become of the few players that can test the server out before its released. This means you get to help us find anything wrong and things to improve. Also because you helped use alpha/beta test you will get a month of Champion where you get everything feature in the server.  Only 30 players can buy this rank.



Legendary:

    Legendary give you 3 months of the highest rank, Champion, which gives you all perks and features. Also you will be added to the alpha/beta tester list where you can join the server before anyone else can, where you can help us test and make the server better. You will also be able to talk with many of the staff and best smash players around. After that you will also receive all the kits we create and offer for free permanently. This is only limited since only 10 people can buy it.  

  Social Media:

Keep up and track with us by following our social pages!

https://instagram.com/smashpvpnetwork

https://www.facebook.com/SmashPVPNetwork

https://twitter.com/SmashPVPNetwork

https://www.youtube.com/smashpvpnetwork

story:
Short Summary

WhatUp Studios is a new startup owned by Michael Schijns. He left a long career "working for someone else" to start working on his passion and his hobby; programming and game development. Up until now, he has employed one university graduate and one high school student and has paid them out of his own pocket! 

Zombie Match is a casual play matching game designed with "old school" style game mechanics. It is a game where the player matches as many Zombies as required by the current level, swiping them away to gain points and hopefully clear the warehouse. Game level increases as you clear each warehouse and number of zombies’ increase as levels increase. Click on the random brains for bonus time.. 

WhatUp would like to continue it's operations, publish Zombie Match and start on the development of a new game!

What We Need & What You Get

$5000 is our crowdfunding goal. This will help WhatUp Studios take the business to the next level. Funding will assist in covering student expenses and allowing WhatUp to start on new projects. Funding will also help bring the current mobile game to market through the purchase of licensing and software. 
For you generosity, at each level we will include you in the updates of our development. At $50 and $75  you will recieve our WhatUp T-shirt available in Grey and White! At $100, you will receive a limited edition Zombie T-Shirt for contributors only! Only 20 are available. Furthermore, your contributions will be recognized in the game credits at two levels - contributor and the ultimate "Zombie Killer"!


Risks & Challenges

The mobile game industry is very competitive and challenging. Hundreds of new games hit the android and apple market everyday so delivering a creative, fun and marketable app is key. As we work toward this goal we will minimize risks through effective marketing and responsible development.

story:
Short Summary

Hi

My name is Chris a solo entrepreneur based in New Orleans. I honestly create a wide range of different things from Jewelry to Video games! Please do not let that give you the false impression that I jump around WITHOUT finishing my projects tho! ;)

My current focus and love is learning to and creating video games but as most indie game developers know. You still have to bills to pay while creating the game haha. Which brings me here. 

I would love to be able to just focus on actually creating something 24/7 which I can no do without your support!

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $19,200 and a year of your time!

$19,200 may seem like a strange amount but I'm only asking for enough to cover my essential bills for the year!

Me being able to focus solely on Glass Tower will allow me to give supply you all with a MUCH clean and polished game. Which I believe we all would enjoy!

Allowing me to come up with more personalized and creative gifts for supports! (Perks of being a designer of all types of mediums) 

 

Risks & Challenges

I understand that this is my first official game and people may think that I'm out of my depth. Promising things I can not deliver.  Which I totally understand. A year is not a long time when it comes to game development. 

All I can say to that honestly is to check out my track record and give me a chance! :)

Every past project I've started has been from absolute zero, but I still managed to deliver high quality products. With zero experience. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not afford to contribute but would still like to help. 

Just a like and a share would be all I ask of you!
